Description:
[FR] Bienvenue chez moi!

Salut, bienvenue chez moi ! Vous pouvez m'appeler Renn, je possÃ¨de cette instance que j'utilise Ã  des fins purement personnelles. Si vous souhaitez rejoindre le FÃ©diverse, essayez une des instances listÃ©es ici !

Je suspendrai sans hÃ©siter toutes les instances ou les comptes qui diffusent ou tolÃ¨rent, entres autres : racisme, anti-sÃ©mitisme, LGBTIphobies, sexisme, validisme, idÃ©ologie d'extrÃªme-droite, pÃ©dophilie, zoophilie... Et je vous prÃ©viens, ma limite de patience est assez basse pour ces choses lÃ . De mÃªme je silencerai les instances ou les comptes qui ne mettent pas d'avertissement de contenu sur leurs mÃ©dias pour le contenu NSFW.

Note : si vous estimez avoir une bonne raison de suspendre ou silencer cette instance ou mon compte, merci de me contacter par message privÃ© afin que nous puissions trouver une solution. Si j'ai dit ou fait quelque chose d'inappropriÃ©, je prÃ©fÃ¨re Ãªtre au courant pour ne pas recommencer plutÃ´t que d'Ãªtre bloquÃ© du FÃ©diverse. J'essaye au mieux d'Ãªtre un Ãªtre humain dÃ©cent, mais Ã§a peut m'arriver de dire ou de faire du mal sans le vouloir, comme tout Ã  chacun.

[EN] Welcome to my place!

Hi, this is my personal space! Please call me Renn, I own this instance that I use solely for personal purposes. If you wish to join the Fediverse, please check out one of the servers listed there!

I will suspend without hesitation any instance or account that diffuses or tolerates, among others: racism, antisemitism, LGBTIphobia, sexism, ableism, alt-right ideologies, pedophilia, zoophilia... Be warned, my threshold is quite low for this sort of thing. Moreover, I will silence any instance or account that doesn't put a content warning on NSFW media.

N.B. : if you think you have a good reason to suspend or silence this instance or my account, please contact me with a direct message, so that we can find a solution. If I said or did something inappropriate, I would rather be informed so that I don't do it again, instead of getting blocked from the Fediverse. I try to be a decent human being, but sometimes I say or do bad things without wanting to, as everyone does.
Short: This is my own personal instance. If you want to see who I am, please go there.

Description:
Pourquoi Guerdal HideOutâ€™s ?

Les rÃ©seaux sociaux sont devenus le moyen de communiciation de ce dÃ©but de 21Ã¨me siÃ¨cle. Sachant que, depuis longtemps, je prÃ©fÃ¨re hÃ©bergÃ© mes propres donnÃ©es sur mes propres outils, jâ€™ai donc dÃ©cidÃ© de monter mes propres instances Mastodon et Peertube lorsque ces deux logiciels libres sont apparus dans mon champs de vision. Elles ont pour but de crÃ©er des espaces fiables sur la durÃ©e pour hÃ©berger mes donnÃ©es.

Qu'est-ce que Mastodon ?

Mastodon est un rÃ©seau social dÃ©centralisÃ© et open-source. C'est Ã  dire que chacun peut crÃ©er son propre serveur, dans son Ã©tat d'esprit. Sur Mastodon il n'y a pas de pisteurs, pas d'algorithme, pas de publicitÃ©. Et il n'y en aura jamais.

Pour en apprendre d'avantage, vous pouvez fouiller le rÃ©seau.

ModÃ©ration

Sachant que cette instance est pour moi-mÃªme et peut-Ãªtre des personnes proches, on va donc poser les bases de la modÃ©ration que je mâ€™applique Ã  moi-mÃªmeÂ : les propos porteurs d'intolÃ©rance, de haine, et la diffusion d'informations invÃ©rifiables pourront entraÃ®ner une suppression de compte.

La nuditÃ© et la sexualitÃ© sont acceptÃ©es sous condition d'utiliser le Content Warning.

CGU

Hormis celles citÃ©es prÃ©cÃ©demment, l'instance n'a pas de rÃ¨gles spÃ©cifiques. Le droit franÃ§ais et europÃ©en s'applique ici.

HÃ©bergement & Financement

HideOutâ€™s est hÃ©bergÃ© sur un Beelink SER Mini PC chez moi-mÃªme (merci le FAI qui autorise lâ€™autohÃ©bergement). Le nom de domaine est dÃ©posÃ© chez Gandi.net. Je finance ces services avec mon salaire.

Bienvenue !

Si vous vous retrouvez dans ces quelques paragraphes, alors vous vous sentirez Ã  votre aise sur cette instance. En vous souhaitant la bienvenue !

Description:
The following rules were taken from mastodon.social:

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of social.lecker.coffee; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

In addition, we have silenced and / or suspended certain instances, using the list also used by toot.cafe, which you can see here.

Please see https://social.lecker.coffee/terms for our privacy policy.

Description: L'instance d'Inframed.net, premier hÃ©bergeur de donnÃ©es personnelles des membres d'inframed.net. Toutes les personnes inscrites sur cette instance font parti du rÃ©seau.
Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Before Joining

I recommend checking out one of the instances as listed here. I also recommend playvicious.social. I'm white, I'm male; by definition I will have prejudices, privileges, and casual biases. For integrity I think it is important that you at least consider the other instances first. If you still want to join me, I'll be happy to have you! Email me as linked in my contact above.

- Kevin H.

Code of Conduct:

Basically,

  1. Don't be a jerk

You are expected to treat both cybres and non-cybres with respect. Harrassment and slander is not tolerated, and exhibiting such behavior can expect reactionary silencing or suspension. Any cases of the following will be silenced and/or resulting in suspension:

  • Unapproved bots
  • Excessive Advertising
  • Untagged gore or pornography
  • Discrimination against peoplegroups (minorities or no)
  • Any means to stalk, harrass, slander, oppress, or intimidate other cybres or non-cybres, including:
    • Continuing engagement with a cybre or non-cybre that has explicitly requested to cease-and-desist respective engagement.
    • Any means of releasing or disseminating a cybre's or non-cybre's private data without express permission.
    • Impressing other cybres or non-cybres to engage in any such harassment or circumventing requests to cease-and-desist in proxy.
  • Hate topics including advocation of racism, sexism, xenophobia, or nationalism
  • Inciting content related to any of the above points

The Code of Conduct is not a legal document and is subject to the interpretation of the site administrator and instance moderators. On behalf of the federation, all such terms are entirely intended to be fulfilled. See the Mastodon.Social Code of Conduct, which has served as a basis for this Code of Conduct.

Privacy Policy

Please visit the Privacy Policy page for more information.

Cybr.es Moderation

We federate with awoo.space!

Instance blocking will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Due to instances typically containing like-minded non-cybres, blocking instances is not out of the question. A list of blocked instances is available upon request.

Community outside of Mastodon

  • Keybase team

Attributions

  • This Mastodon instance makes use of the Mutant Standard emoji set by Dzuk, licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Short: mastodon Instanz der d-hosting GmbH aus Berlin.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

This is a mastodon instance that allows users to share ideas and participate in discussions.

Why are you called Whitespashe?

Whitespashe is named after the admin's first coding project, which replaced spaces within a Word document with non-printable characters.

This would preserve readability, but would fool plagiarism detection sites such as Turnitin.

This site was named after this project, as it represents a desire to create whilst simultaneously sticking it to the Man (or in this case, the hellscape that is Twitter).

To pronounce it correctly, say it in your best Sean Connery impression!

Code of Conduct

  • Don't harass anyone
  • If someone is harassing you, report it to a moderator
  • Have fun
  • Be excellent to each other

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Understand that this instance is run by myself, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) I potentially have access to your data, including DMs.

For truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no end-to-end encryption. So use an encrypted messenger for the things you really want to be private.
Short: Whitespashe is named after the admin's first coding project, which replaced spaces within a Word document with non-printable characters, fooling plagiarism detection sites such as Turnitin.

GNU Natalie Nguyen

Description: An Akkoma instance
Welcome!

The following code of conduct will be enforced on this site:

  • All posts that are supporting or sympathetic to any group on the SPLC's "Hate Map" will not be tolerated.
  • Any harassment of any sort will not be tolerated. That includes homophobia, racism, misogyny, and etc. If you have to ask if your post is any of these things, then it is.
  • We federate with instances that have similar codes of conduct and block those that do not.

Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server
Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of grand-duchy.net; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Sex and gender discrimination, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
    5. Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
    6. Sex and gender discrimination
    7. Transphobia
    8. Misogyny
    9. Pro-ana / Pro-mia
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Luxembourg and/or Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
    4. Nazism or advocation of nazism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Users (or other servers) diffusing sexist, homophobic, racist, transphobic content, relaying insults or threats against a person or a group for their origin, gender identity or sexual orientation, will be blocked or banned on sight. Think twice if your reasons to be an asshole and harass people are "free speech" and "jokes".

Feel free to contact me or use Mastodon federated report tool if you happen to find such messages on this instance.

Description:
Guidelines.

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§

Avoid using microsoft email (outlook, hotmail, etc.) to subscribe

No proselytism of any kind. Regarding religions that seems obvious, but claiming that apple or microsoft is â€œthe bestâ€ is equally boring and useless. So, if you like to preach, then please get lost !

  • No bots allowed.
  • Crossposts/autopost allowed from your own website only.

No illegal content here. No pictures/speech that are racist, sexist, full of hatred (except if you donâ€™t like salsify, that I must admitâ€¦ ;) Basically, respect each other PERIOD!. â€œDonâ€™t do to others what you donâ€™t want for yourselfâ€.

Advertising for someone else than you or a relative is forbidden. I mean, the price of hoovers in some shops, one donâ€™t give a sh*t. Even if the matter of the advertising match the center of interest of a lot of users (ex: some stylus or pens are cheap in some store or other), please avoid to do that publicly. Use your email or the private message if you want to share that info. Advertising is not something that is free. Do that freely, and that is the same as giving away money for nothing (yeah ğŸ¤Ÿ) to companies that are already making a shitload of money at our expense.

Respect intellectual property and copyright. A picture/text/sound etc. found on the internet is not free until you see something that tells you otherwise. The default rule is : a content belong to someone, and you have to get an explicit authorization to use it (except if that person or entity agrees that every one is granted that right).

Even with that last scenario, you must mention the author when you post something that does not belong to you.

  • So, no AI generated "art" here.

Except for those things mentioned above, you are free to do whatever you like. Weâ€™re not afraid of willies in the wind or free breasts over here ! #facebookland. If you post something that is somehow mildly erotic, just remember to use the CW button (content warning) to prevent the â€œsensitiveâ€ users. Pornography's not allowed, even hidden with a CW.

One word of caution : avoid drawing kids and adults doing weird stuffâ€¦ and if you do once, explain yourself ! (if youâ€™re exposing sthg for ex.) On the other hand, if you are sharing an ancient piece of art, then that might be ok as it is an account of another age. But donâ€™t use that as an excuse to satisfy a weird hobby. When in doubt, contact the admin.

You may criticize as you like (I have said criticize, not harass or insult), and donâ€™t forget your right to caricature ! This is written in the law, so no problem with that too. (just try to have commonsense, I think you know what I mean ;)

And finally, please avoid violent images, etc. and all shit â€œinformationsâ€ that are widely seen everywhere. Iâ€™d like to keep a good mood on that instance, and I do not intend this to be a substitute for CNN or whatever.

So, ask yourself : â€œwhatâ€™s the purpose of me sharing shit/depressive information ? Is the world going to be a better place once Iâ€™ll have done that, or will there only be more depressed/sad people ?â€

If you saw the â€œinformationâ€ you want to share, thereâ€™s a huge probability that other user have as well. Actually, most people nowadays are over â€œinformedâ€ (with depressive/shit information I mean), and if anything itâ€™s difficult to avoid it.

My credo is simple : if you have negative information you can transform into good by providing a solution that everyone can apply, then share it ! Otherwise, donâ€™t (at least publicly), because it is kind of useless.

And most important of all : always check your sources !! Itâ€™s information 101.

Thatâ€™s it for now.

Donâ€™t hesitate to let me know if you have suggestions to enhance/modify this guide.

A special thanks to Ellora ! :)

ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·

Evitez l'utilisation d'email microsoft pour votre inscription (outlook, hotmail, etc.)

Pas de prosÃ©lytisme (quel quâ€™il soit). Pour la religion Ã§a semble Ã©vident, mais par ex savoir de qui apple ou microsoft est Â« le mieux Â», on sâ€™en tape Ã©galement, donc si vous aimez prÃªcher, allez voir ailleurs si on y est, merci.

  • Bots non acceptÃ©s.
  • Crosspost/autopost autorisÃ© uniquement depuis votre propre site.

Pas de contenu illÃ©gal. Pas de propos/photo raciste, sexiste, haineux (sauf si vous nâ€™aimez pas les salsifis, Ã§a je reconnaisâ€¦;) En gros, respectez les autres, et avant de poster qqch si vous Ãªtes Ã©nervÃ©, pensez Â« ne faites pas aux autres ce que vous ne voudriez pas quâ€™on vous fasse Â». Câ€™est un principe simple qui permet dâ€™Ã©viter pas mal de caca.

La publicitÃ© autre que la vÃ´tre (j'entends par lÃ  ni vos travaux ou bien ceux d'un(e) ami(e) ) est interdite. Par ex, les prix des aspirateurs chez telle enseigne, on s'en tape. Merci. Et mÃªme si le sujet peut Ãªtre en rapport avec nos activitÃ©s (par ex, telle marque de pastel en promo dans tel magasin), merci de ne pas en faire la pub publiquement. Passez par l'email ou les msg privÃ©s si vous voulez faire circuler Ã§a. La publicitÃ© se paye, la faire gratuitement revient Ã  donner de l'argent Ã  des compagnies qui se font dÃ©jÃ  une marge trÃ¨s confortable sur notre dos.

Respectez la propriÃ©tÃ© intellectuelle et le droit dâ€™auteur. Un(e) image/texte/son, etc trouvÃ©(e) sur internet n'est pas gratuit(e), sauf mention contraire. La rÃ¨gle par dÃ©faut est qu'un contenu appartient Ã  quelqu'un, et qu'il faut son accord explicite pour l'utiliser (sauf si la personne en question indique clairement qu'elle laisse le champ libre). Et mÃªme dans ce cas, indiquez toujours la source si vous postez qqch qui n'est pas de vous.

  • Donc ici, pas d'image/photo gÃ©nÃ©rÃ©e avec une AI.

En dehors de Ã§a, vous Ãªtes assez libre.

Ici, on nâ€™a pas peur des zizis au vent ou des paires de seins libres ! #facebookland. Si vous postez une illus Ã  tendance un peu Ã©rotique, pensez simplement Ã  utiliser un cache en utilisant le bouton CW (content warning) afin de prÃ©venir les utilisateurs Â« sensibles Â». La pornographie nâ€™est pas autorisÃ©e, mÃªme cachÃ©e avec un CW

Une prÃ©cision tout de mÃªme : Ã©vitez de dessiner des adultes sâ€™amusant de faÃ§on douteuse avec des enfants heinâ€¦ et si Ã§a devait arriver une fois, argumentez ! (si vous dÃ©noncez qqch par ex). Par contre, sâ€™il sâ€™agit du partage dâ€™une Å“uvre ancienne, eh bien câ€™est une Å“uvre ancienne, donc un tÃ©moignage dâ€™une autre Ã©poque. Normalement Ã§a ne pose pas de problÃ¨me, mais nâ€™en faites pas une marotte non plus. Si vous avez un doute, contactez lâ€™admin.

Vous pouvez critiquer comme bon vous semble (jâ€™ai bien dit critiquer, pas insulter), et nâ€™oubliez pas le droit Ã  la caricature ! Câ€™est un droit de la loi franÃ§aise, donc pas de soucis de ce cÃ´tÃ©-lÃ  non plus. (essayez juste dâ€™avoir un peu de bon sens hein...je ne vous fais pas de dessin ;)

Par contre, Ã©vitez les images violentes, etc. et plus globalement les informations de merde quâ€™on peut retrouver ailleurs. Jâ€™aimerais conserver une bonne ambiance, et nâ€™ai pas vocation Ã  remplacer LCI ou tout autre chaÃ®ne Â« dâ€™information Â».

Donc posez-vous la question : Â« Ã  quoi Ã§a sert de faire suivre une info de merde ? Est-ce que le monde sera meilleur une fois que je lâ€™aurai fait ou bien y aura-t-il seulement plus de gens stressÃ©s/malades ? Â».

Si vous avez vu/trouvÃ© lâ€™info, câ€™est probablement pareil pour les autres, et globalement la plupart des gens sont Â« informÃ©s Â» (de la plupart des infos de merde, du moins ). A vrai dire Ã  lâ€™heure actuelle câ€™est mÃªme plus difficile dâ€™Ã©chapper Ã  tout Ã§a quâ€™autre chose.

Mon credo est simple : si vous avez une information nÃ©gative, Ã  laquelle vous pouvez apporter une solution concrÃ¨te applicable par le plus grand nombre afin de la transformer en info positive, alors partagez-lÃ . Sinon, abstenez-vous puisque Ã§a ne sert Ã  rien !

Et surtout, vÃ©rifiez vos sources !! Câ€™est la base.

TOS

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§

  1. You must be at least 16 to use this instance.

  2. It is not mandatory for you to use your real name and surname if you do not want to, so you can choose whatever pseudonym you want, as long as it does not match a real person (famous) or a trademark.

  3. All contents that you post (or link) that are your property remains your property in every way. No use can be made of it without your consent by anyone. ( this is not facebook ! ;)

  4. This instance is not supposed to be a personal website/portfolio, so it is not a place to archive your works/pictures/etc. For this purpose, you should definitely get(or create) a real website. Mastodon is a social tool, like email, except that itâ€™s not used the same way. Even if some people are using facebook or twitter like a place that belongs to them, that is not true ! And a lot of them have had an unpleasant wake up call when they have been kicked out of the network for obscure reasons. Of course, I donâ€™t plan to kick anyone out, but I am not crash proof, so think about it. (Even if I have done my best to anticipate troublesome situations to be able to restore a working instance without too much pain ;)

  5. If you so desire it, you can join another instance at any time, export the list of users that you are following, and redirect your actual account to the new one. The redirection will be effective for one year only. After that period of tme your followers will probably be up to date so your account will be deleted.

  6. For now, thereâ€™s no way to export all the data of your account (if you move to another instance for example). The only thing that you can export is the list of users that youâ€™re following, and thatâ€™s it. I doubt that it will be available soon because it seems quite complex (logic wise) to get that working considering the very nature (decentralized) of mastodon.

If you move to another instance, your previous â€œtootsâ€ are linked to the previous instance, and so they canâ€™t fit on another one. It is a bit like changing your email address and asking all of your contacts to modify their archived email messages to match your new address. No can do !

  1. On this instance, the exif information of your images will not be stripped down, because when it comes to ownership/creator informations, stripping them down is like using an image editing software to erase a copyright note. If you do not want to share your exif information, you can always strip them down yourself, that is pretty easy (with xnview for example), or even better if it's that much of a concern to you: you can prevent the software/device to create them in the first place !

  2. Vous n'Ãªtes pas obligÃ© d'utiliser votre vrai nom si vous n'en avez pas envie, et pouvez choisir le pseudo que vous voulez, tant que Ã§a ne correspond pas Ã  quelqu'un de connu (rÃ©el) ou une marque.

  3. Tous les contenus que vous posterez (ou "linkez") dont les droits vous appartiennent continuent de vous appartenir quoi qu'il arrive. Aucune utilisation ne peut en Ãªtre faite sans votre accord par qui que ce soit. (c'est pas facebook ici ! ;)

  4. Cette instance n'a pas vocation Ã  Ãªtre un "site" reprÃ©sentatif de votre travail, et donc n'est pas un lieu de stockage pour vos travaux. Pour Ã§a vous devriez faire vous-mÃªme un site. Ceci est un moyen de communication social au mÃªme titre qu'un email, sauf que son utilisation diffÃ¨re. MÃªme si certains utilisent facebook ou twitter comme un site qui leur appartiendrait, ce n'est pas le cas.
    Nombreux sont ceux Ã  avoir eu un rÃ©veil douloureux lorsqu'ils se sont retrouvÃ©s bloquÃ©s ou Ã©jectÃ©s du rÃ©seau. Ici bien sÃ»r je ne compte pas Ã©jecter qui que ce soit, mais je ne suis pas Ã  lâ€™abri d'une panne, donc pensez-y. (mÃªme si j'ai pris mes prÃ©cautions pour rÃ©tablir l'instance sans trop de perte en cas de soucis)

  5. Vous pouvez si vous le souhaitez rejoindre une autre instance Ã  n'importe quel moment en exportant la liste des personnes que vous suivez, et rediriger les requÃªtes de votre compte vers le nouveau (pendant 1 an, ensuite le compte sera fermÃ© puisque normalement les gens qui vous suivent seront Ã  jour).

  6. Pour l'instant, il n'existe pas de moyen d'exporter l'ensemble des donnÃ©es de son compte (si vous changez d'instance par ex). La seule chose exportable est la liste des gens que vous suivez, et c'est tout. Je doute que cette option finisse par arriver dans un futur proche car Ã§a me semble particuliÃ¨rement complexe Ã  mettre en Å“uvre de par la nature mÃªme de mastodon qui est dÃ©centralisÃ©. Si vous changez d'instance, vos prÃ©cÃ©dents posts (toots) sont liÃ©s Ã  l'instance sur laquelle vous Ã©tiez, et ne peuvent pas "s'adapter" Ã  une nouvelle. C'est un peu comme si vous changiez de boite email, et que vous demandiez Ã  tous vos contacts de modifier leurs archives pour que vos emails aient la bonne nouvelle adresse. Ce n'est pas faisable.

  7. Sur cette instance, les informations exifs de vos images ne seront pas effacÃ©es, car lorsquâ€™elles contiennent des informations sur leur crÃ©ateur, les effacer revient Ã  Ã©diter une image pour effacer une signature. Si vous ne voulez pas partager les informations exifs de vos images, vous pouvez toujours les effacer vous-mÃªme, câ€™est trÃ¨s facile (avec Xnview par exemple), ou mÃªme mieux si cela vous tracasse vraiment: vous pouvez configurer le programme ou l'appareil que vous utilisez pour ne pas en Ã©crire dÃ¨s le dÃ©part !

Description:
Tootsite is a general instance with a focus on your safety. We have strict moderation and rules to promote accessibility. Tootsite is running glitch-soc!

Contact

Tootsite is administered and moderated by:

  • @alison
  • @cryptoxic
  • @ftw
  • @katnjiapus
  • @laughwhilecrying
  • @meave
  • @pikachu

Don't hesitate to say hi, or ask any questions!

If you see content that violates our rules, please use the report feature, or notify an administrator.

Most importantly, have fun and be nice to each other! Our main priority is to protect our users from the darker part of the fediverse. Thus, we employ instance-wide pre-emptive blocking and muting of users and instances that are in conflict with the rules defined below.

Tootsite will always go for the option that minimises harm whilst maximising freedom.

Inactivity

After a long while of inactivity, accounts are scheduled for deletion. New and unused accounts will be scheduled for deletion quicker. This is to enhance the privacy of users that may have forgotten they have an account. Remember to retrieve a backup of your data before this time as the deletion is irreversible. A warning will be sent out before deletion in case the user has just forgotten about the account.

Donation

You can donate to Tootsite to keep the servers running at Liberapay

Shoutouts

  • Mascot design originally by @Princesspeach and illustration by @Animerril
  • Instance picture by @ftw
Short: Tootsite is a general instance with a focus on your safety. We have strict moderation and rules to promote accessibility. Tootsite is running glitch-soc!

Description:
Private Instance

This is a private instance for cruisers only. The information we ask for during sign-up:

  1. name of your vessel
  2. persons living onboard
  3. current location
  4. who referred you

This information is only used for the approval process and is deleted after your account is approved.

Code of Conduct

GOLDEN RULE: Treat others as you would like to be treated.

In addition to the rule above, use the norms of common decency when interacting with others. Some examples include:

  • DO NOT sling personal insults.
  • DO interact as if you are speaking to others face-to-face.
  • DO discuss topics with intelligence, nuance, and reason.
  • DO supply references for information provided when applicable.

Unpopular Opinions

We do not believe in the notion of an accepted narrative on any topic. All opinions are permitted, provided you follow the rules and conduct outlined above.
Short: A social space for yacht "cruisers" living on the water.

Description:
About Toot Party

Last updated: 2021-04-06 09:35 UTC

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration and moderation of toot.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    3. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in France and/or Germany, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. The following types of contents are locally and remotely prohibited and will result in revocation of access to the service, cross-instance reports and defederation (instance block) in case the remote instance doesn't have rules or doesn't explicitely prohibit such content (whichever is applicable):
    1. Advocation and/or support of limitation and/or abolition of a group of persons' rights solely based on their sexual attraction and/or gender identity.
    2. Especially, advocation and/or support of limitation and/or abolition of LGBTQIA+ people's rights.
    3. Denial or implication of denial that LGBTQIA+ people are an oppressed minority.
    4. TERF (Trans-Exclusionary Radical Feminist) arguments.
    5. LGBTQIA+phobia
    6. Anything that is harmful to vulnerable groups of people.
  5. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Toot Party to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Toot Party from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Toot Party users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Toot Party users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Staff

  • @mashi - site owner, sysadmin and moderator

We're looking for moderators; contact me via the above email address if you're interested in becoming a moderator of Toot Party.

Credits

Blobhaj by Heatherhorns is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
Short: toot.party is a generic Mastodon instance open to queer people and allies. We are closed for registration and the instance will go down on the 1st of January, 2024.

Description:
Our code of conduct is pretty simple: don't be a dick.

Of course that means a bunch of different things to different people, so we may have to work out more specific rules. But really that's only necessary if one of us acts like a dick, right? So let's not do that.

#FediBlock is a source of blocks. In general, we will block instances that have overwhelming content in one of the following categories, or moderation rules that permit it:

  • fascists or nazis
  • CSAM, pedophilia, lolicon
  • homophobia, transphobia, racism; hate speech in general
  • misinformation, conspiracy theories
  • doxxing
  • trolling
  • spam
  • cryptocurrencies
  • "free" speech as a tool to push any of the above, or excuse for letting it happen (also: freezepeach)

Typically, this results in suspension (defederation, blocking). This is a tiny instance, and the mods can be quite decisive here.

We show blocked instances. If you find your instance there and consider this unjust, reach out - mistakes do happen.

Spam: nothing is wrong with advertising your own hard work. But doing so depends a little on style. Clickbaity LinkedIn-style self-promotion may get accounts limited, but not instances blocked. Other kinds of self-promotion are not considered spam. Ultimately, this is a judgement call, and depends on how folk present themselves overall.

Federation: instances may get suspended if they freely federate with other instances that are or would be suspended. Experience shows that such instances tend to quickly fall into the same category.

We've signed the #FediPact and will not federate with Meta, or any other GAFAM instance.

Journalism: journalism itself will not get blocked. However, some journalist instances run afoul of the above, and thus do get blocked.

Description:
Sound CafÃ© is een Nederlandstalige server, onderdeel van het Mastodon sociale netwerk.

Men kan hier over van alles en nog wat babbelen, en leuke meuk van elders op het Internet hier met elkaar delen.

Hoe werkt het?

Mastodon is een sociaal netwerk. Het lijkt een beetje op Facebook, Twitter, en Google Plus. Je kunt berichten delen met tekst, video's en foto's; en je kunt mensen volgen. Ook kun je bepalen waar, of aan wie, een bericht zichtbaar mag zijn. Het bijzondere is dat er geen centrale website tussen ons zit die alles bepaald. Het Mastodon netwerk is opgebouwd uit duizenden onafhankelijke servers die samen het netwerk vormen.

Tijdlijnen

De "Start" pagina toont berichten die met jou zijn gedeeld van mensen die je volgt. Je kunt mensen vanuit het gehele Mastodon netwerk volgen.

Wanneer je iemand tegenkomt of kent met een account op een andere Mastodon server, hoef je dus geen nieuw account te maken. Je kunt een ieder vanuit hier volgen!

Dit maakt Mastodon een "decentraal" open netwerk, te vergelijken met e-mail, blogs, podcasts, en andere open systemen. Je kiest zelf waar je jouw e-mail account aanmaakt, en welke website of programma je gebruikt om e-mail te lezen, en vanuit daar kun je dan met iedereen e-mailen, onafhankelijk van welke provider of welk programma de ontvanger gebruikt. Zo werkt het ook met Mastodon, en er bestaan dan ook verscheidene programma's waarmee je Mastodon kunt ontvangen op je telefoon. Je hoeft echter geen app, gewoon hier online inloggen kan ook altijd.

De "Lokaal" pagina toont berichten die "openbaar" zijn, gedeeld door mensen vanaf ons Soundcafe. Dit is een beetje te vergelijken met een ouderwets gastenboek, want alleen onze bezoekers dragen bij aan wat hier staat, en onze lokale beheerder(s) zullen indien nodig spam verwijderen of andere regels handhaven.

De "Globaal" pagina toont berichten vanuit het grotere Mastodon netwerk, inclusief van de duizenden andere servers, en ook in andere landen en talen. Dit is een beetje te vergelijken met een zoekmachine. Net als met zoekmachines, is elke zoekmachine anders. Onze "Globaal" pagina toont voornamelijk berichten van Mastodon servers waar Ã©Ã©n of meerdere van onze gebruikers mee in aanraking is gekomen. Ook kun je indien nodig zo'n server rapporteren, als het ongewenst gedrag vertoont zal het niet meer in onze zoekmachine naar boven komen.

Wanneer je op een hash-tag klikt, kom je automatisch op de Globaal pagina uit, met de hash-tag als zoekopgave. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld nieuws, muziek, of andere interessante berichten Of personen ontdekken.

Berichten tooten: zichtbaarheid

Een Mastodonbericht wordt ook wel een toot genoemd. Voordat je een bericht plaats, kun je de zichtbaarheid bepalen.

Openbaar
Overall zichtbaar. In Lokaal, Globaal, in zoekresultaten, op je profiel, en voor volgers op hun Start pagina.
Minder openbaar (Engels: unlisted)
Zichtbaar op je profiel, voor volgers op hun Start. In principe voor iedereen toegankelijk wanneer ze een link krijgen, bijvoorbeeld wanneer het via-via met hen is gedeeld. Niet in zoekresultaten. Niet in Lokaal/Globaal.
Alleen volgers
Alleen toegankelijk voor je volgers, getoond op hun Start.
Direct
Alleen toegankelijk voor mensen die je in het bericht met een @ apenstaartje vermeld. Getoond onder "Directe berichten".

Het is vaak de gewoonte om langere berichten, gesprekken, of draadjes, met de "Minder openbaar" zichtbaarheid te plaatsen. Hiermee voorkom je dat gedeeltes van gesprekken, of reacties daarop, zonder context in een openbare tijdlijn komen te staan.

Reacties op een bericht hebben standaard dezelfde zichtbaarheid als het bericht waar je op reageert.

Je kunt bijvoorbeeld als je meerdere berichtjes over hetzelfde onderwerp wil plaatsen, het eerste bericht plaatsen met zichtbaarheid "Openbaar" plaatsen en doorzoekbaar maken met een paar hash-tags, en dan daarop reageren met zichtbaarheid "Minder openbaar" voor de rest. Dan kan iedereen het draadje ontdekken, maar alleen het begin van het draadje komt dan in Lokaal en Globaal te staan.

Berichten tooten: CW-kopjes

Berichten gerelateerd aan politiek, en ander mogelijk gevoelige onderwerpen zijn gewoon toegestaan. Echter, is het de sociale norm voor zulke berichten de "CW"-knop gebruiken zodat mensen ervoor mogen kiezen wanneer ze dit wel of niet lezen, afhankelijk van hun humeur (voorbeeld).

De CW-knop kan ook in andere gevallen nuttig zijn, zoals:

  • Een bericht over de uitkomst van een sportwedstrijd.
  • Een bericht over de plot van een film of TV-serie die momenteel gaande is.
  • Verberg de clou van een mop of raadsel ğŸ˜ƒ (voorbeeld).

Waarin verschilt Mastodon?

Decentraal

Mastodon is decentraal. Dat houdt in dat er vele onafhankelijke servers zijn, die samen het netwerk vormen. Dit is te vergelijken met e-mail, blogs, of wellicht je eigen website. Er is niet Ã©Ã©n organisatie die eigendom heeft over alle e-mail, of alle websites. Het mooie is echter dat, net als e-mail, alle Mastodon servers wel elkaar kunnen vinden en herkennen. Dit in tegenstelling tot bijvoorbeeld internet forums of chatkanalen, die meestal "eilanden" zijn.

Het decentrale principe betekend ook dat Mastodon niet te koop is, en niet kan worden uitgeschakeld. Mocht een server eigenaar hun gaan server sluiten, kun je eenvoudig jouw gegevens elders naartoe verhuizen.

Jij doet ertoe

Elke Mastodon server beheerd hun eigen regels en antispam moderatie. Elk bericht komt het netwerk binnen via een server met meestal een kleine groep lokale gebruikers en een actieve eigenaar die verantwoordelijkheid neemt over hun "huis" en dit graag schoon wil houden. Wanneer er onenigheid is kan dit of worden opgelost door de eigenaar van de server waar het bericht vandaan komt, of als de servers andere regels hebben, kan een van de servers ervoor kiezen de verbinding tussen die twee servers te sluiten en iedereen verder z'n gangetje laten gaan.

Doordat er geen centrale organisatie is die alles beheerd, is het dus geen organisatie die genoeg winst moet opbrengen om de kosten te dekken van het runnen van zo'n gigantisch netwerk, en de nadelen die daarmee komen. Zoals een algoritme dat bepaald van wie je berichten ziet om betere advertenties te tonen, of berichten van volgorde veranderd of totaal verbergt zodat je meer tijd op hun site doorbrengt i.p.v. ergens anders heengaat, of die je persoonlijke informatie verkoopt aan derden.

Op Mastodon staan berichten gewoon in chronologische volgorde. Er zijn geen advertenties. Sommige Mastodon servers met duizenden gebruiken staan wellicht geen nieuwe gebruikers meer toe, of vragen eens per jaar om donaties.

Lees meer

  • "Mastodon", Wikipedia artikel.
  • Mastodon, de nieuwe socialmediasite, D-Write One, 2017.
  • Een snelgroeiend alternatief voor Twitter, iCulture, April 2017.
  • Lijst van Mastodon sites

Privacy

Deze site is gehost bij Masto.host, in Frankrijk. Deze site maakt geen gebruik van trackers of advertenties. Je kunt zelf eigen berichten verwijderen, en ook je account verwijderen wanneer je dat wilt.

Zie ook de algemene Mastodon Gebruiksvoorwaarden

Code of Conduct (English)

  1. Be excellent to each other. Have fun!
  2. No discrimination or harassment of any kind. We don't accept hate speech.
  3. No distribution or promotion of conspiracy theories.
  4. No distribution or promotion of pornography.
  5. No content that is illegal in the Netherlands.

This instances follows the Mastodon Server Covenant, and is hosted by Masto.host in France.

Description:
Rules Â¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Attribution Â¶

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This text is adapted from chaos.social and licensed under CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International).
Short: We provide a small community space - Be excellent to each other.

Description:
Netiquette

â€Fairnetz-Tipps fÃ¼r den respektvollen Umgang im Internetâ€œ

PrÃ¤ambel

"Das Internet ist eine Datenautobahn von unbeschrÃ¤nktem AusmaÃŸe, die keine Verkehrsschilder, Geschwindigkeitslimits und Vorfahrtsregeln kennt. Deshalb ist es wichtig, sich bei der Benutzung der Verantwortung und Vorsicht bewusst zu sein, die nÃ¶tig ist, um das Netz nicht zu einem rechtsfreien Raum werden zu lassen, der keine Grundwerte mehr kennt, sondern zu einem Medium aufzuwerten, das zur internationalen VerstÃ¤ndigung und interkulturellen Kommunikation beitrÃ¤gt."

1. Aktiv werden - Schau nicht weg!

Informiere dichâ€¦

SchÃ¤rfe Deine Sinne fÃ¼r fragwÃ¼rdige Inhalte! Diskutiere und informiere Dich gegebenenfalls in Foren, Chats etc. Wer fragt, fÃ¼hrt. Informiere Dich Ã¼ber die Rechtslage und Deinen eigenen Handlungsspielraum. Achte auf die Begriffe, die Du verwendest, klÃ¤re fÃ¼r Dich ihren Inhalt. Ãœberlasse anderen nicht die Deutungshoheit in der Sprache.

â€¦ und Andere, â€¦

Sei zuerst Lektor, und wenn nÃ¶tig auch Zensor. Fordere nicht nur das Verbot, sondern klÃ¤re auch auf. Sammle und teile Wissen. Biete Hilfe an und suche selber den Rat von Experten.

â€¦ denn jeder Klick, jeder Schritt, jede Stimme zÃ¤hlt

Schaffe alternative Angebote und nutze das Internet fÃ¼r globale Kontakte. Deine KreativitÃ¤t ist gefragt! Melde extremistische Inhalte bei den zustÃ¤ndigen Institutionen, z.B. www.jugendschutz.net (weitere Adressen, siehe Anhang), oder/und beschwere Dich beim Provider. Bleib am Ball! Hatte dein Handeln Erfolg?

2. Kontakt schaffen/suchen -Â  Nutze die MÃ¶glichkeiten

Verlinke Deine Seiten, schaffe Diskussionsforen, bilde Mail-Gruppen, suche Gleichgesinnte und handelt gemeinsam. Du bist nicht allein.

3. Achte den Anderen - der Ton macht die Musik

Gesetz im Netz

Was in der RealitÃ¤t Unrecht ist, wird im Netz nicht zu Recht. Auch im Internet gelten Gesetze.

Verhalten gestalten

Am anderen Ende der Leitung sitzt immer ein Mensch; behandle andere, wie Du selbst gerne behandelt werden mÃ¶chtest, bleibe fair und konstruktiv. Handle vorbildlich: Respektiere die Verhaltensregeln in fremden Foren und Chats.

GefÃ¼hle nachfÃ¼hlen

Versuche, Dich mit denÂ  Gedanken und GefÃ¼hlen anderer auseinanderzusetzen, auch wenn Du Sie ablehnst - bleibe selbstkritisch.

4. Werde Ã¶ffentlich â€“ sag, was Du denkst

VerÃ¶ffentliche, â€¦

Nutze das Netz zur VerÃ¶ffentlichung deiner Ideen, VorschlÃ¤ge und Projekte. Sei Dir dabei Deiner Verantwortung bewusst.

â€¦ rede mit anderen â€¦

Rede mit anderen Ã¼ber die Chancen und Gefahren des Internets. Tausch Dich mit anderen aus, das Internet istÂ  Deine Plattform Sei international Dokumentiere nÃ¼tzliche Adressen

â€¦ und bleib interessant

Sei konkret und beschrÃ¤nke Dich auf das Wesentliche Das Internet ist so gut oder so schlecht wie Du es (mit-) gestaltest Wecke Interesse

5. Sei wachsam- Unterscheide zwischen Schein und Sein

SOS - Save (y)our Surf

  • Verhalte Dich trotz Deiner scheinbaren AnonymitÃ¤t gewissenhaft und werde nicht unfair.
  • Stehe zu dem, was Du verÃ¶ffentlichst.
  • Sei Dir der Gefahren bewusst, die entstehen kÃ¶nnen, wenn Du Deine IdentitÃ¤t angibst.

Bleib im Hier und Jetzt

  • Nutze Deine Erfahrungen und Dein Wissen aus dem Netz fÃ¼r das reale Leben.
  • Hilf anderen oder lass Dir im Umgang mit dem Computer und dem Surfen helfen.
  • Verliere Dich nicht in der VirtualitÃ¤t.

6. Meinung bilden - Kritik â€šÃ¼benâ€™

Description:
This is a private server that is not normally open for public signup. Anyone who I know personally (either in real life or virtually) is welcome to ask for an account here, however.

We run the glitch-soc spin on Mastodon, which provides some additional features on top of the base version.

This server follows the Bill & Ted Protocol, i.e. "Be Excellent To One Another".

No kind of harrassment or abuse of other users, on this server or elsewhere, will be tolerated.

In particular be aware that posting content that falls into any of the following categories will result in a ban without any further communication:

  • Racism or anti-semitism
  • Sexism
  • Homophobia or transphobia
  • Nazi, fascist, or other far right images or content
  • Sexual content that is illegal in the UK

In addition any post containing sexually explicit or violent images MUST be marked as sensitive.

This server is hosted in the EU.

Description:
About

Just another Mastodon server to add to the #FediVerse!

agilodon.social Information

About

We are a community for anyone interested in the various aspects of lean and agile software development. Developers, coaches,even project managers all welcome!

What's with the dinosaur?

Just tryng to keep with the prehistoric animal theme here. Unfortunately there is no such dinosaur as an agilodon, so we co-opted the agilisaurus ("agile lizard") from the Jurassic period. See what we did there? Pretty neat, eh? 😎

Funding

This server is run on donations and goodwill, so please show your Admin (who is paying for the server) some love and donate a coffee sometime! Â£5/month will keep things running and allow server capacity to increase as needed.

Note: this server is being run as not-for-profit. So if there is any money left when it is end of life, it will be donated to a UK charity of the Admin's choice.

Code of Conduct

The code can be summed up very succinctly: "Don't be a d🤬ck" and "Be excellent to each other". But specifically:

  • Be kind
  • Be considerate
  • Read and follow the Rules!

Feel free to disagree on here, but keep things civil. No form of violence is tolerated. Nor will prejudice based on race, sex or religion. Failure to adhere to this will result in your suspension and ejection from the server.

Your Admins reserve the right to ban individuals and servers without warning as deemed necessary to maintain the Server Rules

Server Rules

  1. No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia or xenophobia
  2. No sexually explicit or violent media
  3. No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
  4. No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users
  5. No content that is illegal in the UK, or the EU
  6. Do not share intentionally false or misleading information
  7. The Admins are always right
  8. Always remember to be excellent to each other

Description:
This instance is friendly towards South Africans, anti-fascists, members of the LGBTQ+ community, activist movements, hackers, and anyone who understands the responsibilities attached to what they say. Anyone is welcome so long as they abide by the rules. This is not a free speech zone. What you say has consequences.

We do not federate with fascist/illegal instances.

Staff

Admins/Moderators: @bigfoot, @bongani

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM @bigfoot.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or deleting your account.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderator(s) judgment.

File Limits

Images have a maximum file size of 10MB and video/audio content have a maximum file size of 40MB.

Data Location

The Mastodon instance is run in South Africa. Content (uploaded images/videos) is stored in Germany, due to object storage pricing being too expensive in South Africa. Encrypted daily backups are stored in Germany as well. As more technical people come on-board, we may move the all data to South Africa.

Funding

The server cost is currently R20/month (when running exclusively from grid power), but most of the time, it is running off solar power. Content storage is 5 USD/month.

Shutdown Policy

In the case of a shut-down, all users will be notified at least three times via their registered email. If this were to happen, a minimum of three months will be allowed for migrations and exports to happen.
Short: LGBTQIA+ space for Joburgers, or other South Africans.

Description:
The rules of social media

  • Don't rage about something said by a person you've never previously heard of. It's almost certainly a straw man - an offensive and lazy caricature of a group of people you hate. It usually wasn't even real; just satire or a fake account to dunk on. In the rare event it was real, it's deliberately provocative to get rage-shares. Don't give them the attention they want. If you've never heard of them before, ignore it.
  • If you've already seen a dozen posts by different people taking the same stand, don't join in. The 13th post saying the same thing will not convince anyone. No one is taking roll call. You aren't helping, you are just mindlessly spamming.
  • Also don't rage post over something said by a person who has never heard of you and probably never will. Yelling at famous people achieves nothing.
  • No one posts as much as someone who just said they're taking a break from social media and not going to post any more. If you want to stop posting, just stop.
  • Don't hate on other people getting or having good things. Your envy and any actions you take on it will *never* help and will *always* hurt you and others. There are no exceptions. Especially if it's "not fair" that they have whatever.
  • How severely someone reacted to something is not evidence for how bad it is. "I'm scared to go in the street!" is not evidence the streets are dangerous. "Mayor asks famous doctor if Pong turns kids to zombies" is no evidence Pong can zombify you or that the doctor thinks so.
  • Whenever somebody's caught on video saying something awful their fans assert it's "deceptively edited". Don't just say that. Link to the unedited video & list exactly what was cut out that invalidates the rest, or you're just trying to pretend it didn't happen.
  • There is not one post worth sharing that begs you to share it. If it has to tell you to re-post or tag friends, it's not worth re-posting. Decide which ones are worth sharing yourself.

BeitrÃ¤ge, Folge- und andere Ã¶ffentliche Informationen: Die Liste der Leute, denen du folgst, wird Ã¶ffentlich gezeigt, das gleiche gilt fÃ¼r deine Folgenden (Follower). Description: Skew-T.com on the Fediverse!

What sorts of things is this instance for?

It is general purpose and you have the freedom to do what you want, assuming you doesn't break our rules.

Do you block Threads or the Bluesky bridge?

The Bluesky bridge is allowed, however Threads is limited because the entire business model at Meta (who own Threads) is built on collecting data, plus Meta have questionable ethical practices.

Where are you located?

This instance is currently hosted in the UK, media (photos, animations and video) are stored in the Netherlands.

What are the rules?

You will see the basic rules as you create an account.

Reporting to moderation

If you do send reports, please give multiple examples of the rule-breaking posts if possible and aim to give some context, particularly if the posts are non-English.

Depending on severity, the posts may be deleted or further action may be taken.

Reports to moderation are responded to as soon as possible, however note that there is no obligation to notify you about the status of your report.

Is it down?

The instance has a status page.

Description:
Welcome to SocialTurtle, a vibrant and inclusive Mastodon server dedicated to providing a safe and supportive online community for LGBTQIA+ individuals and their allies. Our mission is to create a space where users can express their unique identities, share experiences, and engage in meaningful conversations without fear of judgement or discrimination.

Our Community Values:

Respect and Inclusivity: We strive to maintain a welcoming and open environment where everyone, regardless of their sexual orientation, gender identity, race, ethnicity, or background, is treated with respect, kindness, and empathy.

Safe Space: We enforce a strict zero-tolerance policy towards hate speech, harassment, and any form of discrimination. Our moderation team works diligently to ensure our community remains a safe and supportive space for all members.

Privacy and Consent:

We respect the privacy of our users and encourage members to practice consent when sharing personal information or engaging in discussions with others. Positivity and Support: Our community is a space for celebrating diversity and fostering connections. We encourage members to uplift one another, share resources, and create lasting friendships.

Features of SocialTurtle:

Custom Emojis: Express yourself with our collection of LGBTQIA+ themed emojis, carefully curated to reflect the diverse identities within our community.

Content Warnings: Utilize the content warning feature to ensure sensitive topics are discussed respectfully and responsibly.

Local and Federated Timelines: Connect with members within our server or explore posts from other Mastodon servers in the wider fediverse.

Privacy Settings: Tailor your privacy settings to control who can see your posts and interact with you, providing a personalized and secure experience.

Join our colorful and supportive community today and discover a safe haven where you can be your true self. Let's make SocialTurtle a place where everyone can thrive together! ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ
Short: Join SocialTurtle, a friendly Mastodon server promoting inclusivity and support for LGBTQIA+ individuals and allies in a safe, vibrant space.

Description: Eragon personal instance in the fediverse

Here are some common-sense rules that will help you steer clear of trouble:

Harmful or dangerous content

Don't post videos that encourage others to do things that might cause them to get badly hurt, especially children. Videos showing such harmful or dangerous acts may be age-restricted or removed depending on their severity.

Copyright

Respect copyright. Only upload videos that you made or that you're authorised to use. Don't upload videos that you didn't make, or use content in your videos that someone else owns the copyright to, such as music tracks, snippets of copyrighted programmes or videos made by other users, without the necessary authorizations.

Threats

Things like predatory behaviour, stalking, threats, harassment, intimidation, invading privacy, revealing other people's personal information and inciting others to commit violent acts or to violate the Terms of Use are taken very seriously. Anyone caught doing these things may be permanently banned from Streamz.

Nudity or sexual content

Streamz is not for pornography or sexually explicit content. If this describes your video, even if it's a video of yourself, don't post it on Streamz. Also, please be advised that we work closely with law enforcement agencies and that we report child exploitation.

Violent or graphic content

It's not acceptable to post violent or gory content that is primarily intended to be shocking, sensational or disrespectful. If you post graphic content in a news or documentary context, please provide enough information to help people understand what's going on in the video. Don't encourage others to commit specific acts of violence.

Hateful content

Our products are platforms for free expression. However, we don't support content that promotes or condones violence against individuals or groups based on race or ethnic origin, religion, disability, gender, age, nationality, veteran status or sexual orientation/gender identity, or whose primary purpose is inciting hatred on the basis of these core characteristics. This can be a delicate balancing act, but if the primary purpose is to attack a protected group, the content crosses the line.

Spam, misleading meta-data and scams

Everyone hates spam. Don't create misleading descriptions, tags, titles or thumbnails in order to increase views. It's not acceptable to post large amounts of untargeted, unwanted or repetitive content, including comments and private messages.

Description:
Code of Conduct / Rules

  • No advertising or excessive promotion.
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography.
  • No gore or graphic violence.
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning).
  • No racism.
  • No sexism.
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin.
  • No xenophobia, nationalism, casteism, or fascism; no sympathizing with or advocating for these things.
  • No sexual depictions of children.
  • No holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of National Socialism.
  • No stalking or harassment. In general, if someone asks you to stop interacting with them, then stop.
  • Stalking, harassment, hate speech, or doxing that is posted to other instances or on other social media platforms is still grounds for having your account terminated here.
  • No posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information ("doxing").
  • No unwelcome sexual attention.
  • No public or private oppressive language or actions.
  • No promotion of conspiracy theories (eg anti-vax, anti-mask, anti-COVID).
  • No unsolicited advice to strangers.
  • No advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviour.
  • No other unethical conduct.
  • No scraping content from web interface or API.

To protect the free speech of users belonging to marginalized groups, mastodon.wormhole.eu does not federate with overtly fascist instances. Additionally, we will refuse to federate with instances that themselves choose to federate with fascist instances.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM allspark.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your serviceâ€¦ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!) Similarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

More privacy measures on mastodon.wormhole.eu:

  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.
  • Understand though that this instance is run by @allspark, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) he potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also, for truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. So use Signal for the things you really want to be private.

credit: mastodon.technlogy Code-Of-Conduct

Description:
Unsere Regeln/Our guidelines

English version below

Es gibt Regeln. Auch hier. Dies ist eine private Mastodon-Instanz, auf der wir von unseren GÃ¤sten gutes Benehmen und respektvollen Umgang erwarten. Daher behalten wir uns auch vor, GÃ¤sten die sich nicht an diese Regeln halten, vor die TÃ¼r zu setzen.

Die folgenden Richtlinien sind nicht rechtlich bindend, und die Auslegung der Richtlinien liegt bei social.gunju.de und den entsprechenden Administratoren. Sie geben einen Einblick, wie wir den Server moderieren:

Folgende Inhalte werden ohne Warnung entfernt:

  • Ausufernde Werbung
  • Bot-Spam
  • Nicht gekennzeichnete Pornographie, inklusive kÃ¼nstlerische Darstellungen von Nacktheit
  • Nicht getaggte Darstellung von Gewalt und gewaltverherrlichende Medien

    • Die folgenden Inhalte werden entfernt und kÃ¶nnen zu einem temporÃ¤ren oder permanenten Ban fÃ¼hren:

    • Rassismus
    • Sexismus
    • Diskriminierung von Personengruppen
    • Xenophobische Inhalte und gewaltverherrlichender Nationalismus

    Die folgenden Inhalte sind verboten und fÃ¼hren einen sofortigen, permanenten Ban nach sich:

    • Sexuelle Darstellungen, die Kinder bzw. MinderjÃ¤hrige beinhalten
    • Inhalte die in Deutschland illegal sind, insbesondere Holocaust-Verleugnung und Verherrlichung des Nationalsozialismus

    Folgendes Verhalten ist verboten:

    Jegliches Verhalten das andere Benutzer der Plattform in irgendeiner Art und Weise mobbt, verunglimpft oder beleidigt, oder die Funktionsweise der Plattform einschrÃ¤nkt oder verlangsamt. Dies kan zu einem vorÃ¼bergehenden oder permanenten Ban des verantwortlichen Nutzers fÃ¼hren.

    Dazu gehÃ¶ren unter anderem:

    • Einen anderen Benutzer kontinuierlich weiter mit Nachrichten zu belÃ¤stigen, obwohl dieser ausdrÃ¼cklich klargemacht hat, dass er nicht weiter kontaktiert werden mÃ¶chte, unabhÃ¤ngig von den eingesetzten Schutzmechanismen, die von der Plattform bereitgestellt werden.>/li>
    • Das Recherchieren und insbesondere VerÃ¶ffentlichen von personenbezogenen Daten und das Posten dieser Daten auf der Plattform (Doxing).
    • Aufrufen von anderen Benutzern, um einen bestimmten Benutzer gezielt mit Nachrichten oder Kontaktaufnahme in jeglicher Art zu belÃ¤stigen (Dogpiling).
    Abgesehen von den vorangegangenen Beispielen erlaubt sich das Administratoren-Team, im Zweifelsfall jedem Benutzer ohne Angabe von GrÃ¼nden den Zugang zur Plattform zu entziehen.

    English version: Our Guidelines

    There are rules. Even here. As this is a private mastodon instance, we expect our guests to follow common manners and be respectful with each other. Thus, we also reserve the right to exclude guests from thsi instance who don't comply with these rules.

    The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodogs.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

    The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

    • Excessive advertising
    • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

    The following types of content will be removed and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

    • Racism or advocation of racism
    • Sexism or advocation of sexism
    • Discrimination against gender and minorities, or advocation thereof
    • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

    The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

    • Sexual depictions of children
    • Content illegal in Germany such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

    The following behaviour is further disallowed

    Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service.

    This includes, but is not limited to the following behaviors:

    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
    These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

NOT ALLOWED AND NOT ACCEPTED IN THIS INSTANCE:
- Harassment, stalking, doxxing and other bullying practices;
- Advocacy of hateful and discriminatory practices such as (but not limited to) racism, sexism, fatphobia, xenophobia, queermisia, ableism;
- Violent nationalist propaganda/discourse, Nazi/fascist symbolism/discourse and/or promoting the ideologies of National Socialism, White Supremacism, Anarchocapitalism and other kinds of fascism;
- Disrespecting consent or lack thereof;
- Dogpiling/brigading;
- Untagged/unwarned sexual or violent content;
- Untagged, automated or excessive advertisement;
- Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests;
- NFTs, crypto-pushing and other kinds of fraudulent techbro schemes;
- "Free Speech extremism" discourse.
THIS MEANS THIS INSTANCE DOES NOT/WILL NOT FEDERATE WITH INSTANCES THAT ALLOW/PROMOTE ANY OF THE THINGS MENTIONED ABOVE.

Description:
Server FAQ

Who runs this server?
This Mastodon instance is run by Matt Muller, a cybersecurity nerd who is also passionate about decentralization.

Where is the server hosted?
The server itself is hosted on DigitalOcean infrastructure in the United States, and is proxied by Cloudflare.

Why did you set up a Mastodon server?
This server started as a personal experiment, but with so many users migrating off of Twitter, I decided to make it available to everyone to provide more options for exploring the Fediverse and help ease some of the registration load for other servers.

How do I know this server won't disappear on me?
Well, you don't, really. It's run by one person (me). However, assuming I don't get hit by a bus, I'm committed to keeping the server fully functional and regularly updated through December 31, 2023. If I decide to shut it down, I'll give you at least 30 days notice to transfer your account to another server.
Short: A (safe and lightly curated) place to get started in the Fediverse.
This is only ever intended as a personal instance ... which may not be the right way to use Mastodon. Time may tell

Description: a small node for a few people

Welcome to the Horrific.Dev Mastodon instance!

Horrific.Dev is a tiny software community that likes to break things. We hope to create a fun place for people to build and discuss cool software while acknowledging the common shortcomings of the tech industry at scale.

This server uses the glitch-soc fork of Mastodon.

Privacy Notes

While we do our best to protect user data, please be aware that Mastodon does not (yet?) support end-to-end encryption. Any post, content, or direct message on this server might be made visible to the admins of this server, any server it is sent to, and anyone in-between.

Code of Conduct

This is a summary of the Horrific.Dev code of conduct, based on the Contributor Covenant, which includes a lot more detail than what is explained below:

In short, the following is a list of activities / language that will not be tolerated here:

  • malicious comments about race, ethnicity, gender, or religion
  • xenophobic/violent nationalism
  • general bigotry or harassment
  • implicit or explicit advocacy for any of the above

Instances of such behavior can be reported by contacting @fennifith, me@jfenn.me, or any other moderator on this instance. All instances will be reviewed and will receive an appropriate response. Moderators are required to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Short: A tiny Mastodon instance for Horrific.Dev and friends :3

Description: Gidi's personal Zap server

Code of Conduct

"Don't be dick." This should be enough of a warning, but if not, you will be banned. My moderation time and availability is limited and I'd rather be spending it on helping this instance be protected from external sources rather than having to deal with users here.

Longevity

At the time of writing, this Mastodon instance is a hobby project. If you're concerned about the server failing and maybe not coming back with your account; that's a good mindset, it could happen. That's just the blunt reality of a personal project like this.
