Description:
Was ist "Mastodon" und der Zweck dieses Servers

Mastodon ist ein Verbund aus unabhÃ¤ngigen und freien Servern, welche den Nutzern eine Microblogging-Plattform bieten, die im Grunde Twitter sehr Ã¤hnlich ist.
Ein Posting, hier "Toot" oder "TrÃ¶t" genannt, kann maximal 500 Zeichen und bis zu 4 Medien (Bilder, Videos) beinhalten.

Hierbei kÃ¶nnen die Nutzer anderen Nutzern folgen, kommentieren (Reply) oder die Posts (Toots) teilen ("boosten"). Auch private Nachrichten zwischen den Nutzern sind mÃ¶glich.

Wer kann mitmachen?

Mitmachen kann jeder - die Registrierung auf diesem Server ist aber primÃ¤r fÃ¼r Familienmitglieder, Freunde und Freunde von Freunden gedacht. Bei der Registrierung wird im Feld "Warum mÃ¶chtest Du beitreten" daher um eine kurze Vorstellung gebeten, die verifiziert wird, bevor Du freigeschaltet wirst. Die bestehenden Nutzer dieses Servers kÃ¶nnen alternativ auch direkte Einladungslinks verschicken.

Im weitesten Sinne aber kann jeder die Posts teilen und kommentieren. Besucher sind herzlich willkommen! Es gibt eine Vielzahl von Ã¶ffentlichen Mastodon-Servern, wo sich jeder registrieren kann. FÃ¼r eine Auswahl schaut bitte hier.

Konzept und Bedienung

Die Plattform hat eine extreme Ã„hnlichkeit mit Twitter und ist sehr leicht zu bedienen. Wer auf Twitter aktiv ist, sollte sich sofort auskennen.
Jeder, der sich registriert, kann jedem Anderen hier "folgen", kann alles kommentieren und eigene Posts (hier "Toot" oder "TrÃ¶t" genannt) verfassen.
Mit der weltweit eindeutigen Mastodon-Kennung "@username@majak.de" kÃ¶nnt Ihr sofort am weltweiten Mastodon-Netzwerk teilnehmen.
Einfach heiÃŸt auch: Keine Formatierung, keine Schriftarten, kein komplizierter Editor. Maximal 500 Zeichen und 4 AnhÃ¤nge (Bilder, Videos) pro Post. Hashtags sind ausdrÃ¼cklich erwÃ¼nscht. Links ebenfalls, diese werden als Vorschau dargstellt. Also quasi: Schreiben, absenden und fertig.
Und obwohl sich die Seite auch auf dem Handybrowser extrem gut bedienen lÃ¤sst, gibt es hervorragende Apps fÃ¼r Android und IOS, welche Euch auf Wunsch auch eine Nachricht schicken, wenn es in Eurem Dunstkreis etwas Neues gibt. Eine Auswahl ist hier zu finden. (Ich persÃ¶nlich mag "Toot!" fÃ¼r IOS ... kostet zwar und ist aktuell nur in englischer App-Sprache ... ich finde die App aber wirklich Klasse)

Habe ich dann eine Art Homepage?

Im eigentlichen Sinne - ja. Unter "https://majak.de/@username" ist Dein Ã¶ffentliches Profil, mit Deinem Profil- und Titelbild und allen "Toots" (Postings), die Du Ã¶ffentlich verfasst hast. Und den dazugehÃ¶rigen Kommentaren, sofern es welche gibt.
Hier kannst Du also Deine Gedanken und Bilder in die Welt tragen, ohne Angst haben zu mÃ¼ssen, dass diese zweckentfremdet werden oder fÃ¼r "wer-weiss-was" verwendet werden.

Wieso gibt es diesen Server?

Eigentlich lag auf "majak.de" mal meine Homepage. Aber alle paar Wochen mal einen Artikel schreiben, da fragt man sich dann schon mal: WorÃ¼ber und warum. Ein Dreizeiler auf einer Homepage sieht armselig aus, fÃ¼r lange Artikel reicht die Zeit nicht - und so endete es mit einer verwaisten Homepage.

Das Konzept von Twitter ist eigentlich sehr gut: Man teilt News und verfasst lieber kleine BeitrÃ¤ge - dafÃ¼r Ã¶fter, schickt mal eben ein Bild in die Welt - und das ganz unkompliziert auch vom Handy aus.

Jetzt kommt das "Aber": Ich mag die zentralisierten Dienste wie Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc. immer weniger. Meine Fotos werden irgendwo gespeichert, gescannt, bewertet ... und gehÃ¶ren irgendwie nicht mir. Genausowenig wie meine Gedanken. Und damit nicht genug: Man wird zwischen den BeitrÃ¤gen immer mehr mit doofer Werbung zugeballert. Von irgendwas mÃ¼ssen die ja leben: Meine Daten, Gedanken und Fotos fÃ¼r den Profit der Konzerne und personalisierte Werbung an jeder Ecke. "1984" war Kindergarten dagegen.

Die sich entwickelnde Parallelwelt ist ein geniales Konzept: Menschen, die ihre Zeit und Ideen dafÃ¼r opfern, hierzu eine Alternative zu schaffen. Open-Source und "kostenlos", als Entwicklung der Gemeinschaft und nur von Spenden lebend.
Plattformen, die von normalen Leuten auf ihren Servern betrieben werden, die Daten nur auf beteiligten Servern vorgehalten. Kein Tracking, keine Werbung. Und trotzdem kann jeder mit jedem interagieren - auch wenn der Andere einen ganz anderen Server nutzt.

Seit 2 Jahren kommunizieren wir familienintern und darÃ¼ber hinaus mit Matrix/Riot als sichere, verschlÃ¼sselte Alternative zu WhatsApp und Co. Inzwischen nutzt sogar die franzÃ¶sische Regierung diese LÃ¶sung fÃ¼r die interne Kommunikation.
Nun gibt es Mastodon als dezentrale Twitter-Alternative, die auf eigenen Servern betrieben werden kann, und die zudem eine ideale "Microblogging-Homepage" fÃ¼r die Nutzer eines Servers ist. Mit Pixelfed steht eine Instagram-Alternative in den StartlÃ¶chern - die allerdings meiner EinschÃ¤tzung nach noch ca. 6 Monate "reifen" muss ... welche ich mir dann allerdings ebenfalls genauer ansehe. Es bleibt also spannend!

SchluÃŸwort und Datenschutz

Wir stehen fÃ¼r den demokratischen Grundgedanken der freien MeinungsÃ¤uÃŸerung, daher darf jeder seine Meinung auf seinem Account frei kund tun. Jedes Mitglied unserer Instanz darf seinen Account natÃ¼rlich uneingeschrÃ¤nkt im weltweiten Mastodon-Netzwerk nutzen, so wie er es auch mit seinem persÃ¶nlichen Facebook- oder Twitter-Account darf.

Keinen SpaÃŸ verstehen wir bei allerdings bei gesetzeswidriger Verwendung, welche eine dauerhafte Sperre nach sich zieht!

Wenn Ihr hierzu noch Fragen habt, kÃ¶nnt ihr diese gerne auch persÃ¶nlich per eMail an mich stellen. Ansonsten sehen wir uns hoffentlich hier :)

Mastodon-Twitter-Bridge

Wer (noch oder absichtlich) beide Welten nutzt - Mastodon und Twitter: FÃ¼r die Nutzer meiner Server steht unter https://tootbridge.majak.de ein Crossposter bereit, welcher Eure Mastodon-Toots auf Wunsch twittert und Eure Tweets auf Eurem Mastodon-Account trÃ¶tet. Feel free! ;-)
Short: Mein Mastodon-Server und Homepage fÃ¼r mich, meine Familie, Freunde und Freunde von Freunden :-)

Description: Podcasting is entering a new era. The past two decades of organic growth were driven by original audio content producers. Major digital players and audio content industry are now investing on Podcasts. Yet, compared to the standards in Social Media and Search Engines, Podcasts - technology, user experience - have not evolved for the past 20 years. It is time for all players - Podcasters, Radio Networks, Journalists, Writers and all Voice lovers - to take control of their medium. Our mission is to help find a path to repairing podcast broadcasting and make it free again.
Short: designed and built by and for podcasts lovers

Description:
What kvlt.zone is

kvlt.zone is a Mastodon instance inspired by music that falls somewhere in the overlap of metal, gothy shit, noise, dark ambient/dungeon synth, or anything reasonably adjacent to those things. Other things that drive it are horror movies, low budget sci fi/fantasy schlock, weird cinema in general, occult ~ a e s t h e t i c ~ nonsense, satanic #content, vulture culture, leather/kink, and existential bleakness. Despite the instance focus, we donâ€™t take any of it too seriously. This placeâ€™s name is a joke and most of the posts are too.

Besides the thematically apt material, the limited user base may also post about goings-on in their lives.

I donâ€™t know what â€œkvltâ€ means, is that a meme

kvlt is when you have an album thatâ€™s so authentically black metal you recorded it with a piece of barbed wire on a cassette tape thatâ€™s already been used twenty times, and you drank blood before every recording session, and your guitar track shreds eardrums and your vocal track sets Norwegian churches on fire.

Whatâ€™s the kvlt.zone stance on fascists in metal subcultures

kvlt.zone is staunchly antifascist. We do not support unambiguously fascist artists, and our limited user base looks with scrutiny on artists whose content, branding, or press statements seem suspiciously fashy. Although we make every effort to vet our own tastes (which is trve kvlt), if you see something posted that seems to counter this statement, please give a heads up. Itâ€™s likely weâ€™re just not aware of the artist(s)â€™s given issues, and we would rather not dwell in ignorance.

Can I get some other content assurances for federating with you

Our two users will endeavor not to say or do things that are bigoted, oppressive, or otherwise cruel toward anyone on the broader fedi. Bigotry means deliberate or inadvertent exhibitions of gross beliefs that uphold structural violence against systematically marginalized people. We are all taught some flavor of this shit, so mistakes are inevitable, but on kvlt.zone the aim is to NOT double down or give evasive non-apologies if someone points out a mistake.

We will make absolutely NO apologies for cops, bosses, landlords, billionaires, fascist organizations, or state violence.

We are not interested in starting or joining bad faith discussions, using human beings* as discursive punching bags, doxxing other human beings, demanding that everyone shares our stances about whether sexual identity label A is the same as sexual identity label B, etc.

For maximum clarity: cops, bosses, landlords, billionaires, fascists, and state operatives do not count as human beings.

For the most part, do not expect hot takes or public â€œmetaâ€ posts. We will take meaningful private actions wherever applicable, but as an instance of this size, we recognize that very few people could (or should) give a shit about our opinions on interpersonal conflicts we arenâ€™t directly involved in (or that they arenâ€™t). We also keep our heads down usually. So you may find kvlt.zone rarely has an official public â€œstanceâ€ on any given fediverse issue, unless it seems like our specific voices are needed.

kvlt.zone can promise content warnings and/or hidden media for violence (especially gore), references to sexual assault, flashing images, porn or general nudity, kinky shit, and other things that could reasonably trigger PTSD episodes, seizures, etc., or get people in trouble at work. Other CWs are at user discretion.

Can I join

For now, no. That could change but weâ€™d have to know you extremely well, maybe from offline. Both of us can moderate ourselves but thatâ€™s where the bandwidth stops, so better to avoid ugly surprises.

Federation practices

As a private instance, defederation is at the discretion of the two admin-users. We will defederate from instances known to be hotbeds for fascists, right-wing or neoliberal dickheads, libertarian â€œfree speechâ€ garbage, child porn, other material that strongly sexualizes minors, other material thatâ€™s just categorically vile (zoophilia, necrophilia, etc.), and anything else that falls in this ballpark. We also do not knowingly federate with Threads or any other Meta/Facebook-operated domain. This is not an exhaustive list of reasons we will defederate from an instance, itâ€™s just the shit we find most worthy of defederation. If we havenâ€™t taken action on a particular instance that you know meets the above criteria, itâ€™s likely we just donâ€™t know whatâ€™s up. Feel free to send an e-mail or submit a report.

Bear in mind that again, being a private instance weâ€™re not particularly obligated to offer a reason for defederating.

Also bear in mind that an e-mail or report does not guarantee a response if your message appears to be in bad faith. Likewise please consider preemptively silencing kvlt.zone if youâ€™re not interested in what weâ€™re likely to post or if you disagree with the above policies. Itâ€™s free and legal to ignore us.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Code of Conduct

This is a family Mastodon instance so please keep that in mind ğŸ™‚! We have a few rules on posts, content, and conduct all related to this.

  1. Our primary goal is a way to share photos, updates, milestones, and thoughts with each other.
  2. Keep religion and politics to an absolute minimumâ€”there are plenty of other forums and platforms for that kind of content/engagement.
  3. Family and extended family are all welcome, you don't need to be an @gioia!
  4. Have fun and respect each other always.

Who Made This?

This server is run and managed by Andrew (@andrew) with help from Mike (@mike). It runs Mastodon, a federated social platform that corrects all the problems with Twitter. It costs about $10/mo right now to keep it running if you want to get him a soft pretzel sometime.

If you're interested in learning more about what Mastodon is or who builds it, check out their information page or their active Github project.

Mobile Apps

There are some really beautiful mobile apps that complement this webapp and make the experience much more natural.

On iOS, Mast is @andrew's daily driver and very much recommended. It costs $3 and is worth it.

Problems or Questions

If you're having any technical problems, please email @andrew and he can help right away.
Short: Family photos, updates, and social sharing home of the Gioia Family.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server
A nice Pleroma instance with nya and meows

Thereâ€™s nothing wrong with being a little shortsighted. Myopic.one aims to build a small friendly community of members who wish to aid and encourage each other in pursuing their personal goals.

Whether it be an app your building, a diet youâ€™ve been struggling with, or just donâ€™t know which way youâ€™d like to redecorate the living room: a few words of encouragement can go a long way sometimes. It feels good to do good.

The internet can be a hostile and cold place, especially to those willing to show a little vulnerability and ask for help. Situations such as this can sometimes be met with ridicule, immaturity and hate by those answering back.

Why canâ€™t we build a place to show a little kindness?

Whether you're left, right, north, south, liberal, center, or living in the fourth dimension, all are welcome here, regardless of your color, class, religion and race. The only thing Myopic.one seeks are open-minded and civil people interested in bettering themselves and helping others do the same. Olive branches galore!

This is a social media platform at the end of the day, feel free to bring your memes, cat posts, lunch pics, movie spoilers and whatever you'd like to share with the community.

As long as its legal and respectful, feel free to make this slice of the internet as cozy and homely as you like!

Building a community like this can seem like a pipe dream, and truly only seems possible in small numbers, so this instance will be limited to 100 members max.

For the purposes of dissuading trolls, spam and anyone intending to cause conflict, please provide an existing account for reference when signing up.
Short: Myopic.one is a general purpose instance that aims to build a small friendly community of members who wish to aid and encourage each other in pursuing their personal goals.

Description: Une instance pour les gouverner tous, une instance pour les trouver, une instance pour les amener tous, et dans le fÃ©divers les lier.

Rules, Expanded

Although this is currently a single-user instance, I want to try to explain some rules because they'll also influence whether I block other servers and content (and apply to any users that are on the instance). Expanding on the rules above:

  • No bigotry.

    Bigotry and hate speech of any kind, including homophobia, transphobia, racism, fascism, anti-Semitism, and so on are not tolerated. Instances that tolerate this (usually by claiming they are for free speech) will be silenced or suspended. Users that post or boost anything of this nature will be banned.

  • No harassment.

    Harassment is not tolerated, including brigading. Instances that tolerate this will be silenced or suspended as needed. Users that post or boost harassment will similarly be banned.

  • No content illegal in the United States.

    This server is operated in the United States, ergo anything illegal in the US is not tolerated. This includes hate speech because not everything that's legal is acceptable.

  • Provide alt text for content whenever possible.

    This rule is here as guidance and isn't strictly enforced. Instead, it is here to provide encouragement to think about the accessibility of what you post, including how it's interpreted by tools like screen readers (consider that a single emoji is multiple words, for example). Try to be conscious of what you write.

  • Use content warnings appropriately.

    This is subjective. The main thing is to use it in cases like (but not limited to) not safe for work (NSFW) content, violent imagery, and writing that could cause distress or anxiety. The rule is to encourage people to think about and use the tools they have available and especially consider this when boosting other posts.

  • No cryptocurrencies or NFTs.

    Cryptocurrencies and NFTs are generally harmful to the environment and boil down to creating new money laundering schemes, pyramid schemes, powering ransomware, and other undesirable behavior. History thus far has not shown these topics to be worth carrying in any capacity, and so they are not tolerated. Currently, this excludes aspects of blockchain as a technology (for example, Merkle trees, as used in Git), but most discussions of blockchain itself will be covered by this since cryptobros have a rather limited imagination when it comes to technology.

I feel that most of this boils down to being a nice person. If you engage in harassment and bigotry, it's likely the only company you keep is the same. The rest of the rules are mainly to encourage behavior I want to see in the world by putting them somewhere relevant to the server itself.

Verhaltensregeln

Da "Geht gut miteinander um" einfacher gesagt als getan ist, habe wir eine (nicht vollständige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer Löschung von Toots und zu einer Blockung von Accounts führen können, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere toleriere ich nicht:

  • Strafrechtlich relevante Ã„uÃŸerungen oder Links, die auf solche Inhalte verweisen
  • Belästigung, Stalking, Doxxing
  • Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren Befürwortung
  • Gewalttätige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
  • Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen. Dogpiling
  • Nicht markierter sexueller Inhalt oder Gewaltdarstellungen
  • Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzer interagieren

Accounts, die gegen diese Regeln verstoÃŸen, werden nach entsprechender Verwarnung vom Server gelÃ¶scht bzw. blockiert. Solltest Du VerstÃ¶ÃŸe gegen diese Regeln feststellen, kannst Du Dich gerne bei mir melden.

    Ansonsten gilt: Es gibt ein Recht auf freie MeinungsÃ¤uÃŸerung, solange sie den obigen Regeln nicht widerspricht. Daher werde ich niemanden lÃ¶schen oder blockieren, nur weil jemandem die Meinung nicht gefÃ¤llt. Solltest Du das nicht akzeptieren kÃ¶nnen, kannst Du den entsprechenden Benutzer jederzeit selber bei Dir blockieren.

Description:
I run this server as a gift to you, my friends. Please try not to reward me for it by making my life more difficult. Please follow the server rules; if you repeatedly or egregiously break them, I will have to remove your account.

If you are a user of this site, your profile is opted-out of the public directory and indexing by search engines here by default; if you want to be found, you will probably want to go into your preferences and change those settings.
For privacy reasons, the list of instances that we block is only visible to our users, but members of the general public can be assured that it is lengthy. We try not to federate with servers that have rules incompatible with ours. Please report anything you might see on federated that should be added to the block list.
This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
The "hero image" of the Chicago skyline comes from Max Bender on Unsplash.
Short: A place for folks that like to be social, sometimes

Description:
[tos lang="en"]

In general the server respects freedom of speech and freedom of association and works on moderation precedent. If you make life on this instance intolerable we will probably ban you and write a new rule about you.

General don'ts:

  • Don't spam
  • Don't break laws of France and Estonia
  • Don't post adult or disturbing content without content warning
  • Don't post CP (lolicon is not CP)
  • Don't call for violence ("I hate lizardmen" is OK, "kill all lizardmen" is not) or coordinate violence
  • Don't create bots without admin's prior approval (crossposting from personal social account is OK)
  • Don't harass other fediverse users (in form of repeated or collective unwanted interaction)

Other considerations:

  • Users should be older than 16 to match EU laws
  • We would like to have our public posts in admin inspectable languages: English, Russian, Estonian, Spanish, Esperanto
  • Please contact administration in English or Russian
  • We don't like SJWs here
  • Still, please consider the rules of topic starter instance when replying to external threads
  • We ban instances only for hackish or other similar suspicious behavior or spam or technical problems
  • We reserve the right to shadow other instances at our discretion
  • We reserve the right to ban Nokita without any explanation

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Welcome to paws.town! A furry mastodon server, currently single-user. Registrations are closed and unlikely to be opened.

For moderation inquiries, contact @townadmin@paws.town. @mycroft@paws.town is a personal account, and @mycroft@meow.social and @mycroft@vulpine.club are backups.

This server is intended to be a small growing server of alternate/backup accounts focused on enthusiasts for paws, claws, beans, and the like. As of server creation, I'm not sure how much effort I want to put into maintaining this, so I would advise all users or potential users not to make this their primary home on the fediverse.

Rules, in the event the server opens up:

  1. No bigotry, anti-LGBT, TERFs, nazis, etc. I hope I don't have to spell this out further.

1a. Being a jerk "as a joke" is indistinguishable from being a jerk for real. "But I was only joking" is not an excuse for obviously terrible behavior.

  1. No harassment of other users, either on this server or on remote ones. Again, I hope I don't have to spell this out further.

  2. Use Content Warnings liberally, and descriptively. Erotic or suggestive artwork, erotic or suggestive photographs, depictions of violence or blood, excessive descriptions of food, uncomfortable eye contact, photos of spiders, uncomfortable political topics, etc. should have a Content Warning applied, and be descriptive. Simply "nsfw" is not enough.

  3. Image hiding, "mark image as sensitive", "mark NSFW", or whatever your client of choice calls it, is not enough. Use a proper content warning.

  4. No sexual depictions of minors, real or otherwise, including but not limited to photos, artwork, 3D models, text descriptions, etc.

  5. No sexual depictions of real animals, including but not limited to photos, artwork, 3D models, text descriptions, etc.

6a. Sexual depictions of anthropomorphic animals, fantasy creatures, and other sapients are allowed, as long as they have enough context so as not to be mistaken for real. "Feral" (normal animal shape based) but intelligent/sapient creatures I consider 'anthropomorphic', though it's a gray area I'm uncomfortable with.

  1. If you post 6a, be sure to use a sufficient content warning, as in 3 above; ie "lewd artwork". 'nsfw' is not sufficient.

  2. No automatic posting, or crossposting from other services. If you want to use the fediverse as a glorified RSS feed, go elsewhere. Crossposting from twitter can be done poorly, for that reason I ask if you wish to crosspost, do so manually and with all the sensitivities of the server's rules.

  3. If you need moderation actions, be patient. I'm just a single user, busy with a job and attempted life. I might not be able to get back to you right away. There is no paid customer support agent following a policy.

  4. If you have a problem with another user, local or remote, assume good faith first. Many of us are neuroatypical or not the best at social situations, and might say the wrong thing unknowingly.

  5. Making mistakes is okay. Everyone is new one time or another, and might forget rules that are not often run into. This server likely has slightly different rules than similar fediverse servers. As long as you're trying to be respectful, problems can be fixed and we can move on.

11a. This is my server and I reserve the right to not put up with bullshit. If someone is looking to repeatedly toe the line on what's considered acceptable, they will be banned at my discretion.

Description:
Ready to enter the cave?

This is a small dungeon for the creatures out there. We aim to offer a nice and relaxing space for queer, plural, neurodivergent, and other types of folk.

Never been a monster before? It's okay, here are some guidelines! These are not exhaustive, and can change in the future.

What to do:

  • Decide on your critter

    What beastie would you like to be? Polymorph potions will be provided after sign up

  • Express your monstrous side

    Whether you're here for the lewd and kinky, or just to stretch your wings and hang out, it doesn't matter. Roar like you mean it!

  • Use content warnings

    To keep your fellow critters comfortable, please use CWs for sensitive and explicit topics. Here's a few categories to consider.
    1. abuse
    2. violence
    3. food
    4. us/uk politics
    5. lewd or sexual content

    Other folk may have different CW requests, be respectful of them

What not to do:

  • Don't harass people, and no opressive behavior.

    We've got enough jerks in our everyday lives, let's keep the cave friendly. If you happen to breach someone's boundaries, learn from that. We try to deal with conflicts with communication. But for repeat failures, you can and will be booted off the server.

  • No hateful speech.

    Including racism, ableism, transmisia, sexism, or homomisia. These (or others) will not be tolerated. Terfs, swerfs, nazis, and other fascists need not apply. This isn't a free speech zone!

Did you get this far in the rules? If so, tell me what your favorite plant is in your signup message!

We've updated our Kobold Policy.

Gently the kobolds

Credits

This instance runs on the hometown fork of mastodon, which you can find here.

Thank you to rage.love, weirder.earth, and fediblock for helping us out with the initial block list.
Short: Small instance for monsters, beasties, and other things that go bump in the night.

Impressum

Der Betreiber von Microblog heiÃŸt Robert Lender. Ich betreibe auch ein Macroblog unter dem Titel Nur ein Blog.


Ich wohne in Wien, Ã–sterreich und bin fÃ¼r Anregungen, Beschwerden und Sonstiges unter meine E-Mail Adresse robert@microblog.at , meinen Mastodon Account @robert@microblog.at oder Ã¼ber ein Kontaktformular auf meinem Blog erreichbar.


NÃ¤heres zu meiner Person ist auf der Ãœber mich Seite meines Blog zu finden.


Ãœber microblog.at

Die Instanz microblog.at ist seit 28. April 2022 online. Sie ist meine private Instanz, die ich fÃ¼r den Betrieb meiner eigenen Profile nutze. Sollten im microblog Texte, Bilder, Links oder andere Services AnstoÃŸ erregen oder sogar rechtlich bedenklich sein, so ersuche ich um eine Nachricht um mich diesen anzunehmen.


Mehr dazu gibt es in meinem Blog: Willkommen bei microblog.at (Mastodon)


Eventuell Ã¶ffne ich die Instanz hin und wieder einzelnen Menschen fÃ¼r Versuchszwecke oder spezielle Projekte.


Open Blogging

Ich fÃ¼hle mich beim bloggen dem Open Blogging Manifest verbunden. Dem Sinn nach gelten diese Regeln auch fÃ¼r meine Art des microbloggens.


Willkommen im Fediverse

Dies ist eine Instanz eines groÃŸen Netzwerks, dem Fediverse.


Das Fediverse ist ein fÃ¶rderiertes System. Das heiÃŸt, es gibt unterschiedliche Dienste (microblogging, bloggen, Fotoalben, Video- und Audiohosting,â€¦), die nicht nur von einem Anbieter, sondern von vielen Servern/Instanzen betrieben werden.


Denn alles basiert auf offener Software und auf dem Austauschprotokoll ActivityPub.


Somit kann jede:r ihr:sein eigenes System betreiben - wie ich mit microblog.at - und sich doch mit vielen anderen vernetzen und austauschen.


Damit gehÃ¶rt das Fediverse niemanden und allen. Es ist somit Teil eines Internet/Web fÃ¼r Alle.

Description:
A single-user instance for a pretend dog

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of surfin.dog; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dog-piling) may be considered harassment.
  5. I have no idea what I'm doing.
Short: A single-user instance for a pretend dog

Description: The beauty of federated social is that you can 100% control your social presence. That's what I'm doing by running my Mastodon server. It's like running a personal email server but for social media. This server is just for me, and I can do whatever I want. How refreshing.

Description:
Code of Conduct

Adapted/shamelessly borrowed from mastodon.social's Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of daedal.io; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Homophobia, transphobia, discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Description:
Der Server wird privat von mir (@yoda@mastodon.ir0k.de) betrieben und befindet sich auf einem Contabo vServer in Deutschland. Es soll perspektivisch ein kleiner Server zu den Themen #Bildung, #academia, #Gaming, #Tech und #food sein, den ich erstmal auf ca. 100 Nutzende wachsen lassen wÃ¼rde, je nachdem wie hoch der Moderationsaufwand wird. Der Server ist benannt nach dem gleichnamigen Charakter aus dem Science-Fiction-Roman Ready Player One von Ernest Cline, weil das kurz und knackig war. Bitte werft einen Blick auf die Serverregeln!

This server ist run privately by myself (@yoda@mastodon.ir0k.de) and is located on a Contabo vServer in Germany. I plan to keep this a smaller instance on the subjects of #education, #academia, #gaming, #tech and #food with up to 100 users, depending on the amount of moderation necessary. The server is named after a character from the science fiction novel Ready Player One by Ernest Cline. I just thought it's a cool and short name. :) Please have a look at the server rules. Feel free to toot in other languages than German and English.

Description:
A Sovereign, Open and Healthy Web

When you post something on the web, it should belong to you, not a corporation. Too many companies have gone out of business andÂ lost all of their usersâ€™ data. By running your own sites, your content stays yours and in your control.Â 

You should also be able to post what you want, in any format you want, with no one monitoring you or changing their terms of service and cancelling your presence.

Server Compact

Below is a summary of the compact between members of Winter Ink Social and people of the Fediverse:

  1. To think first and post after
  2. To engage in open debate in search of truth
  3. To not share intentionally false or misleading information
  4. To not post sexually explicit or violent media
  5. To not engage in hate speech
  6. To not incite violence or promote violent ideologies
  7. To not harass other people

Moderation

Requests for moderation will be tested against two important questions before content is removed or people / servers are blocked:

  1. Is it censoring that which is dangerous and false or that which is dangerous and true?
  2. Is the censorship decision following a deliberative process and arriving at an authoritative decision?

The Winter Ink Social compact makes a commitment to always follow a deliberative process to try and arrive at authoritative decisions. However, content will only be removed and people / servers blocked if the statements are dangerous and false. If a statement is deemed dangerous and true, even if it causes offence, it will be left to stand.

We appreciate this may upset some people, but please read on for our explanation as to why we pursue this approach.

No Platforming

It is with sadness that we bear witness to an increasing number of institutions and services adopting a â€˜no platformâ€™ policy because students, staff or external activists feel threatened by the views of potential speakers. Simply because we hear, read or even write a view does not mean we hold or endorse that view. It may simply mean we recognise its importance, if only as something to be rebutted, and think it better to expose and test the assertion against the full weight of evidence than let it stand on hearsay or speculation.Â 

Social media provides a near unlimited outlet for any view, no matter how bigoted, anti-logical or ill-informed it may be. Only by bringing such views into forums filled with the best and the brightest, and having those ideas opened to the scrutiny of debate and analysis, may they finally be put to rest as potential solutions to the present discontents.

Winter Ink is an attempt to redress this tide of no platforming and provide a space for a voice which may be unpopular, but which strives to surface truths no matter how inconvenient.Â 

Safe Spaces

Wink Ink is also a reaction to the use and abuse of safe spaces. A safe space is a crucial notion, but the concept must be extended to mean more than a place in which people who â€˜feelâ€™ marginalised can go to discuss their experiences of marginalisation free from any criticism, no matter how constructive.Â 

If all counter arguments are suppressed, such spaces, far from equipping people with the tools to combat real, and imagined, marginalisation, will create the ultimate philosophical vacuum and only serve to fuel suspicion of all â€˜out groups,â€™ that is to say groups who are deemed not to be part of the milieu of the marginalised. In such an environment it is little wonder minority and majority groups increasingly feel to be under siege.Â 

Such sentiment could be effectively combatted if the concept of a â€˜safe spaceâ€™ was extended to mean a place in which all aspects of thought can be discussed, particularly those which deviate from the â€˜marginalisedâ€™ consensus. Ã‰mile Durkheim observed â€˜if purely moral rules are at stake, the public conscience restricts any act which infringes them.â€™Â 

Without divergence from safe views, without an opposing system of thought or differing set or moral rules, consciousness will â€˜petrify too easily into an immutable form. For it to evolve, individual originality must be allowed to manifest itself.â€™

Although not open for registrations, if you want to join the Fediverse there are plenty of sites that accept new users. See them atÂ joinmastodon.org.Â 

However, to both support the Fediverse and ensure even greater protection of your online voice, running your own instance is an even better solution. This is why the Winter Ink Mastodon service was established. But running your own instance requires a quality hosting solution as you donâ€™t want to find your service offline because the dog pulled the power cable out.
Short: Winter Ink is a philosophical playground from which we can exchange and explore ideas with the Fediverse in a respectful and thoughtful manner.

Description:
This server is operated by @jamie, self-funded and running on a DigitalOcean Kubernetes cluster for easy upgrades, scaling, etc.

Postgres is running on a CloudNative Postgres instance inside the cluster because it's cheaper than cloud Postgres hosting and the Kubernetes operator does all the hard work.

Redis is also running inside the cluster as a plain-old StatefulSet.

The total hosting bill is about $35/mo. If you're feeling generous, you can donate to $jgaskins on CashApp to keep the system running.

Herzlichen Dank an Weingaertner-IT.de fÃ¼r das bereitstellen sowie die technische Verwaltung dieser Mastodon-Instanz.


REGELN für Quasselkopf.de

Quasselkopf.de wird in Deutsch als Hauptsprache betrieben und kann als Zweitsprache noch Englisch verwenden, wobei dann jeder so gennanter "Toot" mit dem Hashtag "#engpost" gekenzeichnet werden muss. Zuwiederhandlungen gegen diese Regelungen führen zwangsläufig zu nachfolgenden Ergbenis:

1. Entsprechende Verwarnung werden erteilt.
2. Konto wird gesperrt für eine bestimmte Zeitspanne.
3. Löschung des betreffenden Konto.
4. Eintragung der E-Mail/IP/Sonstige-Adresse in die interen Blacklist.


Hauptsprache: DEUTSCH(GERMAN)
Zweitsprache: Englisch(English)

 

CODEX zum Verhalten auf Quasselkopf.de


Da "Geht gut miteinander um" einfacher gesagt als getan ist, wurde eine (nicht vollständige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer Löschung von Toots und zu einer Blockierung von Accounts führen können, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere tolerieren wir nicht:

Belästigung, Stalking, Doxxing
Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren Befürwortung
Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten oder deren Befürwortung
Gewalttätige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder Förderung der - Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen. Dogpiling
Nicht markierter sexueller Inhalt, Gewaltdarstellungen oder Werbung
Nicht getaggte oder automatisierte oder übermäßige Werbung
Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzer interagieren

Bitte melde Verhalten, das stört an den @hausundmeister. Das schließt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein - ich bin sehr gerne bereit, mit Asshole-Instanzen die Verbindung zu unterbrechen. Basierend auf dem "About" von chaos.social, verfügbar in deren Github-repository.


Since "Be excellent to each other" is much easier said than done, we have a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, and silencing or suspension of accounts, if problems persist. In particular, we do not tolerate:

Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
Untagged sexual content, gore, or advertisement
Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests

Please report behaviour that bothers you. That includes behaviour from other instances - we are very willing stop federating with asshole instances. Based on the about of chaos.social available in their Github-repository.
Short:
Mastodon ist ein soziales Netzwerk. Es basiert auf offenen Web-Protokollen und freier, quelloffener Software. Es ist dezentral, so wie die E-Mail. 
QuasselKopf.de dient zum Micro-Bloggen und bis auf weiteres nur für dessen Betreiber. Eventuell auch in Zukunft für ausgewählte Kontakte. Einladungen werden nicht auf Anfrage erteilt!

Code of Conduct

This Code of Conduct adapted from social.coop's Code of Conduct v3.1, licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license.

Encouraged Behavior

I will:

  • Help maintain a culture of inclusivity and open participation
  • Show care, consideration, and respect for others.
  • Keep in mind the potential for misunderstandings, avoiding initial assumptions of bad faith.
  • Keep criticism constructive.
  • Attempt to de-escalate conflicts as they arise (see Conflict Resolution Guidelines )
  • Recognize and respect the legitimacy of resistance to abuse and oppression.
  • Participate in an authentic way.

Unacceptable Behavior

I will not:

  • Use violence, threats of violence, or violent language directed against another person.
  • Harass â€” defined as continuing to interact with or post about another person after having been asked to stop.
  • This includes, but is not limited to, unwelcome sexual attention, deliberate intimidation, stalking, and dogpiling.
  • Make offensive, harmful, or abusive comments or insults, particularly in relation to diverse traits (as referenced in our values above).
  • Advocate or encourage any of the above behaviour.

Content

I am responsible for the content I share, and will:

  • Always use content warnings (CWs) when sharing content that:
    • is likely to be distressing or hurtful to others
    • should require consent to view
    • includes discussions or depictions of violence, sexually explicit material, and/or common PT triggers
    • includes flashing or rapidly changing images
  • Strive to make posts accessible with alt-text descriptions for visual media and transcriptions for audio.
  • Give credit and recognize the contributions of others.
  • Promote products or services provided by individuals, cooperatives, or aligned communities over those provided by non-co-op, for-profit companies.
  • I will not post, threaten to post, nor share from this instance or external sources:
    • Personally Identifiable Information about others. (â€œdoxingâ€)
    • Sexual Material that is either:
      • Without consent, or
      • Depicting individuals appearing to be under age 18 â€” including Loli.
    • Excessively frequent promotions of a product or service (i.e. spam)
    • Material that promotes bigotry, including fascist, racist, misogynistic, homophobic, or transphobic content.

Conflict Resolution Guidelines

This Code of Conduct adapted from social.coop's Conflict Resolution Guidelines v3.1, licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license.

Handling Conflicts

loser.cafe is based on the values of self-help, self-responsibility, democracy, equality, equity, and solidarity. In the tradition of their founders, cooperative members believe in the ethical values of honesty, openness, social responsibility and caring for others.

Our top priority is the safety of each of our members and our community as a whole. We will not tolerate bigotry, including fascist, racist, misogynistic, homophobic, or transphobic content and will act swiftly and decisively to protect our members from abuse. We embrace the principles of restorative justice. We want to give people a chance to correct mistakes and learn from them.

How to Initiate Conflict Resolution

We want to prevent conflicts from leading to Code of Conduct violations. We also seek to avoid having productive discussions get derailed by problem posts or by meta discussions of such posts. In the case of conflicts that do not involve violations of the Code of Conduct you should use your best judgment in choosing from the following options:

  1. Bring the concern to the other member directly via Direct Message.
  2. Enlist more support from loser.cafe member(s).
  3. File a formal report to the Community Working Group Operations Team (CWG Ops Team).

Bring the concern to the other member directly

If you feel capable and safe in doing so, discuss your concerns directly with the other person.

Use your best judgment to decide whether to discuss the issue publicly or privately.

For addressing a particular problem post, consider the following template:

I noticed your [post]. Although you may not have intended it, one interpretation is ______, and I feel that is not reflective of [list specific relevant portion(s) of CoC]. Would you please (edit your post / delete and repost improved version | take down your post | put a CW on your post)?

When engaging in dialogue to resolve concerns, consider the following:

  • Foster inclusive dialogue by sharing ideas, asking clarifying questions, and responding to others' ideas.
  • Identify personal wants and needs.
  • Make offers or requests.
  • Propose plans to help resolve in a mutually satisfactory way.

For toots in Mastodon, you can request a "delete and redraft." For editable content such as at Loomio, wikis, or similar, editing can be requested. Posts in Matrix rooms can be redacted. For permanent contexts such as a live call, a request for a public retraction / correction / clarification would be appropriate (and that also may make sense for edited or deleted posts in cases where lots of people saw the original problem version).

Enlist More Support

If you aren't comfortable contacting someone yourself but think such outreach from someone else would be appropriate, ask for help.

  • Private support -- Talk privately to member(s) of the CWG Ops Team or a mutually trusted friend to help you resolve conflicts with other loser.cafe members or other participants in loser.cafe spaces. Make a plan together about what you're going to do.
  • Expanded dialogue -- loser.cafe members may seek to informally resolve their conflicts by discussing them with a group of mutually trusted loser.cafe members. This should be done confidentially.

Someone else can contact the other person on your behalf and keep you anonymous.

  • If you can, you could still help by providing a clear message to send, such as using the template in the section above.

File a Report

Remember, you are always free to file an incident report to the CWG Ops Team to seek help in resolving conflicts. Please see 1 above. We do not look negatively on reports that we determine to describe incidents that do not constitute violations of the Code of Conduct, (unless excessive reporting is used as a form of harassment).

Reporting Guide

This Code of Conduct adapted from social.coop's Reporting Guide v3.1, licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license.

How to report Code of Conduct violations

We would rather get "false alarms" than have Code of Conduct violations go unaddressed.

If you think someone is violating the Code of Conduct, please report them to the loser.cafe moderators.

Click "report @[user]".

Or DM someone on the Community Moderation Team: You can include screenshots, links, and any other context that will help us understand the situation.

What happens after I make a report?

You will get an automated email acknowledging that we've received it. We will do our best to get back to you within 24 hours (understanding that people live in different time zones, have different schedules, etc.).

Our first priority is making sure everyone is safe. If necessary, we will:

  • Delete, edit, or hide a problem post
  • This may be proactive to deal with the item in order to not wait for the person to take care of it or this may be necessary when the person will not voluntarily address the item
  • Privately tell the violator(s) to knock it off, delete/redact posts on Mastodon, or apologize
  • Publicly tell the violator(s) to knock it off, delete/redact, or apologize
  • Mute or block the violator(s)

We may delay an official response until we have dealt with the immediate situation.

Once we have an understanding of what's going on, we will make a decision and contact you. We will take your feedback into account, but the action we take is our responsibility. This might involve:

  • Nothing (if we determine no violation occurred)
  • A temporary ban
  • A permanent ban
  • A request for a public or private apology
  • A request to participate in mediation

Description:
The Machines.social Code of Conduct

Welcome!

Machines.social is a Mastodon instance for people who I, Trevor Flowers, know and are of the maker, machinist, and/or manufacturer persuasion.

I want our 'local' timeline to have the feel of a comfy lunch table at your local machine shop: full of friendly conversation on a wide variety of topics.

I do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

I want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.

Folks asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism.
  • Deliberate or persistent misgendering.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent.
  • Sexual depictions of any sort.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent.
  • Gratuitous sexual images or behavior.
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like â€œ*hug*â€ or â€œ*backrub*â€) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content.
  • Gratuitous advertizing or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share.

Known Harassers

I may ban or silence users known to be harassers or abusers, even if they have not violated the rules of this instance. The mere presence of a harasser can make past or potential victims uncomfortable, and it can put potential victims who are unaware of the person's history in particular danger. Users are encouraged to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see.

At my discretion and without explanation I may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if I believe they endanger the safe and welcoming space I'm trying to maintain.

Similarly, I may block other Mastodon instances if they are the source of harassment or unacceptable content.

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact me. I will respond as promptly as I can but keep in mind that I have work and a family.

I will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At my discretion, I may publicly name a person about whom Iâ€™ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. I will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, I may take any action I deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom I've received complaints.

Domain blocking

This instance blocks huge, unmoderated instances like mastodon.social and mastodon.cloud. I want a fediverse that is unpalatable to hypercorp social media types and friendly to small instance admins.

Credits and License

This document was based on the about page of the Wandering Shop.

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.

This instance (specifically, I on this instance) uses some custom emojis made from stock images. These stock images are taken from the following sources:

  • coral clipart png from pngtree.com
  • cartoon png from pngtree.com
  • under the sea clipart png from pngtree.com

You can ask me where to get the stock images I used for them and make your own emojis from them, though, in case you'd like to do that! :D

Description:
The necessary rules of conduct here:

THIS INSTANCE IS ADULT IN NATURE, AND WILL CONTAIN EXPLICIT SEXUAL IMAGERY, COMMENTARY, AND MEDIA FEATURING CONSENSUAL ADULT SEXUAL EXPRESSION. IF YOU ARE SQUEAMISH ABOUT VIEWING OR READING EXPLICIT SEXUAL CONTENT, YOU ARE IN THE WRONG PLACE!!!! ALSO, NO ONE UNDER 18 YEARS OF AGE WILL BE APPROVED TO JOIN THIS INSTANCE, EVER!!!

THIS INSTANCE SHOULD NOT BE USED AS A MEANS OF PROMOTING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY (ALTHOUGH POLITICAL COMMENTARY SUPPORTIVE OF CONSENSUAL ADULT SEXUAL EXPRESSION AND/OR DECRIMINALIZATION OF SEX WORK AND SEXUAL MEDIA IS MORE THAN WELCOME).

CONVERSATION AND DIALOGUE ABOUT SEX WORK, PORN, AND CONSENSUAL SEXUAL EXPRESSION IS MORE THAN WELCOME ALSO, AS LONG AS PROPER RESPECT AMONGST ALL DEBATERS IS CARRIED OUT. HOWEVER, IF YOU ATTEMPT TO TROLL OR OTHERWISE DISRUPT A DEBATE, OR CAST PERSONAL INSULTS, ABUSIVE SPEECH, OR ANY OTHER FORM OF VERBAL OR PHYSICAL THREATS, YOU WILL BE GIVEN A WARNING BY ME TO CEASE. SHOULD YOU FAIL TO HEED THAT WARNING, YOU RISK SUSPENSION OR, DEPENDING ON THE SEVERITY AND MY PERSONAL ASSESSMENT, SUSPENSION OR EVEN PERMANENT BANISHMENT FROM THIS INSTANCE. I AND I ALONE AM RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING FINAL JUDGEMENTS HERE, AND MY DECISIONS ARE FINAL UNLESS I CHOOSE TO REVERSE THEM. MY INSTANCE....MY RULES!!

(However, if you are respectful of others and follow common sense, you are totally free to speak your mind here, remembering that I reserve the right to disagree with you respectfully.)

The content posted on this server is generally suitable for all ages and sensibilities. Content pulled in from external profiles, including in boosts and as part of local copies of external profiles, may use coarse language or touch on mature themes.

This instance may defederate from servers that condone racism, sexism, transphobia, or other kinds of oppression and harassment. It also blocks content that is illegal in Germany.

Description:
Code of Conduct

Note: "Wrestle Town" in this document refers to the Wrestle Town Mastodon instance at https://wrestle.town. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @Odd_Bloke@wrestle.town.

Wrestle Town is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Wrestle Town spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia"
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Wrestle Town, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from Wrestle Town based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Wrestle Town spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Wrestle Town. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Wrestle Town spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Wrestle Town members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that Daniel Watkins runs. He promises that he won't look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust him on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up "federated" -- basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn't leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other wrestle.town users, and only ever @ mention other wrestle.town users. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off. Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server. This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This privacy policy is based on one originally written by Darius Kazemi and provided under a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain. Daniel Watkins has made modifications to it for this server, and this modified document is released under the same license.

Description:
Code of Conduct

  • tvwatch.party is a place for fans of the small screen. You can post about anything (within the rules), but we'd like this to be a "TV-flavored" general instance.
  • Use content warnings (CWs) for any content that could reasonably be considered NSFW. Consider using CWs for spoilers, as well.
  • Consider the user experience of everyone else here. Whenever possible, add descriptions to your images, and use camel-case for hashtags with more than one word.
  • No role play (RP) accounts allowed. You are not a TV character.
  • Please use the Report button on posts you feel put our community at risk (including those that might come from other instances, but are directed at tvwatch.party users); it is the easiest way for an admin to identify abuse.

Moderation

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of tvwatch.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    • Excessive advertising
    • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and will likely result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

    • Racism or advocation of racism
    • Sexism or advocation of sexism
    • Discrimination against gender, sexuality, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin, or advocation thereof
    • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    • Sexual depictions of children
    • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
Short:
Welcome to tvwatch.party, the fediverse's own public access TV network. 
tvwatch.party is a TV-flavored Mastodon instance, for discussing your favorite shows, TV ephemera, and general chit chat.

Description:
Kokoro Mega Apartment

A Mega Apartment for every soul longing for freedom and care.

Welcome to Kokoro Mega Apartment! Kokoro-chan wishes to present a warm welcome!

We'd love to see you move in. It's a place we intend to make everyone fascinated by creating content they like. Shortly speaking, a place for your wild heart.

Hosted in Zurich, Switzerland, and built upon Mastodon, its data is entirely controlled by our team, who are enthusiastic and dedicated to Internet security and digital privacy. Just like our data, we'll gain maximum security for every resident.

Since we rejoice over every precious intellectual but held complex feelings toward spammers and extreme political activists, the apartment will be held in an apply-for-residence security state â€” apologies for the inconvenience.

Best of all, happy well-being!

(All grammatical errors are due to some cause. Refer to it as a special writing style of Kokoro-chan.)
Short: A Mega Apartment for every soul longing for freedom and care.

Description:
Where am I?

This is a place for Paul Lockaby and people that he knows, where they can put things on the internet.

Can I join you?

Registrations are closed on this server. You can run your own server or you can join one of the existing communities. I have no recommendations for communities because so many of them are full of toxic assholes who want to spread misinformation so good luck out there. However, if you know me and I know you, then you are welcome to shoot me a message and I'll send you an invite.

Can I follow you?

Yes, you can, by joining another site like those mentioned above. Or you can just follow my RSS feed if you are content to not be interactive which is fine by me.

Description:
<!DOCTYPE html>

Jxm social Rules

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration / moderation team of jxmsocial.xyz; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

Jxm Social has a 3 level rule policy, level 1 = post removed from public timeline, level 2 = you recving a strike on you account, if you receve 3 strikes your account, your account will be permanently suspendid, level 3 = your account being being immediately permanently suspended:

Level 1 Rules

  1. Advertising, even with a CW (Content Warning)
  2. Post that need to have a CW (Content Warning) on them but don't, see CW's (Content Warnings)

Level 2 Rules

And some more info about strikes, 1st rule violation = a warning from an admin or mod, 2nd rule violation = a message from an admin or mod, your account being disabled for 3 days, and you receving your 1st strike, 3rd rule violation = a message from an admin or mod, your account being disabled for 7 days, and you receving your 2nd strike, 4th rule violation = you receving your 3rd strike, and your account being immediately permanently suspendid

  1. Racism or advocation of racism
  2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
  3. Discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin
  4. Sexual depictions of children
  5. Holocaust denialism, Nazi symbolism
  6. Xenophobic
  7. Porn / pornographic content, even with a CW (Content Warning)
  8. Posting of illegal content
  9. Posting of copyrighted work without the copyright holders permission, memes are permitted
  10. Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health
  11. repedidly posting stuff that needs to have a CW (Content Warning) with out one, see CW's (Content Warnings) for more info
  12. And lastly harassment, see Harassment for more info

Level 3 Rules

  1. Sexual depictions of children
  2. Accounts impersonating others. Note this rule does not necessarily apply to remote accounts
  3. Making alt accounts, if we have sufficient evidence suggesting that an account on this server is an alternate for someone who was banned / suspended from this server, then it will be immediately permanently suspended

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of jxmsocial.xyz reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

CW's (Content Warnings)

As stated above CW's (Content Warnings) are required on certain types of content below is a list of content requiring a CW (Content Warning) along with some example CW's (Content Warnings)

  1. Political post, EX: CW's (Content Warnings), Politics for generl poltics or, USPol / EUPol / ASIAPol, for county / regain spacific politics
  2. Religious post, EX: CW's (Content Warning), Religion / religous content
  3. Mental heath post, EX: CW's (Content Warnings), MH
  4. Graphic gore/violence weather it's IRL (In Real Life) in a video game or an artistic depiction, EX: CW's (Content Warnings), Graphic content / Contains graphic content / Viewer dicresion advised / NSFW (Not Safe For Work)
  5. Post containing Spoilers, EX: CW's (Content Warnings), spoiler, Contains spoilers, and name of the content EX: Avatar the last airbender book 1 water - epasode 3
  6. Post talking about Facebook, Instagram, twitter, pinterest, and other social media platforms, post talking about mastodon do not need a CW (Content Warning) unless the post contains content that warrents a CW (Content Warning), EX: FB for facebook, IG for instagram,And Birdsite for twitter.
  7. Post containing an advertisment, the following is conciderd advertising and must have an apropriet CW (Content Warning) on it, sponserd post / the ones someone paid you to make, post talking about a product or serviece you yourself are selling, EX: CW's (Content Warnings), Sponserd, #Sponserd, Sponserd content, Advertising, Paid advertising, Self advertising

Harassment

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is disallowed, and subject to punishment, see Level 2 rules for more info. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

  1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed
  2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment
  3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment

Team

In addition to the server owner, @jxm_productions, The admin / moderation team at Jxm social includes:

  • @jxm_social witch is @jxm_productions alt account

Funding

This server is paid for by @jxm_productions

Some Additional info

Jxm social is hosted by mastohost @mastohost@mastodon.social

This document may be updated / changed at any time, If and when these changes occour, any and all mods / admins will toot out these changes with a link to this page

This document was last updated on Sat Nov 21 2020

And lastly a copy of this document can be viewed and / downloaded from the jxm_productions gitlab page under the jxm social repository
Short: Jxm Social is a mastodon instance ran by Jxm Productions

Description:
Code of Conduct The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of masto.evelynyap.com; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline: 1. Advertising 2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources 3. Nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions 4. Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service: 1. Racism or advocation of racism 2. Sexism or advocation of sexism 3. Casteism or advocation of casteism 4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism 5. Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service: 1. Sexual depictions of children 2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism 3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism 4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors: 5. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed. 6. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment. 7. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment. 8. These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another.

That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The account is regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored.
  2. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted.
  3. The account also posts non cross-posts.
