Description:
Hips.Social is a server instance of the Mastodon Decentralized Social Network.

Although this instance was established to serve the active community of fans of the rock band, the Mother Hips, our user base consists of people from all walks of life with a great diversity of interests.

In the spirit of old-internet message boards, like The Grotto, and even pre-internet BBS systems, this server endeavors to deliver the feel of a local, tight-knit community, aligned around common interests.

Registration is open, so create an account and post a toot - yeah, that's the word - with the #hello hashtag and tell us a little bit about what brought you here.
Short: Mother Hips Fan Community

Description:
About risc.social

risc.social is a fediverse instance designed to act as a safe space to discuss general technology topics. As it stands, the instance is closed for registration and hosts only a few users, but this could change in the future.

Rules and Guidelines

Please see below for a list of instance rules. In summary, risc.social is supposed to be a friendly and welcoming space for technology enthusiasts; hate speech and bigotry is absolutely not tolerated, and any accounts found to violate this basic principle will be actioned.

Joining risc.social

risc.social is currently closed for registration. Exceptions may be granted for those who know the instance owner personally, but registration remains generally closed as the infrastructure and moderation policies form more rigidly.

Federation Policy

The administrators reserve the right to defederate any instances which fall short of basic moderation principles, or which are found to harbour hateful or undesirable content under the rules of this instance.

risc.social is preemptively defederated from instances which are known to harbour hate speech and undesirable content; to date, some 1100 instances are on the suspend list.

This instance runs with authorised fetch enabled, meaning that defederated instances in principle should not be able to fetch content from risc.social.

The current federation policy potentially results in overblocking instances by association, but the administrators have decided this is an acceptable compromise to keep the instance safe and harassment-free for all of its users.

If you have any questions or concerns about the federation policy, or if you think your instance has been defederated in error, please email tobes+federation@risc.social for a manual review.
Short: A safe, general-purpose tech server to hang out in.
This server is private.

Description:
About BLFC

Biggest Little Fur Con is a North American furry convention located in Reno, Nevada.

  • Location: Reno, Nevada, USA
  • Founded: May 3-5, 2013
  • Year Round Staff: 8 people

Our History

The seed of the idea, we came back from Further Confusion, and we were all post-con jazzed up. We knew what we wanted to see at a convention, and while wandering the Grand Sierra Resort, we were struck by the large accommodating hallways, how everything was in one central location and the extra amenities available. We figured, we should do a convention here!

By random chance, we were approached by SnafuCon, an anime convention local to Reno. They wanted to diversify and do a furry thing. They did one here by the name of PawFur which we helped them with.

After PawFur, the anime group wanted to hand it off, because two events in one year is insane for anyone to organize. We took it from there, and thatâ€™s how BLFC was born.

BLFC is run by Reno Area Anthropomorphic Arts and Recreation (RAAAR), a 501(c)3 nonprofit.

Contact Us

If you have any additional questions or would like clarification, please feel free to contact us here.
Short: Official Mastodon instance for Biggest Little Fur Con in Reno, NV!

Description:
Funding

This server is funded by Itronic

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Description:
Welcome to "Put the meme"!


This is designed to be a place to relax and have fun! That being said, please keep a few things in mind:


  1. You have entered a "good vibes only" zone! Nobody wants to see drama unfold in a space primarily dedicated to posting memes.
  2. Make sure that whatever you post does not contain anything of a political nature (please!)
  3. Also, don't attack an individual or a community, especially based on race, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, or other factors not listed here.
  4. If you feel that an image contains potentially unwanted content, click the "CW" (content warning) button to blur it before posting.

I hate writing rules as much as you hate reading them, but I don't want anything bad to happen. With that in mind, I reserve the right to issue sanctions for any reason, with or without warning, so think a bit before you post.


Have fun!

-Max (gizmo4487)

Description:
Rules

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Privacy Policy.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism

  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("…@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.

Description:
Cover image and admin profile picture generated using @liza@post.lurk.org's tool, A Physical Book.

This server is hosted and managed by Spacebear. It's administrated by honor, from the Ambition's Graveyard team, who can be found on this server at @ag or at @h@post.lurk.org. If you need to email us, use hi@ambition.rip.

Sign-ups for this server are limited to people who have signed up to be a member at this link.

What's Ambition's Graveyard?

Ambition's Graveyard is a collaborative interdisciplinary art space for experimentation, exploration and sharing, co-created with its members, in Norwich, UK. We have a membership scheme which allows varying degrees of access to our resources, time, and community. We are a local-first space, focusing inwards on our relationship with the community of Norwich and surrounding areas before our outward, public reach with members of other communities and localities. We're running this online space in parallel with our in-person space to carry that ethos through to our presence on social networks.

Why Hometown?

Well, we love @darius first of all - but we also want this space to have the capacity for local-only posting. This means if you're on our server, you can post things which only other members can see! It's like our own private space, but you don't have to leave the house for this one.

Defederation and blocklist

We've opted to share our blocklist with those who are members of the space. If you're concerned about federation with a particular server, send us a message and we can let you know our policy on it. If, at any point, you think we should defederate/refederate with a particular instance, feel free to raise this in a message or email. We block instances which post illegal content, or have a reputation for harrassing others. We don't necessarily block instances due to opinions expressed by their users, unless they've targeted it specifically at others or gone out of their way to cause trouble. We enact a policy of openness and receptiveness in our day-to-day lives, which we want to reflect in our attitude to moderating this space. All rules stated in this documentation are up for negotiation with Friends of the Space, because that's who this is for, after all.
Short: A Hometown server for members of Ambition's Graveyard, a collaborative interdisciplinary art space for experimentation, exploration and sharing, co-created with its members, in Norwich, UK.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

About

This community was created to share information, thoughts, opinions and have meaningful conversation. Our conversations should help illuminate and educate. Members should come away feeling buoyant and inspired. One thing we will not tolerate is disinformation and lies. Come prepared to defend your position with facts. This community was founded by a lover of sci-fi and comics, fantasy and gaming, and a lover of tv sitcoms and documentaries. Finally, this is a great place for writers and artists. Share your work and we will talk about it respectfully. Also, don't forget to have fun!

Founders

This small community was founded by Eric Darnley Small. Mastodon by VTIP, VTIP Productions, VTIP Entertainment and V-TIP.COM are sister sites. Check out Link tree for additional links.

Funding

We take tips (hey itâ€™s part of the name). Please visit our Paypal to donate. As little as a dollar can go a long way! We do not take crypto and are not on patreon or any other service. Paypal has been around since forever. We see no reason to switch now.

Moderation

This is a small community. Please adhere to the rules as listed when you join. If you have issues, please contact the moderator if you are unable to resolve them. If you have issues with other members, please remember to flag the offending posts. Don't be a baby. People may say things that are a little off color. It is the internet for gosh sakes. We really want to avoid kicking people out of the community, but will if we have to.

Warnings and caveats

This server may go down for hours at a time. Please be mindful of that. In addition, mastodon is open source. We do not control the software or any breaks in the code that may harm or otherwise eliminate your content or posts. This server may go down due to server related issues, code related issues or human error. Contact Eric either here or on the V-TIP contact page if the server is not accessible for long periods of time. In the subject line put Mastodon and in the body of the text make sure to enter your best contact info.
Short: Powered by VTIP, this community seeks to inform, educate and entertain. Expect chats, links, vids & pics of tv, movies, comics, sci-fi, fantasy & center left leaning politics. You can thank me later.

Description:
This server hosts robots that post daily porn from e621.

Each post includes a link to the source artist, unless the only source available is Twitter, in which case we will include the Twitter username of the artist.

FAQ

Hey, that dude has no dick.

You don't have to have a dick to be a man. Trans men are men.

I am horribly offended by what I see!

We're sorry. This site is generated automatically by a robot. While it attempts to filter out underage characters, it selects images based on a combination of newness, and e621 favs. We don't choose what to post - you do.

Can I choose what is shown here?

Yes. Go to e621 and add new pictures that you like to your favs. We post pics with the most favs.

I don't want my artwork shown here.

Add yourself to the e621 DNP list, we never post artists on that list.
Short: Daily furry porn for the Mastodon network. Accounts on this server are NSFW and run by bots.

Description:
Server is open, when you think you know us and when you want to join, register and leave a message.

  • The servers purpose is to give us and our home base to explore Mastodon.

  • Profiles are not discoverable by other servers. That means for someone to follow you full @yournick@talk.mastodon.com is needed.

  • There is no public timeline for not logged-in users outside of this server (eg. crawler), for more privacy you can close your account (followers only).

  • Everything else will show up at the local timeline. To not to spam it, use at least not listed (world icon below the editor) for follow ups, replys and anything which might not concern other users of this server. More information about Publishing levels

  • Local timeline use is encouraged for occasional cat vids and memes, #dresden related event tips #kultur , music recommendations #audiospam , more proposals are welcome.

  • Behave! (for rules see chaos.social). Additions to/revocation from some of these rules are TBD when necessary

Description:
FOSS - Free Open Source Software

This instance is powered by Mastodon. Mastodon is free open source software designed to allow you to run your own self-hosted federated micro-blogging platform. It brings control of social media back into the hands of people instead of mega corporations. Always 100% ad-free. Your feed is based on chronological order of posts and not some algorithm designed to get clicks.

The Latest Project from Little Mike on the Fediverse.

This instance is both self-hosted and self-moderated, so please be patient. Join me in discussing video games, sci-fi, fantasy, tech, and whatever other geeky or nerdy things bring you joy.

Content Policy

Post whatever you like! Pictures, text, video are all allowed. You have up to 500 characters, unlike other sites. You can also delete and redraft a post if you messed it up (or decided against publishing it.) The platform is very robust.

Regarding explicit nudity and other NSFW content, just make sure you follow the rules listed below under the Server Rules heading. All sensitive content needs to be marked as such before posting. We don't do age-verification here, but you really should be 18 or older if you're using this site. As long as we can act like adults, everything should be just fine.

Staff

Yours truly, @littlemike

Safety

If you are using Mastodon in high-risk or other areas of political unrest, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. Always use a VPN service if possible, preferably one that does not keep logs. With that said, you should also take additional steps such as reviewing your post and account visibility. You can check that under your account settings. Mastodon also has further documentation you can read up on.

Finally, and although it should be obvious, it bears mentioning that you should never give out personal information to people you do not know without properly vetting them first. Usage of Mastodon itself requires a bit of trust. Because every instance is privately run, you should be cautious of whom you sign up with, as they may have more nefarious purposes in mind with your information. Except me. I'm just a geeky dude that loves tech. I also get bored and could delete this instance and all your information would go poof along with it. Perfectly safe if I wipe it ğŸ˜‚

If you have any questions, you can always shoot me a message
Short: The latest project of Little Mike where people can discuss all the geeky and nerdy things.

Description:
Code of Conduct (Rules)

The following types of content will be removed, which will result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

Notice: List this will never be complete, and exists to set a tone. We will refine these rules over time.

  • Registering accounts with inherently malicious intent.
  • Unauthorised distribution of any personal information or data (DOXing).
  • Impersonation: You may not impersonate individuals, groups, or organisations in a manner that is intended to or does mislead, confuse, or deceive others. While you may maintain parody, fan, commentary accounts, you may not do so if the intent of the account is to engage in spamming or abusive behaviour. (Parody accounts must be labelled as such in the bio).
  • Any conduct intended to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed.
  • Racism or the advocacy of racism.
  • Queerphobia, or advocacy of queerphobia (comparisons to pedophilia, animals, dehumanising language)
  • Sexism or advocacy of sexism.
  • Anti-sex worker perspectives or advocacy against sex workers.
  • Discrimination or advocation against genders and sexual minorities.
  • Homophobia, Biphobia & Transphobia (Trans Rights are Human Rights).
  • Ableism, fatphobia, or discrimination against disabled people.
  • Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism.
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
  • Promotion or encouragement of suicide or self-harm.
  • Stalking; including advocating any physical, sexual, or emotional harm against individuals or groups.
  • Harassment of any kind, including consistent baiting, bad faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc. especially towards marginalised groups, and minors.
  • Promotion of scams, including web3/crypto and other ponzi schemes.
  • Promotion of unhealthy lifestyle advice, including Promotion of anorexia.
  • Any content intended to harm or cause distress.

Please report users who break the code of conduct, but please do not message people on behalf of the moderation team. Instead, you can scroll on, block, mute, or report to let moderators deal with it.

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism (Seriously. Absolutely no Nazis!).
  • Holocaust denial, Nazi symbolism, or similar content.
  • Violence: You may not make specific threats of violence or wish for the serious physical harm, death, or disease of an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting terrorism. You also may not affiliate with organisations that â€” whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform â€” use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
  • Child exploitation: You may not post (or promote) suggestive depictions of children in any way (regardless of context). Example: No bath photos.

Description:
Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA")

alleysmith.family respects the intellectual property rights of others. Per the DMCA, alleysmith.family will respond expeditiously to claims of copyright infringement on the Site if submitted to alleysmith.family's Copyright Agent as described below. Upon receipt of a notice alleging copyright infringement, alleysmith.family will take whatever action it deems appropriate within its sole discretion, including removal of the allegedly infringing materials and termination of access for repeat infringers of copyright protected content.

If you believe that your intellectual property rights have been violated by alleysmith.family or by a third party who has uploaded materials to our website, please provide the following information to the designated Copyright Agent listed below:

  1. A description of the copyrighted work or other intellectual property that you claim has been infringed;
  2. A description of where the material that you claim is infringing is located on the site;
  3. An address, telephone number, and email address where we can contact you and, if different, an email address where the alleged infringing party, if not alleysmith.family, can contact you;
  4. A statement that you have a good-faith belief that the use is not authorized by the copyright owner or other intellectual property rights owner, by its agent, or by law;
  5. A statement by you under penalty of perjury that the information in your notice is accurate and that you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or are authorized to act on the owner's behalf;
  6. Your electronic or physical signature.

alleysmith.family may request additional information before removing any allegedly infringing material. In the event alleysmith.family removes the allegedly infringing materials, alleysmith.family will immediately notify the person responsible for posting such materials that alleysmith.family removed or disabled access to the materials. alleysmith.family may also provide the responsible person with your email address so that the person may respond to your allegations.

Pursuant to 17 U.S.C. 512(c). alleysmith.family's designated Copyright Agent is:

dan@alleysmith.family

Description:
Rules

  1. This is an adult space, all users must be 18+ and all pictures posted mustn't contain any minors.

    1. Social media is a detriment to the mental health and privacy of minors.

  2. Do not post anything which is illegal in France, Germany, or The Netherlands.

  3. Criticism is allowed, but no targeted harassment. Harassment includes the following

    1. Evading the block function(s) to harass a user.
    2. Doxing.

  4. All explicit pictures must have an appropriate content warning.

    1. Scat, gore, and any sort of extreme imagery must be clearly labelled as such.

  5. Posting direct advertisements in the form of posts on this instance is prohibited.

  6. Do not post any content which could get the server blocked by any larger and more main-stream servers.
Short: A server for LGBTQ+ / neurodivergent people / rogue techies / gamers / space / nerdy things.

Welcome! Had some free time and built this instance over 2022 Thanksgiving weekend. No political or social agenda and minimal server rules in place.

All are welcome. Simple rulesâ€¦be kind and play nice! (or else)

We follow amazing people I admireâ€¦

Personal computer era legends Howard Rheingold, Dave Winer, Andy Inhatko, Clive Thompson, Walt Mossberg, Cory Doctorow.

Potential superstars Molly White and Sherilynn Ifill.

And folks I find super interesting like Ruth Nineke.

Iâ€™m not trying to build a million followers nor redirect you to monetized sites. This is truly just for me to play, build, and share.

Thanks for stopping by!

-don

Description:
We are a private instance for the staff and editors of the British Journal of General Practice (BJGP).

Users will post about a lot more than just BJGP stuff though and would love to connect with you. Here are some people you may wish to follow:

  • BJGP Editor, Dr Euan Lawson is here: @euan

More about the BJGP

The British Journal of General Practice is an international journal publishing research, editorials, debate and analysis, and clinical guidance for family practitioners and primary care researchers worldwide.

The journal is sent to over 50,000 clinicians and researchers each month. The BJGP's impact factor for 2021 is 6.302, and it is the leading journal in primary care research worldwide.

BJGP is published by Royal College of General Practitioners, a registered charity, regulated by the Charity Commission. Its charitable objective is: "To encourage, foster and maintain the highest possible standards in general medical practice". BJGP is editorially independent of RCGP.

Server rules

In terms of content on this server we maintain the highest standards.

  • You will find no hate speech or any incitement of violence or promotion of discriminatory or violent ideologies.
  • We won't post anything that is sexually explicit or violent media without marking it as sensitive when posting.
  • We will endeavour to use content warnings to keep Mastodon a safe place.
  • There is no content illegal in the United Kingdom.
  • Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia won't be found here.
  • There will be no spam, harrassment, dogpiling or doxxing.

In short, we are a small number of users, working in medical publishing with high ethical standards. If you have any concerns with our content, get in touch.
Short: This is a private instance run by the British Journal of General Practice (BJGP) for its staff and editors.

Description:
Hello everyone!
This is a small mastodon solo instance that I use to experiment with the #fediverse, while learning and sharing about #hobbies in general.

 

  • Limitation of liability: The access to this service is provided to you "as is". The owner and admin accept no liability for any loss or harm that may result from your use of this site. You are liable for everything you post. It is your responsibility to back up any data or media files that you wish to retain in perpetuity, and we accept no liability for data loss.

 

  • Moderation: Managing this server is a task done by the Admin team as volunteers, in addition to their regular full time jobs.  We try to handle moderation ASAP,   but we may not see reports for several hours. Admin stuff and reports are handled during US Eastern Time regular hours.   We will get to all reports though!  Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is highly encouraged.  Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. It may take more than a week due to timezone differences or jobs, but you will always hear back about your report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us. Please include in the report whether you chose to send the report to the other instance, though.  Note: We monitor the Fediblock hashtag.
     

The Admin
Short: This is a small mastodon solo instance that I use to experiment with the #fediverse, while learning and sharing about hobbies in general.

Description:
The Gathering Space is a mastodon server for people who just want to chill and discuss various topics. While we are left/liberal - I hope that doesn't dissuade the right from joining for CIVIL discourse and discussion. All are welcome here with the exception of GOP/GQP/Qanon far right where civil discourse will not be in good faith.

This server is open to any type of discussion, but we are in love with video games, table top games, dnd, politics, music, tv, anime, etc etc.

We also have a lemmy server, matrix server, and most recently a pixelfed server. Please feel free to join any of these services.

Pull up a chair, have a seat, and welcome to The Gathering.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

This server is operated by a UK limited company as a service to those that wish to explore what more positive social media systems may look like.

It is run by me, Rob Pickering. I'm a greybeard software and networking person who has wasted too much time on other social media platforms over the last 2-3 years and want something different for the world. When we started this Internet thing, the early signs were good and I was naively positive about the impact of people talking to each other across geographical, political and social divides. In retrospect, we have probably broken society more than we fixed it. The press is now largely a vacuous clickbait, and discourse on social media is gamed to monopolise attention for the benefit of the owners of those platforms to the detriment of many users' mental health.

I'm not going to pretend that openshare.me this is a grand master plan, the catalyst was the post acquisition behaviour of the new twitter owner. Public discourse cannot flourish under the stewardship of a CEO that posts disgusting meme's on his own platform.

I'm done with the superficial attention sapping environment, and Mastodon is great software that has been out there for years. It isn't however the complete solution to the problem. The ecosystem needs a plurality of hosting organisations, at scale. Ones that embrace a diverse social media landscape and operate their service responsibly within a framework that promotes and rewards responsible discourse and disincentivises toxic behaviour. We need a business model for responsible service provision that survives mass adoption. Having great operating values is only part of the solution, the hosts also need to provide the kind of seamless user experience that is now a standard requirement for any serious platform and openshare will also invest and push this. See an early and very preliminary solution at [openFollow](https://openfollow.me] to the problem of migrating social graphs between platforms.

Openshare aims to play some part in figuring out how to do both of those things and contribute to a viable ecosystem for open social media which challenges platform silos through software enhancement and best practice service provision.

We are currently funding it as a free service as an experiment with limited numbers of daily signups. Our likely direction of travel will be to introduce a micro subscription fee in future to break even on the costs of running the service. Maybe we can avoid doing that by proving our social value and attracting outside funding to provide a service that enhances society. What we guarantee not to do is inject compulsory advertising, or develop other business practices that cause us to have to game your attention for commercial reasons.

Registrations are open at the moment, feel free to sign up and use the service which we will keep free for as long as we can, possibly even forever. If we ever change our policy then we guarantee to give at least 60-days notice before changing the terms of access or shuttering the service which is loads of time to move your account to another service.

Moderation will be responsible, and mindful. We are a UK company, and the service is operated from a data-centre in the EU in Belgium. We have obligations under the GDPR, and will likely be regulated under the Online Safety Bill which is going through UK Parliament plus other statute. We cannot carry content which is illegal in any of these venues and will not carry content which is toxic or has a net negative impact on our service, it's users, or the world.

In common with every service provider, we are trying to figure out what this looks like in practice and how it stifles, or promotes free speech. We undertake to act openly and in good faith, trying to avoid putting ourselves in a position where we create a conflict between doing the right thing and commercial imperatives.
Short: This is a general use server being run by a UK organisation for the benefit of anyone who wants to use it as a home for now. Legal, safe, respectful content from thoughtful contributors welcome.

Description: The Sandbox - a semi-private Akkoma instance
This is my personal instance.

Hello!

This is the singular and personal Mastodon server for Bryce Chidester. It is wholly and exclusively operated and moderated by myself, Bryce Chidester. I created this instance, in part because I'm insane and like to torture myself, and because I was tired of being subject to others' decisions. (Nothing against my previous instance, it was exceptional, it's simply that I wanted to have full control.)

Moderation and Blocks

I believe I'm a reasonable individual, and make every effort to respond in a timely manner to reasonable inquiries. I will not tolerate instances that engage in racism, both-sidesism, sexism, genderism, and basically all the other terrible -isms and utterly stupid, antiquated and obsolete ideas there are.

Status

Status page available via status.cobryce.com
Short: This is the personal Mastodon/glitch-soc instance of Bryce Chidester

Description:
This is a small Mastodon instance run by a couple of SASÂ® Software enthusiasts as our new home in the fediverse. It's a place for us to post about SAS software, I.T., and other more general social media topics.

At this stage new signups are disabled on this server and we encourage you to create an account on one of the bigger Mastodon instances. You can still follow us from those other servers. If you still want an account here, are really into SAS software, and know us personally then contact us and we can send you an invite.

Please be aware that this instance uses Mastodon software and, as is the case with all Mastodon servers, as instance admins, we potentially have access to any data you post here, including DMs. Do not post private data here, even via DMs. Mastodon offers no E2E encryption so please use Signal or another E2E messaging app to exchange private messages.

SASÂ® and all other SAS Institute Inc. product or service names are registered trademarks or trademarks of SAS Institute Inc. in the USA and other countries. Â® indicates USA registration.

This proc.social site is not affiliated with SAS Institute Inc.
Short: A small Mastodon instance run by some SAS software enthusiasts.

Description:
Rules

No advertising or excessive promotion
No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
No pornography, nudity, or something that would be considered "NSFW" in a U.S. workplace, even behind a NSFW warning.
No gore or graphic violence
Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning)
No racism
No sexism
No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), caste, or national origin
No xenophobia or violent nationalism
No sexual depictions of children
No holocaust denialism, Nazi symbolism, promotion of National Socialism, or anything that is illegal in the European Union
No stalking or harassment
No fake accounts, even celebrity joke accounts. Note this rule does not necessarily apply to remote accounts.
No "follow bots." We block these and our instance is on a "no bots" list.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment. Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't; brands and non-humans (other than fun/useful bots) are banned. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your serviceâ€¦ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!)

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Emergency Alertodon is an instance set up to facilitate emergency messages from designated agencies and public information officers. While primarily serving Cumberland Goodwill EMS (which hosts the device) it may approve registrations from other emergency police, fire, EMS, or EMA agency users. Please note, though, while every effort is made to make sure this instance remains up and running, 100% runtime is not guaranteed.

Additionally, media, user archive, & content is only cached for 7 days to keep storage space functioning optimally.
Short: Emergency Alertodon is an instance set up to serve emergency alerts primarily from Cumberland Goodwill EMS and the greater Carlisle area. It also serves to provide health/safety Public info.

Description:
This is the dedicated Mastodon instance of Casa Quinnwitz, purveyors of all things writing, reading, coding, machine learning, running, eating, napping, and toddler-ing.

What we're here for

Truly, we're here for all the things that could have made social media a connective force: meeting new folks, learning new things, passing around memes, and generally enjoying the virtual company of others.

We're not here for "debates", or politics/religion (insofar as they're used merely as bludgeons), or to be Reply Guy. We are here to hear from folks whose thinking we admire, to bring light to areas of conversations commonly overlooked, and to otherwise make space for people who are marginalized.

We're also here for the memes.

Guidelines

If you know the admins personally, you have a good idea of what the guidelines are. If not, make sure you read the Server Rules below. They're summarized here:

Be subject to one another.

Also if you're not a West Wing fan, you probably also won't make it here.

Once you've joined

Introduce yourself! There aren't ever going to be a lot of us here, so introductions are a great way to make sure we're all familiar.

Support

This instance is run entirely in @magsol's spare time. If you've got some DevOps and/or programming experience and would be interested in helping, please don't hesitate to volunteer! If you'd instead like to provide financial support, that's absolutely not necessary, though deeply appreciated.

Description:
This is a single-user instance. As such, a Code of Conduct doesn't make much sense.

I will happily federate and engage with well meaning individuals with a default openness. That being said, I will block and defederate from any instance where moderation appears non-existent, as well as any instance where I see repeated evidence of poor behavior, including but not limited to: racism, colorism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, misinformation, propaganda, and white supremacism. I also reserve the right to defederate from any other server as I see fit.

As a single-user instance, it's very possible that my block list is not fully up to date since I tend to react to what I see. As such, I don't currently share my block list as it's not a good starting point for other admins to use.

This description was heavily influenced and inspired by Polymerwitch's server description.

Description:
Hello

I'm @mo. This is my own little instance. More things about me can be found on my profile or my website.

I'd been on Mastodon over five years before I set this up and defaulting to the fediverse. Some other inferior and defunct social network had trained me out of posting and participating.

Once available time and headspace permitted to do this properly, I chose to get my own instance going. This was partially to keep some control over its longevity, but also because there's something enjoyable about contributing to the economics of this thing than some pan-handling billionaire drug addict wanted for a tick.

(For the same reason, I also donate to instances that I think would most benefit from my support: feel free to bring any such thing to my attention.)

There's also a little bot living here that collects things I've posted elsewhere: links, blog posts, weeknotes and so forth.

A note on rules

As this is a personal instance with a single human user, and sign-ups are disabled, there aren't rules so much as guiding principles. These define how I prefer to conduct myself here, and the expectations I'd have about the conduct of others. Shouldn't be anything at all surprising here, but hey.

Broadly, anything hateful defined below, or that makes me uncomfortable, gets blocked without recourse. I'd also defederate from any instance hosting intolerant or discriminatory content, whether or not a particulate user is acting in violation of the instance's rules.
Short: A personal instance for Mo Morgan

Description:
Welcome to the 907.life Mastodon Instance!

907.life is a region-focused Mastodon instance that aims to serve the diverse communities of Alaska. Our goals are as follows:

  • Provide a safe and welcoming online space for discussing Alaskan art, culture, science, activities, news, politics, events, and life experiences; and
  • Provide a venue for both casual and serious conversation, with the ability for users to opt-out of unwanted content; and
  • Foster a community of individuals, organizations, and business who work together to make Alaska a better place.

If youâ€™re considering becoming a member of our community, please review our server rules and code of conduct before applying. This information will help you make an informed decision regarding joining this particular instance.

Contributions

Contributions to 907.life will first go to cover our costs with the awesome toot.io Mastodon hosting service.

The time dedicated from our instance admins and mods is free because we love you, and because we love Alaska. Therefore, any donations exceeding our monthly hosting costs will go straight to the Food Bank of Alaska, supporting their mission to feed hungry children, families, and seniors.

To donate, simply click on the Ko-fi link below:

ko-fi.com/907life

And to keep things transparent, we'll provide a monthly summary of how much we've spent on hosting, and how much we donate to Food Bank of Alaska.

Thanks for your support!
Short: 907.life is a region-focused Mastodon instance that aims to serve the diverse communities of Alaska.

Welcome to KobuKobu - a fork of Mastodon for language learning communities. Instead of translation, KobuKobu offers links and tools for language learning.

Right now, KobuKobu just supports Japanese. For posts in Japanese, there is a link that says "KobuKobu!" Click it, and it will add furigana to the text. Click the post, then click a Japanese word to see its dictionary entry.

Please be advised that the UI is pretty rough at the moment, and that this instance may go down periodically for updates. You may not want to make this your primary server. However: if you're interested in joining this instance, please do so. Just be ready for bugs. :-)

Dictionary entries Copyright (C) 2022 The Electronic Dictionary Research and Development Group. Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike Licence (V3.0)

Description:
This instance was created as a personal instance to remove the need to have my interactions managed for me. If I wish to block an instance, I can do that. However, on the other hand, if there are people I wish to engage with from an instance that was blocked because of some bad actors on that instance, I'm now able to make that choice for myself, as opposed to losing contact with my associates through no fault of theirs or mine.

This instance does not accept sign ups or other members. It is solely for the use of interacting with individuals of the Fediverse who I associate with, but are spread out across many different instances. Feel free to follow or interact with me!

Racism, bigotry, and general mistreatment of others will result in a block.

Farscape, Sci-Fi in general, and Music are my love languages

Description:
Who we are

Lianna (Digitalspork) had been experimenting with Mastodon and ActivityPub related applications and networking for a couple of years on her own, and decided to have a small server hosted by Masohost specifically for herself, her friends, and friends of friends.

Basic Rules

Content we do not allow that will lead to limiting of accounts or suspension includes but is not limited to

  • Harassment of any kind, this includes continued contact after being requested to stop.
  • Hate speech and bigotry (queerphobia, racism, colourism, antisemitism, xenophobia, sexism, ableism, etc).
  • Cryptocurrency, NFTs, or any other financial scams of any kind.
  • Malicious links and phishing are prohibited.
  • Untagged NSFW and violent content is prohibited.
  • No SWERFS or TERFs allowed.*

Moderation is at our discretion. We may limit accounts or servers that are acting in bad faith, spreading harmful content, or causing general issues.

Federation policy

We block instances that

  • Have no active prohibition against hate speech and bigotry.
  • Carry content illegal in the US, UK and Germany.

We will completely defederate with servers that we feel are unsafe or are consistently breaking our own guidelines.

Moderation of Federation with egirl.social is at our discretion and may occur for any reason.

Bot Crawlers are blocked by default using robots.txt as a standard.

Server Disclaimers:

Administered by a Transgender Indigenous Woman

Server Theme from Rolle - Source
Short:
A small server hosted by Mastohost and Administered by Digitalspork for friends and friends of friends who want a smaller and quieter existence.

We do not federate with Meta, Inc.

Short: pants removed successfully

Description:
The Enchanted Tavern

This server is for the geeks, the nerds, and their friends. We try to keep a chill and positive vibe here, unfettered by the whims and woes of the world. Herein, we talk about works of fiction, computers, video games, cosplay, tabletop and board games, and anything else that fits in the realm of "nerdy." We're a friendly bunch who look out for each other, because an adventuring party won't last long if nobody works together.

Pull up a seat and chat with us. There's enough stress in the world; we're not interested in what a little blue birdie told you, but we'd be happy to hear what you're celebrating today.

Code of Conduct

Follow these rules and we'll all get along just fine. We'll try to let you know when things change, but that could happen any time without warning.

Subject Matter

You can talk about almost anything here. No, it's not completely free speech because this is a private server, not a town hall. If you think something might cause upset, please unlist it. Please find one of the more general purpose Mastodon servers if this is a problem for you.

Discrimination and hate is not allowed here, full stop. It's unhealthy and not productive; everyone is better off without it.

Content

Content posted here is subject to the laws of the United States of America. If it's NSFW or might reasonably offend somebody, please unlist it and mark it as sensitive and provide a short text description of the content in the CW section of your post.

Nothing posted here is encrypted or private. Everything is stored in an Amazon S3 bucket on the public facing internet. Assume that absolutely everything uploaded to this server, including in DMs, is public. Use other communication channels for sensitive private conversations.

Nothing posted here is permanent. We will try to give our users notice in a reasonable amount of time before anything gets deleted or purged, but this service is not a cloud storage service and content uploaded here could vanish at any time.

As this server is part of the Mastodon federation, its content may be cached by other servers. As with anything posted to the internet, assume that once something is posted, it can never be permanently deleted by you.

Behavior

Please be on your best behavior. If you get riled up, please disconnect, step away, and cool down before continuing your conversation; it'll probably be there when you come back.

Some things that might get you blocked are:

  • Discrimination and hate
  • Flaming
  • Harassment or bullying
  • Sexual harassment
  • Promotion of violence
  • Spam

Bots

Only officially sanctioned bots are allowed on this server. At present, there are none. We will not be adding a Twitter relay.

Contact & Feedback

If you are having a problem with another user, please use the report feature.

If you have feedback or need to get in touch, please email us.
Short: A Mastodon server for nerdy folk with a penchant for role-playing, storytelling, and a fascination with fiction.

Description:
This Server is made available by Digital Science. When using this Server, we ask that you always respect others and do not do anything which is harmful, illegal or otherwise inappropriate. In particular, you must not do, or assist, encourage or permit any person to do, any of the following in respect of any part of this Server:

  • post, share or otherwise transmit anything that is unlawful, fraudulent, misleading, infringes or violates another's rights, pornographic, indecent, false, defamatory, derogatory, threatening, obscene, abusive, offensive, hateful, inflammatory or is likely to harass, upset, annoy, alarm, embarrass or invade the privacy of, any person, deceitful, promotes or advocates an unlawful act or activity, discriminatory, sexually explicit or violent;
  • post, share or otherwise transmit health or other sensitive personal information, classified, controlled unclassified or other regulated information, personal information of others, or anything which you are not authorised to post, share or transmit;
  • impersonate or misrepresent your affiliation with any person or entity; probe, scan, or test the vulnerability of any system or network;
  • tamper with, breach or otherwise circumvent any security or authentication measure;
  • access or use any non-public area / content or shared area you have not been invited to;
  • interfere with or disrupt any user, host, or network;
  • introduce, or otherwise use to facilitate the spread of, spyware or any other malware;
  • access or search by any means other than our publicly supported interfaces (for example, â€œscrapingâ€);
  • send unsolicited communications or spam;
  • send altered, deceptive or false source-identifying information, including â€œspoofingâ€ or â€œphishingâ€;
  • infringe any trademark, copyright (including design rights), database rights, or other intellectual property rights, or privacy or other rights, of any other person or breach any contractual or other legal duty;
  • violate or cause the violation of the law in any way or otherwise harm the reputation of Digital Science.

Digital Science may remove content from this Server at any time at its absolute discretion.

All users of this Server must be at least at least 16 years old and otherwise of legal age to form a binding contract

Please refer to the Digital Science Terms and Conditions for further details.

Description:
SociallyDental.org aims to bring together authoritative stakeholders from within the global Dental network, becoming a shared Social Media resource of dental knowledge, academic publications, training materials, News and events information.

Taking inspiration fromâ€¦ The Pandental Society steering group came together to broaden the horizons and provide networking with other Dental disciplines, consequently, a large number of delegates attended from outside of the four societies: BSP, BES, BSRD, BSSPD.

Everyone agrees that the 3 Pan-Dental Society Conferences of 2007, 2011 and 2016, were a great success and brought together the knowledge and practical expertise of all the disciplines in restorative dentistry. They also provided outstanding opportunities both to hear international experts in the field and to network with like-minded colleagues.

The conferences were of particular interest to General Dental Practitioners, Vocational Trainees, Specialists, Academics, Dental Technicians, Hygienists, Therapists, Nurses and Students, from around the world.
Short: The SociallyDental.org platform for Dental professionals, Dental Societies, Dental Educators and Dental students.

Description:
First Established in 1999, the SubspaceLink originally was a Star Trek fansite, it morphed in the early oughts to a site network containing other star trek fansites.

In the 2010s the site (and site network) mostly collapsed, but @nickmoline held onto the domain (using it mostly for email).

Now in the 2020s, as the Fediverse has made it possible to run your own social networks that interact with other social networks around the world, I wanted a place for Science Fiction and Fantasy fans to gather together on a social network of our own, while still being able to interact with other Mastodon social networks. The old SubspaceLink domain name seemed perfect for this, as the SubspaceLink is how you communicate in Star Trek.

Welcome to the newly revived SubspaceLink!
Short: First Established in 1999, the SubspaceLink originally was a Star Trek fansite, it morphed in the early oughts to a site network, now it is back as a Sci-Fi/Fantasy bent social network run on Mastodon

Description:
Official.Community - A private Mastodon server for verified accounts

Official.Community caters to personal and corporate accounts that desire an official Mastodon address. This is an invitation-only server that does not permit open registrations from the general public.

Eligible accounts

Only the following types of users may apply for an account on this server:

  1. Public individuals, with verified identity
  2. Trademarked brands
  3. Public organizations and non-profits

The advantages of creating a brand account on Official.Community are:

  1. Restricted registration ensures that bad actors are not able to create accounts and potentially threaten the serverâ€™s reputation, which would potentially lead to de-federation by other servers. Each brand applying for an account will be vetted prior to granting an account, to ensure a stable user community of brands. This ensures that the brandâ€™s content is accessible to the maximum possible audience without risk of â€œguilt by association.â€
  2. The domain name â€œofficial.communityâ€ provides an immediate benefit for brands seeking to establish their official presence on Mastodon without having to establish their own server or diluting their brand with server names that are unrelated to the brand. A username on the server such as @YourBrandHere@Official.Community keeps the focus on the brand identity rather than the server identity.

Server Rules

The server rules for content are available at https://official.community/about and generally forbid illegal, hateful, misleading, or explicit content.

Individual accounts

Usernames for individual accounts will be asked to follow the first name last name convention. For example, celebrity James T. Kirk could have usernames @JimKirk, @JamesTKirk, etc. Individuals must demonstrate a verified status, either as a â€œblue checkmarkâ€ on Twitter, having their own existing website and domain, or the equivalent.

Organization accounts

Usernames for organization accounts (e.g., corporate accounts, non-profit organization accounts, etc.) will be expected to utilize their trademark or known public moniker. For example, If Acme Corporation is trademarked as AcmeCorp, then usernames @Acme@Official.Community or @AcmeCorp@Official.Community could be used. Organizational accounts must also have a corresponding website, for verification (see below).

Verification

Users will be assisted by the admin of Official.Community in establishing the â€œgreen linkâ€ for verification to the domain associated with their brand. This consists of creating a link to the Mastodon profile on Official.Community from the brandâ€™s own domain, using the â€œrel=meâ€ link attribute.

Server funding

The server will be funded by voluntary Patreon donations. Please visit our Patreon page for Official.Community. Thank you!

Defederation policy

Official.Community seeks to preserve a safe environment for its userbase. Rather than make subjective decisions about defederation on a per-instance basis, Official.Community relies on the block list of flagship mastodon servers (e.g., mastodon.social) operated by the German non-profit Mastodon gGmbH. A white list of large and well-known servers that will not be defederated will also be prepared, to ensure that accounts on Official.Community are not blocked from communicating with their followers. These policies will be subject to review and revision as needed, and feedback from account holders is welcomed.
Short: Private server for branded companies and verified individuals

Description:
Welcome YABTM.us:

The Official Mastodon Server of the Yelling About Movies podcast

Â Who We Are

Yelling About Movies (#YabtM) is a video podcast on YouTube where a group of friends gets together to discuss movies, often with vigorous disagreements and petty personal insults.

What This Is

Yabtm.us is a Mastodon-based Fediverse instance run by the hosts of Yelling About Movies.

Why This Is

Seemed like a good idea at the time, much like hosting a weekly podcast, no one considered the amount of work it would be.

Why Are Signups Closed?

While we find our feet and figure out this whole "running a social media instance" thing, we're keeping the user count low.

Anything Else?

Uh, you could give us money if you want? DM the owner about that. Otherwise subscribe to our dumb podcast: YabtM - YouTube

Lexa's comfy place! Cosy chats about FFXIV, Gaming, Anime and Tech. No politics or internet drama please.

Safe space for those that need one ğŸ’•.

Contact Information

If you have questions or concerns about a post or user of this instance, please use Mastodon's the report function, alternatively contact the instance admin @Lexa, use the contact form here, or send an email to mastodon-enquiries@contact.comfy.blue.

Content and Moderation Policy

Comfy.Blue is designed to be a safe space that puts the mental health and well-being of it's users first. We ask that you use content warnings, or unlist posts concerning sensitive topics such as:

  • Politics
  • Human (or animal) pain or suffering (mental or physical)

Description:
We are Elestio, a managed open-source software services provider.

Our mission: Improve the open-source ecosystem by providing fully managed services for a large catalog of curated software, contributing to OSS projects, and also creating a recurring revenue for OSS authors.

Elestio was originally built by our founding technical team as an internal tool to manage thousands of virtual machines running open-source software in production environments used by millions of users, Fortune 100 companies, as well as startups, web agencies, and freelancers. Our proven team has been developing and refining Elestio's core technology for over 15 years, deploying and maintaining over 12,000 production services.

We share revenue with open-source authors participating in our program. This is a win-win to us. Open-source developers and communities get more resources to improve their softwares and our customers, staff and other stakeholders know that they are helping to support something really positive.

The goal is to create a sustainable ecosystem where open-source authors can focus on improving their software without any DevOps responsibilities, and without going into B2B/SaaS business models.

https://elest.io/
Short: This mastodon instance is hosted on Elest.io. We discuss about open-source software, self-hosting, CI/CD, development and more.

Description:
Jammer.social is a tiny invite-only Mastodon instance run by @mike. ğŸ”’

It's home to Ludum Dare's official feed, as well as the feeds of other services and bots related to Ludum Dare, the Jammer Network, Game Development, and Game Jamming.

Although we may have a "cool" domain, tiny servers like ours can be a difficult place to establish yourself in the Fediverse. To be seen, you need to be federated. That means chatting with and getting boosted by others. In addition to joining conversations, one of the best ways to connect and be discovered by others is via the local feed of a topical instance.

Some popular topical instances that follow us include:

  • https://mastodon.gamedev.place/public/local â€” GameDev
  • https://peoplemaking.games/public/local â€” GameDev ğŸ”“
  • https://hachyderm.io/public/local â€” Technology
  • https://fosstodon.org/public/local â€” OpenSource
  • https://mastodon.art/public/local â€” Art
  • https://tech.lgbt/explore â€” Technology, LGBTQIA+
  • https://infosec.exchange/public/local â€” Infosec
  • https://ioc.exchange/public/local â€” Infosec
  • https://indieweb.social/explore â€” OpenWeb, IndieWeb
  • https://newsie.social/public/local â€” Journalism
  • https://journa.host/public/local â€” Journalism
  • https://social.linux.pizza/explore â€” GNU, Linux
  • https://dice.camp/public/local â€” RPG, BoardGames
  • https://bitbang.social/public/local â€” Retro, Technology
  • https://vt.social/public/local â€” VTubers

To contrast, the local feed here is @mike, @ludumdare, as well as a few bots and friends: https://jammer.social/public/local. Very few (if anybody) follows this feed.

Large general instances like mastodon.social have a similar problem: They're too busy and varied to be seen on the local feed.

We highly recommend you join a topical instance, something related to your interests and goals. You're then to free to follow anyone from any other instance, including ours. That's the power of the Fediverse: no matter where you call home, we're all connected. You're free to move too! ğŸ¤

In the future we will be connecting your Ludum Dare accounts directly to the Fediverse (via custom Fediverse support on ldjam.com), but this will not be as full featured as having a Mastodon account. It's more of a bridge, letting you boost, like, and comment on content there, and as a user of ldjam.com get feedback from Fediverse users.

With that in mind, to keep our costs low and moderation work at near zero, Jammer.social is invite only. That said, if you have a good reason you think you should be here (i.e. you operate a popular jam, you're a well known figure in the game dev or jam space, you're Mike's friend/colleague and it makes sense, etc), reach out to @mike.

Fediverse Tips

  • EXTREMELY IMPORTANT: Fill in your profile! When you don't recognize someone, you click their profile to see who you're talking to. If you've never had a conversation with someone, unless you're on the same instance you wont see their message history, just your profile.

  • RECOMMENDED: Change your default posting privacy (Preferences -> Other -> Posting Privacy) to Unlisted. After that, you must click the little lock icon (ğŸ”“) to change the post privacy of your messages.

    IMPORTANT: After you do this, be sure you change your posts to public (ğŸŒ) any time you want to broadcast them to the greater Fediverse.

    This helps you be a good citizen of your topical instance, as your casual messages and replies will get omitted from the local instance feed (unless they're marked public ğŸŒ). Everybody doesn't need to see you say @jeff yes. ğŸ˜‰

  • Use #HashTags! You can't search across the Fediverse, but messages tagged with #HashTags will group together. This makes it easy to share, discover, or even mute topics.

  • Research your #HashTags! Though you can use anything as a #HashTag, some are more popular than others. For example, #GameDev and #GameDevelopment both get used, but #GameDev is more popular. Popular tags will be seen by more people.

  • You can follow #HashTags! This is a great way to discover people on busier servers. Some suggestions include: #LDJam, #GameDev, #GameJam, #IndieDev

  • Use UpperCamelCase (i.e. PascalCase, StudlyCaps, etc) in your #HashTags (i.e. capitalize the first letter of each word). This not only improves readability, but it's extremely important for screen readers. Without it, humans and screen readers could make crude mistakes with tags like #PenIsland and #SusanAlbumParty.

  • Talk to people! Be part of a conversation! Be social!

  • Share and show-off! Disregard anyone that suggests "no self promotion" hereâ€”This isn't Reddit, bedazzle everyone with your creativity and wit. ğŸ‰

  • Boost messages! Similar to "retweeting", boosting is the primary way you share things posted by others. There's no algorithms here that boost or hide messages, so we all depend on each-other to find and share content. We are a community.

  • Write alt-text for the photos and pictures you use. This not only helps the visually impaired, but can provide context clues and cues for readers that miss what you're looking to say with your picture.

  • Follow people with shared interests, or browse who they follow to find recommendations. Again since there's no algorithm that boosts things, we depend on each-other to find people.

  • Post an #Introduction message, and browse them. After setting up your account, this is a great way to find who to follow, or to reconnect with friends.

  • Don't be discouraged by a lack of likes, boosts, or followers! The Fediverse isn't like other social networks. Everyone's feed only shows messages with 0, 1 or 1+ likes and comments. It doesn't matter if they're a famous celebrity or the new kid. When your words resonate and get a boost, you're equal to everyone they boosted.

  • Be kind and respectful. Leave bigotry, racism, and homophobia behind. There's a human on the other end of that comment. The disabled, neurodiverse, LGBTQIA+, and furries are not your punching bags. Neither are kink and sex workers. If this ever becomes a problem, you can block people or entire instances with just a few clicks.

BONUS TIP: You can append ".rss" to any Mastodon user URL for an RSS feed. For example https://jammer.social/@ludumdare.rss is a feed of all messages posted by Ludum Dare.

Jammer.social is hosted on masto.host.
Short: The official Mastodon instance of Ludum Dare and the Jammer Network

Description:
Currently a single-user instance. Sign-ups disabled.

Runs on a linux box under my tv, Ireland, Europe.

This server came about as a meeting point between two ideas;

  1. My love of the 1996 film 'The Craft',

  2. The continuing influx of users from other platforms. Because it means a whole lot of people I know in real life are here now. And having grown up in a small town, I am very familiar with this sense of being seen, constantly. And how it alters my behaviour, to fit-in better. Sometimes I need a place where I'm not known, where I can just be.

So this is my part-time instance, where I can be a little extra.

We use the seirdy tier0 blocklists (https://seirdy.one/posts/2023/05/02/fediverse-blocklists/), and also block fbinsta.
Short: A place to go when you're feeling too weird for main.

Description:
About efd-o-don

This is a self-hosted (well, managed self-hosted) server, created to fulfill my latent nerdy tendencies and get a better understanding of what's involved in running/managing/admin-ing a Mastodon instance â€” or at least a Mastodon instance with managed hosting. (I'm not ready to wade into hosting completely on my own at this point.)

Can I join this server?

Maybe? New accounts are not open to the public, but if you're someone I know in real life, you're a kind and reasonable person, and you're interested in joining me here get in touch via DM or email (evan at wfmu dot org). Capacity is limited, though, since the hosting plan I have is a small one.

Other Rules

For now these are standards I hold myself to, as the only user. But if I were to add any other users they'd be expected to abide by these rules as well (TL/DR: don't be a jerk):

  1. No harassment of any kind, including (but not limited to) harassment related to age, body type, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual identity/orientation ethnicity, nationality, race, color, religion, personal appearance, education, or socio-economic status.

  2. Welcome others without regard to any of the factors mentioned above.

  3. Promote and contribute to a positive and supportive community environment.

  4. Examples of behavior that won't be tolerated include (but are not limited to):

    • Personal attacks
    • Disclosing personal/private information about someone else
    • Racism
    • Sexism
    • Discrimination
    • Xenophobic or nationalist statements
    • Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories

  5. Reasonable self-promotion is fine. Advertising is not.

  6. Sensitive content (gore, graphic violence, nudity, pornography) must be tagged with a content warning. But think twice about whether it needs to be posted in the first place.

  7. Don't mirror a social media account on another platform. Occasional cross-posting is fine.

  8. No spam or junk posts. The server admin has the final say on what qualifies as â€œjunk.â€

  9. No crypto BS.

Moderation

Any moderation of this instance is based on the admin's determination of whether content posted to this instance goes against our published rules. If you are concerned about content posted to other instances, please contact the administration of the instance.

Decisions of the judges are final. Les judges, c'est moi.
Short: EFD's self-hosted server, created to fulfill nerdy tendencies. By invitation only.

Description:
Welcome to Monoceros Digital Consulting's private Mastodon instance. This is the official social media home for our employees, contractors, and anybody else with an official connection to Monoceros.

We haven't opened up registrations on this server to the public, but we are in the business of helping you to get your own private instances. If you're looking to carve out your own private space in the fediverse, create a community for your team, church, school or neighbourhood, or if you'd like to stamp your company's brand in a new social media landscape, then talk to us. We'll get you started, and help keep you running, with the best advice on how to get the best Mastodon experience for you and your community.

Mail us at info@monoceros.co.za or chat directly at https://mastodon.monoceros.co.za/@uastronomer

Description:
Code of Conduct

Note: "Moss Haus" in this document refers to the Moss Haus Mastodon instance at https://moss.haus. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @thomas@moss.haus.

Moss Haus is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Moss Haus spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Patterns of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia"
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Moss Haus, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from Moss Haus based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Moss Haus spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Moss Haus. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Moss Haus spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Friend Camp members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

Who can join this instance?

Moss Haus is an intentional micro-community for folks looking to participate in a better and healthier form of social media. We hope to create and improve relationships between members. You don't have to know someone to join, but it helps! Given a desire to keep our instance at less than >20 members, we may ask inactive folks to migrate elsewhere.

If you're interested in joining, reach out to thomas@moss.haus.

What does this instance provide?

Moss Haus aims to provide:

  • The technological ability to interact with the Mastodonâ€compatible fediverse.
  • Conflict mediation, both between members of this instance and between individuals on this instance and the fediverse more broadly.
  • A local scene, wherein the people on the local timeline are likely to share interests and/or be friends with someone you know.

License

This was adapted from the Friend Camp Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain. Additional content was adapted from the GlitchCat.Family instance.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that Thomas Hils runs. He promises that he won't look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust him on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up "federated" -- basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn't leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other Moss Haus users, and only ever use our "local-only" posting mode which you learned about in your onboarding. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off. Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server. This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This privacy policy was adapted from the works of Friend Camp's privacy policy by Darius Kazemi and provided under a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Administrative Details

Technical

Moss Haus is hosted by Spacebear OÃœ in Estonia. This is subject to change without notice. The site should be fully accessible via IPv6 and modern HTTPS/TLS.

Local-only Posting

Posts/toots that have "Local-only" enabled in the web interface are not federated from moss.haus to any other instance. They are only visible to Moss Haus users (depending on the toot visibility setting).
Short: moss haus is an old cabin in the woods for friends. we are an intentionally small community. our friends have no tolerance for intolerance.

Be yourself
