Description:
BYTE HEAVEN is tekhedd's place. This means it's a place for games, music, pointing out the irony in self-contradictory things, and tech. And, naturally, cat pictures.

  • Sarcasm is encouraged here. If you have difficulty with humor, mute or block to taste.
  • If you can't make your point with logic, you might be wrong.
  • Kindness is encouraged. If you can't do it nicely, take a break.

There is the usual list of "rules" but the core rule is: be ethical and considerate. None of the "rules" make sense if you can't be aware of context and behave appropriately.

Server population is kept severely limited. But, feel free to ask if you feel like you'd like to land here.

If we can't understand it, we can't moderate it, so... English only pls.

"Any fool knows a dog needs a home and shelter from pigs on the wing."

Description:
Introduction

Weaviate Community is set up for people that share an interest in the optimization of search engines. This feed collates the latest information on topics such as combining vector search and cloud-native databases, all accessible through GraphQL, REST various language clients. Anyone can post links, images, videos, and text to this feed. Our idea of "Search" spans from the vector search to keyword search in Weaviate and everything in between.

This is a gentle reminder to be respectful and work collaboratively on everything beyond search.

Please read more about this in the Code of Conduct section.

Weaviate in a nutshell:

Weaviate is an open source â€‹database of the type â€‹vector search engine. Weaviate allows you to store JSON documents in a class property-like fashion while attaching machine learning vectors to these documents to represent them in vector space. Weaviate can be used stand-alone (aka bring your vectors), with a wide variety of modules that can do the vectorization for you or extend the core capabilities. Weaviate has a GraphQL-API to access your data easily. â€‹We aim to bring your vector search set up to production to query in mere milliseconds! Check our open-source benchmarks to see if Weaviate fits your use case. Get to know Weaviate in the basics getting started guide in under five minutes.

Weaviate in detail:

Weaviate is a low-latency vector search engine with out-of-the-box support for different media types (text, images, etc.). It offers Semantic Search, Question-Answer Extraction, Classification, customizable models (PyTorch/TensorFlow/Keras), etc. Built from scratch in Go, Weaviate stores both objects and vectors, allowing for combining vector search with structured filtering and the fault-tolerance of a cloud-native database, all accessible through GraphQL, REST, and various programming languages client.

Weaviate helpsâ€¦

Software Engineers (docs) - Who use Weaviate as an ML-first database for your applications. Out-of-the-box modules for: NLP/semantic search, automatic classification and image similarity search. Easy to integrate into your current architecture, with full CRUD support like you're used to from other OSS databases. Cloud-native, distributed, runs well on Kubernetes and scales with your workloads. Data Engineers (docs) - Who use Weaviate as a vector database that is built up from the ground with ANN at its core, and with the same UX they love from Lucene-based search engines. Weaviate has a modular setup that allows you to use your ML models inside Weaviate, but you can also use out-of-the-box ML models (e.g., SBERT, ResNet, fasttext, etc). Weaviate takes care of the scalability, so that you don't have to. Deploy and maintain ML models in production reliably and efficiently. Data Scientists (docs) - Who use Weaviate for a seamless handover of their Machine Learning models to MLOps. Deploy and maintain your ML models in production reliably and efficiently. Weaviate's modular design allows you to easily package any custom trained model you want. Smooth and accelerated handover of your Machine Learning models to engineers.

Features

Weaviate makes it easy to use state-of-the-art ML models while giving you the scalability, ease of use, safety and cost-effectiveness of a purpose-built vector database. Most notably: Fast queries Weaviate typically performs a 10-NN neighbor search out of millions of objects in considerably less than 100ms. Any media type with Weaviate Modules Use State-of-the-Art ML model inference (e.g. Transformers) for Text, Images, etc. at search and query time to let Weaviate manage the process of vectorizing your data for you - or import your own vectors. Combine vector and scalar search Weaviate allows for efficient combined vector and scalar searches, e.g â€œarticles related to the COVID 19 pandemic published within the past 7 daysâ€. Weaviate stores both your objects and the vectors and make sure the retrieval of both is always efficient. There is no need for third party object storage. Real-time and persistent Weaviate lets you search through your data even if itâ€™s currently being imported or updated. In addition, every write is written to a Write-Ahead-Log (WAL) for immediately persisted writes - even when a crash occurs. Horizontal Scalability Scale Weaviate for your exact needs, e.g., maximum ingestion, largest possible dataset size, maximum queries per second, etc. High-Availability Is on our roadmap and will be released later this year. Cost-Effectiveness Very large datasets do not need to be kept entirely in memory in Weaviate. At the same time available memory can be used to increase the speed of queries. This allows for a conscious speed/cost trade-off to suit every use case. Graph-like connections between objects Make arbitrary connections between your objects in a graph-like fashion to resemble real-life connections between your data points. Traverse those connections using GraphQL.

Documentation

You can find detailed documentation in the developers section of our website or directly go to one of the docs using the links in the list below. https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/current/

Video Weaviate introduction video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IExopg1r4fw

Examples You can find code examples here - https://github.com/semi-technologies/weaviate-examples

Support Stack Overflow for questions - https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/weaviate GitHub for issues - https://github.com/semi-technologies/weaviate/issues Slack channel to connect - https://join.slack.com/t/weaviate/shared_invite/zt-goaoifjr-o8FuVz9b1HLzhlUfyfddhw Newsletter to stay in the know - http://weaviate-newsletter.semi.technology/

Contributing How to Contribute - https://weaviate.io/developers/contributor-guide/current/
Short: This is the Mastodon server of the Weaviate vector database!

Description:
Bnuy.Space was created with the idea in mind, to combine queer, furry and game dev topics into one place. If you locate yourself within this niche, feel free apply for registration. However, as long as you stick to the rules of this instance & german laws, you may toot about other topics as well. (:

Why do you need to apply for registration? Currently this instance is only administered by me (@LunarAkai) in my freetime. Because of that I want to limit the influx of people to what I can moderate. Thanks for your understanding.

This instance is a non-commercial venture with no advertising.

Mastodon instance run by @LunarAkai@bnuy.space. For updates on the development of the instance please follow @bnuy.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License (Prefixed with "ms_").

This instance uses OpenMoji emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Share Alike License 4.0 (Prefixed with "open_").

This instance uses the BunHD, Neofox and Floof, Emoji Packs. BunHD is licensed under Apache 2.0 ("bunhd"). Neofox and Floof are licensed under CC BY-NC-SA ("neofox" / "floof")

Rules

We acknowledge that rules will never be comprehensive or cover every possible situation. Our instance rules are meant to be respected closely in cases that they do cover and to inform how we act in cases where they aren't explicit. Always try to act in the spirit of these rules.

This instance is hosted in Germany. All content posted on bnuy.space must abide by German laws and regulations regardless of our own rules.

General

As members of bnuy.space we accept these rules and commit to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for ourselves and others.

We do not tolerate oppression of people on the basis of who they are. This includes but is not limited to: gender, race, ethnicity, language, body size and shape, religion or spirituality, nationality, age, disability and sexual orientation.

We define oppression as any language or action that expresses, reinforces, upholds or sympathizes with any form of systemic social domination.

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • harassment, both individual and coordinated
  • insults and derogatory language
  • trolling (trying to deliberately provoke someone)
  • threats
  • doxxing (publishing of personal information without consent)

Content Warnings

The following types of content should be posted with a Content Warnings (CW) when they appear on the public timeline:

  • violence (depiction and graphic description)
  • self harm and suicide
  • dieting and eating disorders
  • citing/quoting content that would violate any of our rules, including screenshots of such content
  • visual media with rapid flashing/blinking

Nudity, Sex and Sex Work, Kink

Discussion and depiction of sexual, erotic, kinky and sex-work related content is explicitly allowed on bnuy.space as long as it's not illegal in Germany.

Anything that falls into these categories should be posted with a content warning and media marked as sensitive when the post appears on a public timeline.

Other users should only be tagged in these posts if they have consented to it.

Accessibility

Visual media that is posted to the public timeline should always have a text description that conveys its content accurately to someone who cannot see the image.

We avoid large clusters of non-text characters (e.g. Emoji and "glitchy text"), and refrain from using them in usernames at all unless we have actually tested how they are pronounced by a screen-reader and that it doesn't inhibit reading the timeline.

Creative Works

When posting works created by others (e.g. photos, artworks, comics, music, video, etc.), include attribution for the original artist/creator. If possible link back to their original post.

This rule does not apply to the citing of popular media, for example a screenshot or GIF from a movie, or things like memes.

Crypto

We don't tolerate promotion of any cryptocurrency, NFTs, de-fi, and related projects.

Impressum / Imprint

Angaben gem. Â§ 5 TMG:

Leonie Luna Freitag

c/o Grosch Postflex #2033

48268 Greven

Server

Ce serveur Mastodon est dÃ©diÃ©e Ã  l'actualitÃ© des arts de la scÃ¨ne en Suisse et Ã  la sauvegarde de leurs traces. Il a Ã©tÃ© mis en place et est administrÃ© par la Fondation SAPA (https://sapa.swiss).

Dieser Mastodon-Server ist den Darstellenden KÃ¼nsten in der Schweiz in ihrer gesamten Vielfalt sowie der Sicherung ihrer Spuren gewidmet. Er wurde von der Stiftung SAPA eingerichtet und wird von dieser verwaltet (https://sapa.swiss).

This Mastodon server is dedicated to the performing arts in Switzerland in all its diversity as well as to the preservation of its traces. It was set up and is managed by the SAPA Foundation (https://sapa.swiss).

Instance rules

Adapted from the tooting.ch Code of Conduct

Please note that the rules below should not be considered a legal document and may be interpreted by the moderation team of info.performing-arts.ch as they see fit. This is only an overview which provides you with the general moderation policies you'll have to expect when using this instance.

Offenses against the rules can generally be categorized as one of the following:

  • Minor offenses
  • Moderate offenses
  • Major offenses

Minor offenses

Minor offenses will be handled by removing the content in question, hiding sensitive content behind a content warning or issuing a warning to the offending user. The risk of facing consequences like account suspension after one minor offense is very low.

The following list is an (incomplete) list of actions that count as a minor offense:

  • Nudity, pornography or other explicit material without content warning ( or CW) and appropriate description
  • Gore or extreme violence without content warning and appropriate description
  • Excessive advertising, be it manual or automated
  • Uncurated cross-posting from third-party sources such as news sites

Moderate offenses

Content that counts as moderate offense will lead to removal of the offending content. Additionally, depending on the circumstances, further actions that range from a warning to account suspension are likely to be taken.

  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Discrimination against minorities of any kind or advocation thereof
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism or advocation thereof
  • Stalking or harassing other users or encouraging others to do so
  • Doxing, that is, aggregating, posting or spreading a user's private data, or encouraging others to do so, without their express permission
  • Brigading or dogpiling, that is, continuously engaging another user in conversation or discussion after said user has asked for this engagement to stop

Major offenses

If content is classified as a major offense, it is removed and leads to an immediate suspension of the offending account. Furthermore, the account holder will be reported to the authorities if appropriate and applicable.

  • Explicit depictions of children
  • Content illegal in Switzerland, such as hate speech
  • Promotion of the ideology of national socialism
  • Impeding other users' access to or degrading the performance of this instance or the attempt thereof
Short: This server is dedicated to the performing arts in Switzerland in all its diversity as well as to the preservation of its traces. It was set up and is managed by the SAPA Foundation (sapa.swiss)

Description:
English instance for my friends and family. Rules are pretty strightforward:

  1. All NSFW/Graphic content must be tagged - no NSFW/Graphic content in Profile images or headers.
  2. No willful propagation of misinformation. Some things are verifiable fact, and acting in bad faith that they are not is unacceptable, will result in account suspension.
  3. No Nazis, no Nazi-adjacencies. No lolicon, no pedos. No spreading of any of that shit. Period.
  4. Be respectful and decent to those with whom you interact - No doxxing, no harassment, no bigotry.
  5. Bots are permitted, but any account that primarily automates posts must be flagged as a bot account.

Moderation Policies

Admins will silence and suspend domains that demonstrate a lack of interest or unwillingness to address the behavior of their members. These de-federations will be published publicly. Demonstrated unwillingness might be in the form of multiple instance admins reporting lack of engagement from the instance in question, or ongoing and/or widespread bad behavior by members of the instance in question.

Regarding members of this server, if admins are made aware of instances of behavior in violation of the above, they will be acted on. Itâ€™s in the adminâ€™s discretion what action to take, but will tend toward having a conversation with the member before silencing or suspending accounts.

Description:
Hi, I'm Brian Morrison!

Welcome to my personal Mastodon instance. I'm hosting this instance as a fun new place to communicate and share content with others. I'm hoping this will be a great way to connect with friends, family, colleagues, and more.

I'm looking forward to connecting with you here, so come join me and let's explore the world of Mastodon together!

- Brian

What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is an open-source decentralized social network that works in a similar manner to Twitter, but it has no central server architecture. Instead, different servers (called instances) are run independently of each other. This means that the content and conversations happening on each instance is kept separate from the others.

This also allows users to follow people across multiple instances, making it a great way to connect with people who might not be on your own instance.

Here's a great video explaining in more detail:

Watch What is Mastodon? on YouTube
Short: Hi, welcome to Brian Morrison's personal Mastodon instance.

Description:
The MacMynatt Social Code of Conduct

Welcome!

MacMynatt Social is a Mastodon instance for people who I, Blair MacIntyre, know and are looking for a smaller home for a personal account on Mastodon.

I want our 'local' timeline to have the feel of a family gathering.

I do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

I want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.

Folks asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone.

Unacceptable Behavior

The following behavior is not welcome anywhere:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion.
  • Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism.
  • Deliberate or persistent misgendering.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Publishing any individual's address, phone number, or other private identifying information without consent.
  • Sexual depictions of any sort.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention, including sharing sexual content with specific users without consent.
  • Gratuitous sexual images or behavior.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Continued communications with someone who's asked that you leave them alone.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.

The following behavior is not allowed on the public timeline:

  • Graphic violent or sexual content.
  • Gratuitous advertising or spam. It's fine to promote your work, but it shouldn't be the bulk of what you share.

Known Harassers

I may ban or silence users known to be harassers or abusers, even if they have not violated the rules of this instance. The mere presence of a harasser can make past or potential victims uncomfortable, and it can put potential victims who are unaware of the person's history in particular danger. Users are encouraged to individually mute, block, and/or report accounts they don't want to see.

At my discretion and without explanation, I may take the additional step of blocking or silencing someone instance-wide if I believe they endanger the safe and welcoming space I'm trying to maintain.

Similarly, I may block other Mastodon instances if they are the source of harassment or unacceptable content.

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact me. I will respond as promptly as I can but keep in mind that I have work and a family.

I will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At my discretion, I may publicly name a person about whom Iâ€™ve received harassment complaints or privately warn third parties about them. I will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, I may take any action I deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom I've received complaints.

Credits and License

This document was based on the about page of the Wider Web mastodon instance, which in turn based it on the Wandering Shop.

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy.

Description:
This is a private Mastodon instance made available primarily to immediate family members of the server administrator.

The server is a virtual machine hosted in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia, and as such, is subject to the laws governing digital platforms in this state. The instance is volunteer-run. Posts from remote Fediverse instances is stored for a maximum of one week (7 days), and will be automatically pruned after that period for technical reasons.

Back-ups of the instance are made nightly, with point-in-time snapshots kept for a maximum of 12 months for disaster-recovery purposes.

By posting content to this server (either directly or through remote instances), you agree:

  • to permit the content you post (including your profile) to be mirrored by this server for the purpose of displaying that content to other users (in accordance with post privacy settings)
  • to comply with local (to this server) laws regarding prohibited content (such as Child Sexual Abuse Material, misinformation and unlicensed copyrighted content)
  • "rights" allegedly granted in foreign jurisdictions (outside Australia) are only recognised here if equivalent "rights" are granted under local (within Queenland) laws. (For example absolute "Freedom of Speech" is NOT a right granted under Australian constitutional law.)
  • any content you publish is assumed by default to be "Your" work, either material you have generated yourself, or from whom you have rights (implied or explicit) to re-publish on the Fediverse system

Remote instances may interact with this server (federation) under the following conditions:

  • Remote instances are permitted to mirror content (posts, profiles) for the purpose of displaying said content to users on that remote instance.
  • Remote instances are forbidden from using content (posts, profiles) from users of this instance that have explicitly "opted out" of search (by means of the "Privacy/Reach" profile preferences), from indexing those users' profiles or posts in search engines' databases.
  • Remote instances are forbidden from using content (posts, profiles) from this server in training machine learning systems for the purpose of generating new content ("generative artificial intelligence") unless each piece of used content is approved by its author/poster in writing for such use in advance.
  • Where content is "generated" using content from this server, the author/poster of the source material used in the "generated" content is granted a royalty-free license to re-use and re-license said generated content as they see fit.

Copyright holders: Content on this server may be received via users of third-party systems in addition to local users. If content displayed here has been posted in violation of your licensing requirements, please contact the server administrator.

  • If the user is a local user (their fediverse ID is of the form @${USER}@longlandclan.id.au), content originates from this server, we endeavour to have the material removed as soon as practical.
  • If the user is a remote user (their fediverse ID is of the form @${USER}@${DOMAIN} where ${DOMAIN} is NOT "longlandclan.id.au"), the content has been mirrored from a user on another instance. Your best avenue is to contact the administrator of that remote server directly (you may send this server administrator a courtesy copy) as the content may be mirrored elsewhere too. If you need help getting in touch with the remote server administrator, contact us here and we'll try to help out. Content retention on this server for such users will automatically remove the material after 7 days without administrator intervention.
  • This server is volunteer run, and so whilst administrators are "usually" online, it is possible that responses may take longer than they would for a commercially run social network. As such, response times may extend beyond 24 hours due to time-zone differences and personal availability. We ask that copyright holders please be patient when requesting material be removed.
Short: A private server for my family members.  A longlandclan.id.au email address is required for registration.

Description:
Single-user instance for Markus Unterwaditzer. As a result there is not really anything interesting in terms of server policies or content rules.

Very unlikely to (intentionally) host NSFW content, and if so it will be behind a CW and marked as sensitive media.

If there is any problem with this instance or its contents I strongly prefer email communication to admin@woodland.cafe over pinging me on Mastodon itself. I cannot guarantee that the message does not get lost otherwise.

Technical details

  • Theme: Modern Mastodon
  • Theme: Tangerine UI

Adjacent services

  • Bookmark RSS is a tool to let users on any mastodon instance subscribe to their bookmarks via RSS.
  • Boost Graph, runs entirely in the browser.
  • RSSHub, for subscribing to other social media platforms via RSS.
  • List Bot, for (ab)using Mastodon's list feature to build alternative home feeds.

Random projects

  • @a11y_link_bot
  • Every Evrart

Mirrors/Frontends

  • Nitter, a Twitter mirror.
  • Breezewiki, a Fandom mirror.
  • Libreddit, a Reddit mirror.
Short: Private, single-user instance for Markus Unterwaditzer: https://unterwaditzer.net

Description: Akkoma: The cooler fediverse server

Tras la Ãºltima compra de Twitter, muchos nos dimos cuenta de que las plataformas centralizadas tienen fallos fundamentales.

La redescentralizaciÃ³n es una respuesta a esos fallos. El Fediverso ofrece un modelo alternativo para reconstruir las redes sociales en una red de redes que se parece mÃ¡s a los diseÃ±os originales de Internet precomercializados.

En este servidor, federate.blogpocket.com, queremos ser fieles a los mismos valores que nos impulsaron en 2001 a participar activamente en la revoluciÃ³n de los blogs. Queremos desarrollar y cultivar, en colaboraciÃ³n, una cultura de comunidad.

Te proponemos:

  • Desacelerar. Hemos sido condicionados para exigir estimulaciÃ³n y gratificaciÃ³n inmediatas y constantes. Construir un nuevo mundo requerirÃ¡ tiempo, trabajo y paciencia, pero serÃ¡ mÃ¡s gratificante. Piensa en esto mÃ¡s como plantar un jardÃ­n que simplemente reemplazar lo que ya estÃ¡s condicionado a esperar.
  • Experimentar. Hemos sido condicionados para aceptar cualquier diseÃ±o de grandes plataformas en su mejor interÃ©s. Necesitamos un lugar para diseÃ±ar otras formas de imaginar cÃ³mo interactuar juntos en lÃ­nea.
  • Participar tranquilamente. Esperamos que experimentes la liberaciÃ³n de comunicarse sin las presiones de cosechar compromiso y atenciÃ³n. En cambio, si has estado en esto el tiempo suficiente, es posible que recuerdes cÃ³mo se sentÃ­a Internet antes de que las grandes plataformas dominaran nuestras experiencias.

Description:
This Mastodon instance is private for the moment

It could change later according to demand and server stability.

About the server

The actual infrastructure is both a test and a little challenge, it is aimed to evolve later, maybe on K8S cluster.

Please note current issues with the ISP's router can cause the instance to be sometimes momentarily down.

Hardware

VMs are mainly running on a Proliant ML350 G8
CPU is Xeon E5-2690 (8/16) shared over all the VMs
RAM is Quad channel 1600MHz
SSD Storage on a 800GB SAS HGST disk
HDD Storage on a HW RAID5 of 10K HGST disks
Redondant PSU, one on UPS

Infrastructure

The instance is running over 4 VMs with variable specifications:

  • Reverse proxy with caching
  • Dedicated PostgreSQL Database
  • On premise S3 objects storage (MinIO)
  • Mastodon instance

Backup

Daily snapshot based disk backup
Monthly tape backup

Description:
This Mastodon instance is intended for folx based in the Pacific Northwest, aka in the Cascadia Bioregion. This doesn't mean you have to live here to join, just that this area is where we would like to focus our effort.

We think that social media can be extremely useful, but the idea of a "global square" is inherently problematic, because it tends to strip people of the context in which they are otherwise normally immersed. That isn't always bad, but it does seem to increase the chances that people just shout at each other angrily.

The structure of Mastodon allows for less everyone-to-everyone communication and more "local" interaction. We are trying to intentionally enhance that by focusing on community building (online and off) in the place we live and work.
Short: This mastodon instance is intended for folks in the Cascadia area, focused on a slower, more decentralized, more localized form of social media.

Description: Social media owned by you

The Goblin Market is a small Mastodon instance focusing on creativity. Registrations are by invitation only.

General Information

The Goblin Market is an independent community-run instance and is not affiliated with the joinMastodon.org (tootsuite) organization.

Moderation Team

  • @lazcorp - Instance Admin

The Goblin Market is currently being run as a single user instance, but when it opens up registrations (by invitation only) some time in 2024 then a moderation team will start to be added.

Copyright

All original content is copyrighted by the artist and cannot be distributed or used without prior permission by the artist. Do not repost or disseminate our artists' original content anywhere without their express permission.

The Goblin Market cares about your privacy and doesn't monetise or profit off of your personal information or art â€” your information is never for sale.

Hosting Information

The Goblin Market is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host.
Short: The Goblin Market is an English-speaking instance focused around the arts, currently being test-driven as a single-user instance.

Description:
This is a GoToSocial server run by StoryDragon! Let's Go To a Social future! Let's go to some social dragons! If you do really believe that I have blocked an instance that should not be blocked, you can send me an email. That does not mean, however, that I will unblock the instance. I will take another look at it, though.

This instance uses (part of) the Blobhaj emoji pack by Heatherhorns. (CC BY-SA 4.0)
This instance uses Volpeon's dragon emoji as well. (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)
The calculator dragon emoji has been made by myself.

The hope is that federated networks can replace artist communities dependent on Meta for their promotion, portfolios and events. Feel free to use this instance to share your work and build out your creative community. From here it is possible to connect with anyone across the federated networks, you are not limited to just the accounts present on Salva.ge itself.

Description:
Welcome to Akiba.Social

A place for old-school otakus, new-school otakus, and any other kind of otaku in between. It doesn't matter where you're from, it doesn't matter how old you are.

Our aim is to create a cozy space for anyone in the OTAKU spectrum.

This place is for you if you:

  • Like Anime or Dorama
  • Like JPop, JRock, Citypop or Japanese Tradicional Music
  • Like Japanese videogames (retro or new, mobile or console)
  • Like Cosplay (doing or just taking pictures)
  • Like Japanese Culture Conventions
  • Like Maid Cafes (right?)
  • Like Japanese Giant (or small) ROBOTS!
  • Like any other kind of Japanese Culture we were too lazy to list!

Moderation

We follow the Benevolent Dictatorship (TM) moderation style with loose rules but strict moderation, which means this place is not a democracy and the AD staff has the last word about anything.

However, we are also people, and better than that, cool people (we promise, kira! âœ¨) and want the best for our users. So don't be shy and inquire any doubt to our AD staff, and they will try to answer as soon as possible in the best way possible.

Notice: We don't plan to use this power indiscriminately, but our lawyer at Wright & Co. Law Offices told us to keep it clear since the beginning.

That said, some points of attention:

This is a SMALL server.

At the moment of writing this server is managed by only 2 people on a not-so-limited but not state-of-art infrastructure. We may open/close new registrations at any given time without previous notification (we will notify you at the moment of change, though) for the benefit of our server stability.

We are also not prepared to handle a huge intake of users, so please don't create accounts just because or multiple alt accounts if you don't plan to really use it.

This is a THEMED SERVER.

As you may have noticed, this is a JAPANESE CULTURE themed server and will focus on this kind of content. If you have no interest in Japanese Culture we politely ask you to avoid creating an account here and choose a bigger and with more resources instance. There are many more mastodon instances out there, and we are sure you'll find one for you.

Fediverse Friendly Moderation Covenant

This instance commits to the following

1. Administration and Moderation will be handled as neutral as possible

Reports and widespread information on specific instances (often known as bad actors) will be verified and actions might be taken as necessary.

2. Actions taken will respond to the bare minimum to keep the network operating and not influence the ability of the instances users to connect to other people

  • If another instance spreads media content of questionable legality for the region the current instance is operating from, these files might be rejected from being saved.
  • If another instance is sharing hateful messages that impact local users, there might be consideration of silencing that specific instance from being visible in timelines. If users follow and/or wish to follow users on the target instance, they are still free to do so.
  • If another instance is posting content illegal in the local instance operation region or actively posts content attacking local users, a full instance block might be the last resort.

3. Communication before Actions

If any of the above behaviours start to surface from a given instance, the moderation of the local instance will attempt to inform the moderation/administration of that instance and resolve the problems coming from there. Only if no communication succeeded or no results that resolved issues came forth, actions will be taken towards that instance.

4. We won't recommend blocks

Blocklists and block recommendations as an information source are taken for granted but lack accurate verification. Instead of using these options to publicly announce instances of questionable intent, we will inform local users of such, with the reminder of possible personal options for hiding content that might impact their experience of the network.

5. No Guilt-by-Association/Federation

If we have applied any action against Instance X, an Instance Y that federates with them will not get the same judgement applied to them. A natural connection, as by the networks design, does not imply shared interests and thus doesn't warrant the same moderation methods.

Regardless of all given points above, in special cases the instance moderation/administration might still opt to block an instance, while this is tried to be avoided at most.

This Covenant is based on The Fediverse-Friendly Moderation Covenant and is licensed under CC0

Moderation limits

The current moderation team can moderate content in the following languages:

  • English
  • Portuguese
  • Japanese (æ—¥æœ¬èªã§OK)

Content in any other language will be moderated using auto-translation tools (google translate, deepL) and are subject to moderation failure and a higher chance of contact by an AD staff.

AD Staff (Moderation Team)

  • @densha
  • @moon

Instance Matrix Room

  • #akiba:mozilla.org

Instance Gaming Chat

  • Akiba @ Guilded

Instance Emoji List

Yes, we have a emoji instance list.

Reporting

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to punitive action and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another.

That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted.

Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Code of Conduct This Code contains the rules and principles for participating in the recoveryposse.social community. It is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document, so the recoveryposse.social team may amend it from time to time.

Goals Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristic. Create a supportive community, where people freely share their recovery and are excited and positive about each otherâ€™s successes. Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content and from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community. Principles that Guide us We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything that violates these rules or principles and remain a member of our community. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here. The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want, if what you post follows these rules, principles and the goals outlined above. Not every member of the community will appreciate controversial or explicit posts so use Content Warnings very liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit. Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome in recoveryposse.social. We will moderate accordingly. This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you choose to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it. Rules for posting The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in recoveryposse.social: Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about inflammatory subjects at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases, but it is never acceptable to post inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning. Do not post any type of nudity without a Content Warning. Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. If you are here only to sell your products or services, you will be removed. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when the vast majority of a user's posts are commercial in nature, we regard the account as a Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case by case basis. Do not engage in name calling, ad hominem attacks, or any other uncivil behavior. Criticize ideas, never people. Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful, or just donâ€™t like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation. Moderation Principles Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from recoveryposse.social when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times, or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in suspension of the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isnâ€™t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for recoveryposse.social, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or otherwise are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the discretion of the moderation team, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Staff This server has the following administrators: @wbhm

The server has the following moderators: @wbhm

Description:
What is Clacks?

Clacks is a fully inclusive Mastodon server instance based in Australia.

What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is free and open-source software for running self-hosted social networking services. It has microblogging features similar to Twitter, which are offered by a large number of independently run nodes, known as instances, each with its own code of conduct, terms of service, privacy policy, privacy options, and content moderation policies.

Where does the name Clacks come from?

In Terry Pratchett's Discworld series, the clacks are a series of semaphore towers loosely based on the concept of the telegraph. Invented by an artificer named Robert Dearheart, the towers could send messages "at the speed of light" using standardised codes.
Short: Clacks is a fully inclusive Mastodon server instance based in Australia.

Description:
Mastodon's MyThoughtProcess.info is a new general-purpose private instance. It was established in late 2022 as a private instance to be able to post, share and gather with friends and like minded people.

ALL CONTENT IN THIS INSTANCE SHOULD BE CONSIDERED POTENTIALLY NSFW. POSTING OF NUDITY AND SEXUAL(IZED) CONTENT MAY OCCUR.

This instance is fully intended to be an echo chamber of moderate views and highly intense discussion and debate.

If you believe you may be offended, don't join. If you believe you will be offended, DO NOT JOIN. If the human body, or controversial language ever offend you, at all... DO NOT JOIN THIS SERVER!

General Information Abuse / Harassment: If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." Moderators may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

This server does NOT follow the Mastodon Server Covenant, as rule #1 has too much potential to conflict with my belief in free speech. In particular, the specific notation that "Users must have the confidence that they are joining a safe space, free from white supremacy". The modern application of the phrase "white supremacy" has become distorted, and a tool of manipulation for those that would choose to silence dissenting discourse!

To be clear, THE OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF THIS SERVER ARE STILL NOT GOING TO TOLERATE OR ALLOW ANY EXPRESSION THAT INCITES HATE OR VIOLENCE!

  1. We agree to active moderation against RADICAL racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  2. We agree to daily backups to ensure your data is safe.
  3. We are working on having backup administrators ready to operate this server in emergencies or my unexpected absence.
  4. In the unlikely event this instance shuts down, we agree to give our users a 3 month period to migrate to another instance.

As a general-purpose instance, we do not have heavy moderation in terms of what topics people are allowed to post about. However all users are expected to follow our rules at all times, and generally be nice and friendly on the federation.

Please report all content you see which might violate our rules for evaluation. If you are on a remote server, please forward any reports of our users to our server for our moderators to take action. We pledge that remote reports will remain confidential within our moderation team and will not be used for any form of retribution against the reporter. NO PERSON SHOULD EVER BE SCARED TO REPORT ON QUESTIONABLE CONTENT! EVERY PERSON HAS A RIGHT TO THEIR OPINION, AND WE HAVE THE RIGHT TO REVIEW AND AGREE OR DISAGREE WITH THOSE OPINIONS!!!

Legal ADULT CONTENT: This server MAY be host to incidental adult content. While this server does not oppose the posting of adult content, the server owners and operators expect ALL content, posters AND subscribers to adhere to the legal requirements of their local, regional, national and international laws!

POSTING SEXUALLY EXPLICIT CONTENT INVOLVING MINORS OR ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY (including content of a non-sexual nature, that may still be illegal) IN ANY CAPACITY WILL NOT ONLY RESULT IN IMMEDIATE REMOVAL FROM THIS SERVER, BUT ALL RELATED DETAILS AND INFORMATION WILL BE IMMEDIATELY TURNED OVER TO ALL APPLICABLE AUTHORITIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO U.S. AUTHORITIES.

Mastodon Party is operated by "Type2Media", a Minnesota (USA) entity, and is hosted on servers operated in the EU. All content on this server is expected to be legal in all of these jurisdictions. If you have any copyright, trademark, legal concerns, please email us directly.

DMCA Complaints: dmca@mythoughtprocess.info Trademark Complaints: trademark@mythoughtprocess.info Abuse Complaints: abuse@mythoughtprocess.info

Description:
Welcome to The Void

void.holdings is a small instance of friends, mostly based in San Francisco. This instance is invite-only for folks we know and their projects, and we never intend to grow much.

If you're interested in learning more about folks on the server, check out our directory and filter by "From void.holdings only": https://void.holdings/directory, or our local public timeline: https://void.holdings/public/local

Goals

  • Provide a space where a network of friends can share things silly, snarky, and serious, while opting-out of unwanted content and contact
  • Help show how community-oriented small-scale federated social media can help enrich existing connections and foster new ones
  • Support voidlings to make the fediverse more enjoyable, including through posting their creative work; making accounts for projects, RSS feeds, and bots; etc.
  • Get Cindy the Barfer the fediverse stardom she deserves
  • Celebrate at least three of the nine delights every day

Non-Goals

While void.holdings aims to be inclusive, itâ€™s important to understand what the void is not. The void is not:

  1. A â€œfree speechâ€ zone. If you would like to exercise your full free speech rights, you can do soÂ somewhere else; while on void.holdings, you should agree to follow the community rules set out in this CoC.
  2. Keeping things cordial. While we aim to ensure everyone has a harassment-free experience, it is not our goal to define or enforce civility, or to tone police. If there is conflict that does not qualify as harassment, we hope that folks can sort it out themselves or mute and block accounts as needed. (But, if you feel that something does qualify as harassment, be sure to send a moderation report!)
  3. Growing this instance beyond the size of an impressive house party

Code of Conduct

Here is where we lay out ground rules for participation in void.holdings (referred to as voidlings). We have tried to craft these policies to create a space that is safe for all community members, and to help make a process clear if and when conflict arises. Instance-wise, our goal is to have a place to hang out with friends, shitpost a bit, post pictures of dogs and birds, and, probably, gripe about local politics and hopefully do something product about it. This is a living document, and the void.holdings team will amend this document as necessary to ensure the safety of our users and health of our community.

This isÂ notÂ a legal document, which you may have begun to suspect, and our team will address gray areas as they arise. This document is primarily to provide insight into the values that drive both the instance and moderation decisions.

What action can I take?

You have tools to mute and block content and accounts, and report bad behavior. Instance moderators will help you by enforcing server policies to limit bad behavior (as defined in the section below). However, you have many options available to curate your own timeline:

  1. Mute accounts you donâ€™t want to see content from, but youâ€™re ok with them seeing yours.
  2. Block accounts you donâ€™t want to see you.
  3. Block instances that produce content you would rather not see.
  4. Report content that violates the server code of conduct.

Rules for all Posts

All posts (public and private) should abide by the following rules:

  1. Do not use slurs or racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist or otherwise discriminatory or hateful jokes or language or promote white supremacy, anti-Semitism, transphobia, casteism, or other hateful ideologies.
  2. Do not harass anyone, participate in group harassment of anyone, or otherwise engage in personal attacks. Posting or threatening to post other peopleâ€™s personally identifying information (â€œdoxingâ€) constitutes harassment. Continued contact after someone has requested that you stop contacting them does, too.
  3. Do not â€œshitpostâ€ hateful content â€“ while shitposting in general is encouraged, â€˜shitpostingâ€™ does not grant exceptions to rules (1, 3). There are no ironic slurs.
  4. Mark sensitive content with a warning. We encourage the use of content warnings (CW) and hashtags to identify material that some users may not want to see (for example,Â #squirrelballs). Use of CW or tags allows users to opt in or out of conversations they donâ€™t want. This does not mean all potentially uncomfortable content requires a content warning. Discussing lived experience or issues of identity do not require content warnings, though authors may choose to add them.
  5. Do not post illegal content. This includes unlicensed media. We will remove DMCA reports we receive. Legal NSFW content is allowed, but must be marked with a content warning.

Suggestions for Posts

Though we will not moderate against these items, we do suggest considering them when posting:

  1. Add descriptions to all images, audio, and video. Mastodon makes adding this information easy, and adding a description both helps folks who use assistive technology to understand what is being posted and lets you point out to everyone the most relevant information.
  2. Consider using the content warning field as a subject line, even when the topic of the post is not sensitive. Think of it like an email, where people can understand what theyâ€™ll be reading before they commit to the entire message. It also makes for good jokes.
  3. Consider using the unlisted or followers-only post types if you are posting a lot in a short period, or are just riffing on an idea. Public posts show up in the local and federated timelines but unlisted and followers-only do not.

Moderation

If you notice a post that violates this code of conduct, promptly click on the three dots at the bottom of the post and report it. When choosing â€œspamâ€ or â€œotherâ€ report reasons, please include a short description of why you are reporting the post.

If you believe something is not a good contribution to the community, but is not covered by our Code of Conduct, please report it with a comment about why you are reporting it. The moderation team will take appropriate action

When our moderators receive a report, we will investigate to understand the context of the account being reported and the interactions that led up to the report. If our team decides that the content goes against our code of conduct, we will take corrective action.

Participants asked to stop any bad behavior are expected to comply immediately. If the moderation team finds that a user repeatedly violates server rules, they may be suspended. Similarly, if an instance receives a lot of reports they may be defederated. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all void holdings spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other void holdings members or the general public.

Our current moderators are @christa, @jim, and @peter.

Winding Down Some Day

We plan on keep on running this as long as people use it. When the party is over some day and we decide to shut it down, we will give users at least 3 months of advance warning, and repeated reminders, in order to allow them to gracefully migrate accounts.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that a small group of void holdings administrators run. They promise that they won't look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust them on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up "federated" -- basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn't leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other void.holdings users, and only ever @ mention other void.holdings users. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off.Â Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server.Â This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This Code of Conduct was adapted from the sfba.social Code of Conduct, which as far as I can tell was adapted from the Fosstodon Code of Conduct. Iâ€™m not sure if either has an explicit license, but thank you to both instances for the format and a fair amount of the wording.

The Privacy Policy was adapted from the Friend Camp Privacy Policy by Darius Kazemi and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.
Short: for friends of the void

Description:
This server is special because the DRÎ›M team curates participants well-qualified to discuss and debate the near-future of technology and aesthetics.

Our organization's main site is at dram.org, and our group organizes an annual retreat for people to discuss similar issues in a live forum.

STANDARDS

We have particularly heavy moderation around fact-checking, especially for numeric or scientific claims.

DIVERSITY

Our foremost aim is to create a space for exploring innovation and progress, regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, or sexuality. We respect the privacy of participants and we do not ask how they self-identify. While we actively seek out variety, some category or another of persons may appear under-represented at any one time. We believe all people are as one, and the future is free of labels.

FOOTPRINT

We respect our shared environment, and we aim to minimize our impact in terms of energy consumption and waste production. We are sadly aware that electricity can cause carbon release. Mining r are minerals can destroy ecosystems, release toxic materials, and provoke political conflict. We are interested in learning cost-effective ways to conduct our events for net-positive impact on the biosphere.
Short: We are creators and entrepreneurs excited to explore how technology is altering our aesthetics, lifestyles, and the ways we do business. If you are a fellow enthusiast, join our community!

This instance is a safe space

This instance is actively moderated with the guiding principle of being a safe space for our users and for those that interact with them in the fediverse.

Prohibited content

The following content is prohibited on this instance. Posting any of this content on this instance will have consequences for the poster.

  • Sexual content of any kind involving children including artistic depictions

  • Graphic violence including artistic depictions

  • National socialism, facism and alt-right

  • Holocaust denial

  • Racism

  • Transmisia

  • Homomisia

  • Misogyny

  • Discrimination by sex, gender, disability or religion

  • Harassment

  • Promotion of any harmful behaviour

Federation

This instance suspends federation with any other instances that permit any of the prohibited content listed above, utilising and supporting FediBlock.

Masto.host

This instance is hosted by Masto.host. Their terms of service are reflected in these rules and inform our approach to moderation.

Description: Just my readings

What is a Mastodon decentralized network? Who can I talk to on legaltech.social?

Those who are familiar with Twitter might wonder why they have to select a Mastodon server or instance. Mastodon is a decentralized social network, with thousands of servers connecting together rather than one organization hosting it. A Mastodon server can operate as an independent social network. People can use this platform to sign up, post messages, upload photos, and communicate with one another - just like on a normal website. A Mastodon social network is different from traditional websites because its users can message or mention each other regardless of the platform they are on; like sending an email between Gmail, Outlook, Fastmail, or Protonmail as long as you have the address.

How to Get Started on Legaltech.social

Foremost, it's a digital community. This social network service contains no advertising, monitoring, or money-making initiatives. This is a place shaped by members who wanted to escape the rage-driven onslaught of trolls and misinformation that define social media. A place built around connection and respectful conversation. Want to learn more? Here's this massive list of resources related to the MastodonMigration.

Mastodon Server Covenantâ€¨

We do our best to follow the Mastodon Server Covenant which is a set of minimalistic guidelines to provide the best possible experience for our users. Account signups require manual approval to prevent bot and spam accounts. We attempt to review all signups within 24 hours.

Code of Conduct

Legaltech.social aims to be an informative community of marketers and attorneys, sharing insights and helping each other. We promote robust dialogue from all viewpoints, but want to cultivate a trusted instance for others to join. You are welcome to join!

Basic rules:

  • Be polite and kind. Don't be a jerk. Religious speech, hate speech, discrimination, and harassment of any kind is not tolerated on this server. we will moderate threats of violence, harassment, harmful disinformation, hate speech, and similar content.
  • Be respectful - even if you disagree.
  • No spam or commercial advertisements. This includes excessive commercial advertising, promotional campaigns, and negative SEO.
  • Mark sensitive content with a content warning.
  • No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users.

This server is intended for anyone who works in the field of law firm marketing. The primary instance language for this server is English.Â Play nicely and be respectful! And everything will be fine.

Best practices:â€¨

The list below is a collection of behavior expected from Legaltech.social users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and the moderators will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule. These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any userâ€™s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law. â€¨The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviors and type of content that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators, as described in the legaltech.online terms.

  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  • Timeline Flooding: Continuous posting of content or reposting of external content within a short time without intent of engaging in a conversation is not allowed.
  • Adult content (pornography)
  • Holocaust denial, Nazi symbolism, or conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Trolling, insulting and derogatory comments towards others using a legaltech.online account
  • Spreading falsehoods, alternative facts, anecdotal evidence, prejudice or bias towards a social group, inciting violence, circular reporting, shock-provoking content, conspiracy theories, dark patterns, deepfakes, disinformation, misinformation, sensationalism, truthiness, propaganda, rumors, hoaxes, urban myths, pseudoscience, post-truth and opinion pieces or interviews that convey any of the previous.
  • Threats of Physical violence against any person, animal or institution.
  • Posts in other languages than English.

In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Do not debate moderation actions in public posts. If you disagree with how a moderator enforced the rules you may direct-message the moderation team. The admin (@scott) is maintaining this Legaltech.online instance in his spare time, finances, and nerves. Please don't push any of those.

Reporting Violationsâ€¨

Please report behavior that bothers you. The moderators will keep your report confidential. Accounts found to be breaking the rules will be banned without a warning. The moderation team will always take a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if a problematic post isnâ€™t explicitly called out above, yet is inappropriate for Legaltech.social, the post will likely be removed, and the member will be dealt with appropriately.
Short: Legaltech.social aims to be an informative community of legal marketers and attorneys, sharing insights about SEO, SEM, SMM, Reputation Management, and lead generation strategies.

Description:
Wir haben folgende (nicht vollstÃ¤ndige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer LÃ¶schung von Toots und zu einer Blockierung von Accounts fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnen, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere tolerieren wir nicht:

  1. BelÃ¤stigung, Stalking, Doxxing
  2. Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren BefÃ¼rwortung
  3. Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten
  4. GewalttÃ¤tige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder FÃ¶rderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
  5. Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen
  6. Nicht markierter sexueller Inhalt, Gewaltdarstellungen oder Werbung
  7. Nicht getaggte oder automatisierte oder Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸige Werbung Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzer interagieren

Bitte melden Sie Verhalten, das Sie stÃ¶rt. Das schlieÃŸt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein.

Jeder Nutzerin und jedem Nutzer steht maximal ein Konto zu. Mehrfachanmeldungen sind nur mit schriftlicher Zustimmung von uns gestattet. (Bspw. zur Erstellung eines Projektkontos, oder zum Betreiben von Bots oder Zweitkonten).

Konten fÃ¼r kommerzielle Zwecke erfordern eine schriftliche Erlaubnis unsererseits.

Cross-Posting von Twitter ist hier nicht erwÃ¼nscht und kann deshalb von uns in der lokalen TL unterdrÃ¼ckt werden.

Wir behalten uns vor, Konten, die Ã¼ber 365 Tage keine AnmeldeaktivitÃ¤t aufweisen zu lÃ¶schen. Hierzu erhÃ¤lt jeder Account per Mail eine Einspruchsfrist von 30 Tagen. Nach diesen 30 Tagen wird der Account unwiderruflich gelÃ¶scht und kann dann nicht mehr reaktiviert werden. FÃ¼r einmal gelÃ¶schte Konten, kann weder der verwendete Account-Name, noch die zugehÃ¶rige Mailadresse auf dieser Instanz wieder verwendet werden.

Konten, die nicht per Mail bestÃ¤tigt werden, werden von uns gelÃ¶scht.

Wir behalten uns vor, der Nutzerin oder dem Nutzer die Lizenz zur Nutzung des Dienstes zeitweise oder dauerhaft, jederzeit und ohne Angaben von GrÃ¼nden zu entziehen. Ausgenommen davon sind gesetzliche Verpflichtungen und Bestimmungen.

This instance has no description.

The Media Economies Design Lab experiments with democratic ownership and governance in the online economy. It creates space for researchers and practitioners to challenge the conventional norms and explore possibilities offered by neglected histories and possible futures. Drawing on diverse fields such as cultural studies, law, management, media archaeology, organizational communication, and sociology, MEDLab holds space and time for better kinds of business.

Learn more at https://www.colorado.edu/lab/medlab/
Short: A home in the fediverse for the Media Economies Design Lab at the University of Colorado Boulder.

Description:
pics by ourselves.space, providing an open platform for sharing pics of friends and family. Welcome to ourselves.space, by The Doodle Project, LLC. The purpose of this system is to provide single user (or a few!) instance domain hosting for individuals and companies using shared infrastructure for a low monthly price. We also have open registration enabled for anyone who would like to register with the base 'ourselves.space' domain and does not come with a cost.

ourselves.space is well integrated with the fediverse and you will find a great community of like minded individuals in the local feed with strict moderation enforced (see Server Rules).

Come, be yourself on ourselves.space!
Short: pics by ourselves.space. A place to be ourselves.

Description:
The premier destination for the most pleasant odors in the federated network.

It is a means of exiting or avoiding the unpleasant odors emanating from the avian source.

I was a somewhat active user of Twitter from December 2008 until January 2023, but ultimately found that I was unable to fully enjoy the experience. Despite this, it is likely that I will continue to have some level of engagement on the platform.

Why this thing?

â€¢ Easy URL (and we all toot, amiright?!)
â€¢Â Federated with other servers who may have their own focus
â€¢Â Moderation that is controlled by the server operators
â€¢ Distributed

It is true that Mastodon can be likened to a modern iteration of IRC (Internet Relay Chat), as it utilizes a distributed network of servers that employ hub-and-spoke architecture to facilitate communication among clients. The ability to implement per-server moderation (such as banning) is a feature inherent in the architecture of IRC, and channel-level moderation can be managed by individual channel owners. In the case of Mastodon, while the platform does not have a specific channel-level moderation configuration, the administrator of a particular instance (referred to as the "site runner") has the capability to delegate moderation responsibilities to trusted users.
Short: Technology, education, social issues, whatever, just don't be a dick about it. Calm, political, discourse is just fine but see previous statement.

Description:
Join a thriving community of thinkers, creators, and dreamers on our Mastodon instance, hosted on a highly secure and reliable Kubernetes cluster. Our platform offers a user-friendly interface and is powered by cutting-edge technology, making it an ideal space for meaningful connections and self-expression.

We are committed to the development of our platform, always striving to improve and innovate. The team is based in Canada, bringing a unique perspective to the technology landscape and a commitment to privacy and security.

So why wait? Join us today and be a part of a supportive and inclusive community, where you can share your ideas, engage in meaningful conversations, and discover new perspectives. Embrace the power of technology and connect with like-minded individuals on our Mastodon instance.

Description: This is my private instance.

This is a family instance of a social media server using Mastodon is a private and self-hosted platform that provides a unique space for the members of a family to communicate, share memories, and connect with one another. This family instance of Mastodon offers the familiar features of social media, such as posting updates, photos, and videos, as well as the ability to follow and interact with other members of the family. This server provides privacy and security to the family members, ensuring that their personal information and conversations remain within the family by limiting the visibility of certain posts, and can also monitor the activity to ensure the platform remains a safe and positive environment for everyone.

In addition to connecting family members, the family instance of Mastodon can also be used as a shared repository of memories and family history. The members can create and share albums of family photos, post updates about important events, and keep a record of their family's story. This creates a unique digital legacy that future generations can access and enjoy.

Overall, the family instance of Mastodon provides a private and secure space for family members to communicate, share memories, and connect with one another. It offers the benefits of social media without the risks of public exposure and allows the family to control their own online environment.

Description:
Being an administrator, a moderator and a user on my own self-hosted Mastodon instance I have no privacy policy or terms of service I could effectively enforce on myself. However, I am fully aware that with great power comes great responsibility and I do not live in a vacuum. I acknowledge the existence and fully support Mastodon Server Covenant.

I run this instance in good faith within laws imposed on me by the country I live in, as well as terms and conditions of my service providers, including my web hosting provider, domain registrar and many others.

As a mature citizen of the internet community I abide by very simple rules: I know there's a human on the other side of the screen and I don't do things I wouldn't do to my grandma. I strongly support this old-fashioned notion of being excellent to each other.

This Mastodon instance is not a public service. All accounts hosted on this instance are 100% owned and moderated by me. I do not offer account registration to third parties. Should that ever change in the future I will convert this page into proper terms of service.

Bot accounts on this instance are clearly labelled. I strive to design and run them in a way they don't cause disruptions to other parties and I monitor their behavior.

I use content warnings and mark relevant media as sensitive if they contain NSFW content.

I do not support nor engage in hate speech, harassment, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia or other forms of discrimination.

I do not support nor engage in disinformation campaigns or conspiracy theories undermining public health.

If you notice any unexpected behavior that can be traced back to my instance and doesn't align with the standards I described above, please contact me directly. Thank you!

Description:
Code of Conduct

Note: "Beefus Camp" in this document refers to the Beefus Camp Mastodon instance at https://beefus.camp. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @david@beefus.camp.

Beefus Camp is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Beefus Camp spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia"
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Beefus Camp, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from Beefus Camp based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Beefus Camp spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Beefus Camp. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Beefus Camp spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Beefus Camp members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that David Sidlinger runs. He promises that he won't look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust him on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up "federated" -- basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn't leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other friend.camp users, and only ever use our "local-only" posting mode which you learned about in your onboarding. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off. Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server. This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This privacy policy was written wholly by David Sidlinger and provided under a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

This policy was 100% ripped-off from https://friend.camp/about
