Description:
Willkommen bei Noto.social! ğŸŒ´

Wir sind ein kleiner Knotenpunkt in einem riesigen, fÃ¶deralen sozialen Netzwerk namens Fediverse. Du kannst mit Millionen von Nutzern auf der ganzen Welt sprechen, verteilt auf Tausende von anderen Knotenpunkten und verschiedenen Systemen. Es ist ein bisschen wie E-Mail, aber fÃ¼r soziale Netzwerke.

Es gibt Plattformen fÃ¼r Microblogging, Blogging, Fotoblogging, Videohosting und vieles mehr, die alle miteinander vernetzt sind. Du brauchst also nur ein Konto, um Nutzern auf jeder der Plattformen zu folgen. FÃ¼r diejenigen, die mehr lesen mÃ¶chten, gibt es eine Website mit vielen Details, auch Ã¼ber die Software, die diesen Knotenpunkt betreibt.

Oder du springst einfach rein, schaust dich um - und richtest dir hoffentlich ein gemÃ¼tliches Zuhause ein. Viel SpaÃŸ! ğŸ¦¥

Wie lÃ¤uft das hier?

Noto.social versteht sich als Instanz fÃ¼r sichere Kommunikation unter zivilisierten Menschen. Wer sich hier anmeldet, wird vermutlich keine Arbeit bei der Moderation oder sonstwie Probleme verursachen. Du hast eine Meinung? Das ist gut, aber bitte beleidige niemanden bei deinen Ã„uÃŸerungen. Und falls es dir doch mal passiert, entschuldige dich aufrichtig. So schwer ist das doch nicht.

Dennoch gibt es einige Grundregeln und rote Linien, um die Dinge klar zu halten. Nicht nur fÃ¼r die Nutzer, sondern auch fÃ¼r andere, die sich diese Instanz ansehen. Soll niemand hinterher sagen kÃ¶nnen, er hÃ¤tte es vorher nicht gewusst.

Regeln

1. Diskriminierungen
Diskriminiere niemanden, verhalte dich nicht menschenfeindlich oder generell unangenehm anderen gegenÃ¼ber. Solches Verhalten umfasst unter anderem Verunglimpfungen, HerabwÃ¼rdigungen, das VerÃ¤chtlich- oder LÃ¤cherlichmachen und darÃ¼ber hinaus Aussagen, die Folgendes ausdrÃ¼cken:

  • gruppenbezogene Menschenfeindlichkeit im Allgemeinen
  • LGBTQIA+-Feindlichkeit
  • Rassismus
  • Antisemitismus
  • Ableismus
  • Misogynie

Sei im einfach kein Arsch, dann ist alles gut.

2. BelÃ¤stigungen
BelÃ¤stige andere nicht im Fediverse. Dies umfasst, ist aber nicht beschrÃ¤nkt auf:

  • Umgehung von Sperren von Benutzern, mit denen du interagiert hast, auf oder auÃŸerhalb des Servers, Ã¼ber Zweit-Accounts oder andere Mittel.
  • Drohungen
  • Erpressung
  • Leute dazu auffordern, sich selbst zu tÃ¶ten

3. Illegale Inhalte
Es versteht sich fast von selbst, aber verÃ¶ffentliche keine Inhalte, die in Deutschland illegal sind. Inhalte, die in Deutschland illegal sind, werden gelÃ¶scht und kÃ¶nnen zur sofortigen Sperrung des Kontos fÃ¼hren. Wenn du dir unsicher bist, ob dein nÃ¤chster Beitrag legal ist, ist er es hÃ¶chstwahrscheinlich nicht.

3a. Inhalte und Informationen Dritter
Respektiere die Rechte Dritter und verÃ¶ffentliche nur Inhalte deren Urheber du bist oder deren Lizenz eine Weiterverbreitung ausdrÃ¼cklich erlaubt. Die VerÃ¶ffentlichung persÃ¶nlicher Daten oder Adressen ("doxing") ist untersagt und wird zur Anzeige gebracht.

3b. Propaganda verfassungswidriger und terroristischer Organisationen
SÃ¤mtliche Inhalte verfassungswidriger oder terroristischer Organisationen sind untersagt und eine VerÃ¶ffentlichung wird zur Anzeige gebracht. Dies schlieÃŸt auch Organisationen mit ein, die nach aktuellem Stand nicht verboten sind, deren Positionen aber unter 1.) fallen.

3c. Rechtliche Grauzonen
Es gibt eine Reihe von Inhalten, die vielleicht nicht illegal sind oder wo die Rechtslage unklar ist, ich aber mindestens ablehne und deren Verbreitung auf keinen Fall fÃ¶rdern mÃ¶chte. Dazu zÃ¤hlen vor allem aber nicht nur: Falschinformationen, VerschwÃ¶rungsmythen, sexualisierte Darstellungen von MinderjÃ¤hrigen ("loli").

4. NSFW / 18+
Kennzeichne Bilder als sensibel, wenn du NSFW-Inhalte postest, insbesondere mit grausamen, sexuell anzÃ¼glichen oder expliziten Bildern. Falls du einen NSFW-only Account erstellen mÃ¶chtest, ziehe bitte eine andere Instanz in Betracht. Es gibt genug Instanzen, die dafÃ¼r besser geeignet sind.

5. Spam / Flooding
Kein Spammen oder Fluten mit Posts ("Flooding"), weder auf Timelines hier noch auf Timelines anderswo. Spamme einen Hashtag nicht mit Unsinn zu und Ã¼berschwemme einzelne Person nicht mit Antworten, um sie zu Ã¼bertÃ¶nen.

6. Automatisierte Postings
Crossposting von anderen Plattformen, Feed-Postings, Bots und Ã¤hnliche automatisierte Inhalt sind nicht so gerne gesehen. Auf Noto.social stehen die Menschen und ihre Kommunikation im Vordergrund. Wenn dein Account also Ã¼berwiegend aus automatisierten BeitrÃ¤gen bestehen soll, such dir bitte eine andere Instanz. Falls du dir unsicher bist, frag bitte vorher nach. Man kann ja Ã¼ber alles reden.

7. Werbung
Auch hier wieder der Hinweis auf Menschen und zwischenmenschliche Kommunikation als zentralem Aspekt von Noto.social. Unternehmensaccounts oder das dauerhafte Reposting solcher Accounts fÃ¼hrt zur Sperrung. Wenn du fÃ¼r ein Unternehmen werben mÃ¶chtest, gibt es sicher besser geeignete Instanzen. Oder du trÃ¤gst zum Fediverse bei und setzt selbst eine Instanz fÃ¼r deine Firma und ihre Mitarbeiter auf.

MaÃŸnahmen

Die Personen in Verantwortung, Moderatoren und Admins, sorgen fÃ¼r einen zivilisierten Umgang der Nutzer auf Noto.social. DafÃ¼r haben sie das Recht und die Verantwortung, BeitrÃ¤ge, Nachrichten, Kommentare zu entfernen, zu bearbeiten oder abzulehnen, die nicht mit den oben aufgefÃ¼hrten Regeln Ã¼bereinstimmen.

DarÃ¼ber hinaus haben sie das Recht, bestimmte MaÃŸnahmen zu ergreifen, wenn ein Mitglied der Noto.social Community andere Verhaltensweisen an den Tag legt, die sie fÃ¼r unangemessen, bedrohlich, beleidigend oder schÃ¤dlich halten. Beispiele fÃ¼r solche MaÃŸnahmen sind unter anderem:

  1. Entfernung oder EinschrÃ¤nkung der Sichtbarkeit von Inhalten, die auf Noto.social verÃ¶ffentlicht werden
  2. VorÃ¼bergehender oder dauerhafter Ausschluss aus Noto.social
  3. Ein vorÃ¼bergehendes oder dauerhaftes Verbot, sich in Zukunft ein Konto auf Noto.social zu registrieren
  4. Ein vorÃ¼bergehendes oder dauerhaftes Verbot der Teilnahme als Noto.social Moderator oder Admin

Durchsetzung

FÃ¤lle von beleidigendem, belÃ¤stigendem oder anderweitig inakzeptablem Verhalten kÃ¶nnen gemeldet werden durch:

  1. Verwendung des MenÃ¼punkts "Melden" auf jedem Beitrag oder Profil
  2. Kontaktaufnahme mit Noto.social Administratoren direkt Ã¼ber den Account @admin@noto.social
  3. Senden einer E-Mail an vinz (at) vinzv (dot) de

Alle Beschwerden werden so schnell wie mÃ¶glich geprÃ¼ft und untersucht und fÃ¼hren zu einer Antwort, die als notwendig und den UmstÃ¤nden angemessen erachtet wird. Die Noto.social Administratoren und Moderatoren sind verpflichtet, die Vertraulichkeit in Bezug auf den Reporter eines Vorfalls zu wahren. Weitere Einzelheiten zu spezifischen Durchsetzungsrichtlinien kÃ¶nnen separat verÃ¶ffentlicht werden.

Namensnennung

Diese Regeln basieren lose auf den Nutzungsbedingungen von floss.social, kowelenz.social, metalhead.social und akkoma.sandhill.social. Danke fÃ¼r die Inspiration!

Impressum

Vinzenz Vietzke
Thurgauerstr. 5A
86179 Augsburg
Deutschland
Telefon: +49 821 99959905
E-mail: vinz (at) vinzv (dot) de

Welcome to Noto.social! ğŸŒ´

We a are a small node inside the huge and federated social network called the Fediverse. You can talk to millions of users worldwide, distributed over thousands of other nodes and various different systems. It's a bit like e-mail but for social networking.

There are platforms for microblogging, blogging, photoblogging, videohosting and much more, which are all interconnected. So you only need one account to follow users on any of the platforms. For those of you who fancy reading more, there's a website with lots of details even on the software powering this node.

Or you could just jump in, look around - and hopefully make yourself a comfortable home. Enjoy! ğŸ¦¥

How do things work here?

Noto.social sees itself as an instance for safe communication among civilized people. Anyone who registers here is unlikely to cause any moderation work or other problems. You have an opinion? That's fine, but please don't offend anyone in your remarks. And if it does happen to you, apologize sincerely. It's not that difficult after all.

Nevertheless, there are some ground rules and red lines to keep things clear to keep things clear. Not only for the users, but also for others who look at view this instance. No one should be able to say afterwards that they had not known before.

Rules

1. Discriminations
Do not discriminate against anyone, do not behave misanthropic or generally unpleasant towards others. Such behavior includes, but is not limited to, slurs, disparagement, ridiculing or ridicule, and in addition, statements that express the following express the following:

  • Group-related enmity in general
  • LGBTQIA+ hostility
  • Racism
  • Antisemitism
  • Ableism
  • Misogynism

Just don't be a dick and everything will be fine.

2. Harassments
Do not harass others in Fediverse. This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Bypassing bans by users with whom you have interacted, on or off the server, via secondary accounts or other means.
  • Threats
  • Blackmailing
  • Ask people to put themselves off

3. Illegal Contents
It almost goes without saying, but do not publish content that is illegal in Germany. Content, illegal in Germany will be deleted and can lead to the immediate immediate account suspension. If you are in doubt as to whether your next post is legal, it most likely is not.

3a. Third party contents and information
Respect the rights of third parties and only publish content of which you are the author or of which the license explicitly allows redistribution. The publication of personal information or addresses ("doxing") is prohibited and will be reported to law enforcement.

3b. Propaganda of unconstitutional and terrorist organizations
All contents of unconstitutional or terrorist organizations are prohibited and any publication will be reported to local authorities. This also includes organizations that are not banned according to current are not banned, but whose views fall under 1.).

3c. Legal gray areas
There are a number of contents that may not be illegal or where the legal situation is unclear, but which I at least reject and whose dissemination I do not want to encourage under any circumstances. These include, but are not limited to: false information, conspiracy myths, sexualized depictions of minors ("loli").

4. NSFW / 18+
Flag images as sensitive when posting NSFW content, especially with cruel, sexually suggestive, or explicit images. If you want to create a NSFW-only account, please consider another instance. There are plenty of instances that are better suited for this.

5. Spam / Flooding
Do not spam or "flood" with posts, either on timelines here or on timelines elsewhere. Don't spam a hashtag with nonsense and don't flood individuals with replies to drown them out.

6. Automated postings
Crossposting from other platforms, feed postings, bots and similar automated content are not as welcome. On Noto.social, the focus is on people and their communication. So if you want your account to consist mostly of automated posts, please find another instance. If you are unsure, please ask first. After all, there's always room to discuss things.

7. Advertising
Again, referring to people and interpersonal communication as a central aspect of Noto.social. Corporate accounts or the permanent reposting of such accounts will lead to suspension. If you want to promote a company, there are certainly better suited instances. Or you can contribute to Fediverse and set up an instance yourself for your company and its employees.

Measures

The persons in charge, moderators and admins, ensure a civilized interaction of users on Noto.social. For this they have the right and responsibility to remove, edit or reject posts, messages, comments that do not comply with the rules listed above.

In addition, they have the right to take certain actions when a member of the Noto.social community engages in other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, abusive or harmful. Examples of such actions include, but are not limited to:

  1. Removal or restriction of the visibility of content that is published on Noto.social
  2. Temporary or permanent exclusion from Noto.social
  3. A temporary or permanent ban on registering an account on Noto.social in the future
  4. A temporary or permanent ban on participation as a Noto.social moderator or admin

Enforcement

Incidents of abusive, harassing or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by:

  1. Using the "Report" menu item on any post or profile
  2. Contact Noto.social administrators directly through the account @vinzv@noto.social
  3. Sending an e-mail to vinz (at) vinzv (dot) de

All complaints will be reviewed and investigated as soon as possible and will result in a response deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. Noto.social administrators and moderators are required to maintain confidentiality regarding the reporter of an incident. Further details on specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Attribution

These rules are loosely based on the terms of use of floss.social, kowelenz.social, metalhead.social, and akkoma.sandhill.social. Thanks for the inspiration!

Imprint

Vinzenz Vietzke
Thurgauerstr. 5A
86179 Augsburg
Germany
Phone: +49 821 99959905
E-mail: vinz (at) vinzv (dot) de

Report Handling Below are rough definitions as to how moderaters will handle reports and what actions will be taken when a user report is submitted. Of course every report will be investigated thoroughly and punishments may be more or less severe based on moderator findings.

User level: User Silence: Minor infractions, heated arguments, frivolous accusations, and centrist rhetoric will result in the user being silenced. Users may still follow and converse with users that are silenced but their toots will not be federated. User Suspension: Major infractions, multiple and consistent infractions, abuse, hate speech, illegal content, and right wing politics will result in a full suspension. Users will be unable to interact with suspended accounts and, if the account is based on the instance, the user will not be able to log in or post.

Instance level: Reject Media: Applied to any server that allows illegal content and illicit porn. Can be applied to a server regardless of federated, silenced, or suspended status. Domain Silence: Reserved for instances whose politics are in violation of guideline 3. Currently consists mostly of Libertarian instances and gnu.social instances that have federated. Domain Suspension: Any domain that harbours hate speech, encourages the sharing of illegal content, or where admins have been unwilling to punish users violating guidelines 1 and 2 will be given a full suspension and will no longer be able to federate with our instance.

Description:
This Mastodon server is primarily intended for healthcare professionals in nephrology (kidney medicine). The server is located in Germany.

Impressum (German)

PD Dr. med. Daniel Kraus
c/o UniversitÃ¤tsmedizin Mainz
Langenbeckstr. 1
55131 Mainz
Tel. (0 61 31) 17-68 39
d.kraus@uni-mainz

neph.social ist ein privat betriebener Mastodon-Server und vÃ¶llig unabhÃ¤ngig von Unimedizin und UniversitÃ¤t Mainz.

"Warum brauchen wir denn das?"

Niemand "braucht" diesen Server, um bei Mastodon mitzumachen. Mastodon ist bekanntermaÃŸen ein dezentrales Netzwerk. Man muss sich jedoch einen "Heimatserver" aussuchen, auf dem der eigene Mastodon-Account angelegt wird.

Um allen an Nephrologie Interessierten ein Mastodon-"Zuhause" zu bieten, wird dieser Server (neph.social) betrieben. Das hilft vielleicht auch dabei, Gleichgesinnte zu finden, die ihren Account ebenfalls auf neph.socal haben.

"Aber ist denn das vertrauenswÃ¼rdig?"

Dieser Server wird von mir, PD Dr. Daniel Kraus, finanziert und betrieben. Ich stelle unter anderem folgende andere Angebote im Internet bereit:

  • https://www.xltoolbox.net -- seit 2008 (zunÃ¤chst unter anderer Internetadresse)
  • Zwei Klinik-interne Wiki-Systeme -- seit 2011 und 2019
  • https://www.ggap-ev.org -- Homepage des gemeinnÃ¼tzigen Entwicklungshilfe-Vereins Gemeinsam gegen Armut auf den Philippinen (GGAP) e.V. -- seit 2015

Ich bin Oberarzt an der UniversitÃ¤tsmedizin Mainz. neph.social ist aber mein privates Projekt und hat mit der Unimedizin nichts zu tun.

Obwohl ich nunmehr seit 15 Jahren zuverlÃ¤ssig Web-Angebote betreibe, kann ich nicht garantieren, dass neph.social unter allen UmstÃ¤nden immer existieren wird. Aber angesichts meiner bisherigen Historie ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit hoch, dass es neph.social langfristig geben wird.

"Ich bleibe aber lieber bei X, Y oder Z!"

Gerne. Wer jedoch von X, Y oder Z genug hat und sich nach einer nicht-kommerziellen Alternative umsieht, kann als nephrologisch interessierte Person gerne zu neph.social kommen.

"FlieÃŸen meine Daten ins Ausland?"

Der Server, auf dem neph.social lÃ¤uft, ist von einer deutschen Firma gemietet und steht in Deutschland. Mastodon ist ein dezentrales, internationales Netzwerk. Was Sie auf neph.social schreiben, kann also auf Servern irgendwo auf der Welt angezeigt werden. Ihr Account bei neph.social liegt aber auf dem deutschen Server und bleibt dort.
Short: A Mastodon server for nephrologists & friends, run by a nephrologist from Germany.

Description:
md.muyactual.com es una comunidad de la red social Mastodon, abierta a cualquier persona cuyo idioma principal sea el espaÃ±ol y quiera compartir temas de ciencia y tecnologÃ­a.

El objetivo de md.muyactual.com es facilitar la interacciÃ³n con otros hispanohablantes en Mastodon en un ambiente amable y seguro. El equipo de moderaciÃ³n velarÃ¡ siempre por el cumplimiento de las normas para lograrlo, pero tambiÃ©n se ruega la colaboraciÃ³n de los miembros.

Recomendaciones

Pulsa para mostrar El equipo de md.muyactual.com ofrece las siguientes recomendaciones (que no reglas) a la hora de interactuar con personas en esta u otras redes sociales.

SÃ© amable con los demÃ¡s.

Recuerda que al otro lado de la pantalla hay una persona como tÃº, con sentimientos.

Piensa antes de criticar.

Una crÃ­tica mal encajada puede arruinarle la vida a una persona. Si vas a criticar, empieza elogiando los aspectos positivos.

Evita las discusiones inÃºtiles.

Por regla general, no convencerÃ¡s a nadie en Internet. Tu energÃ­a estarÃ¡ mejor invertida en tareas mÃ¡s productivas.

InterÃ©sate sinceramente por los demÃ¡s.

Una red social no es "social" si sÃ³lo venimos a hablar de nosotros mismos. Muestra interÃ©s por los demÃ¡s y recibirÃ¡s interÃ©s de vuelta.

Reglas detalladas

Pulsa para mostrar Las siguientes reglas son de obligado cumplimiento para las personas registradas en md.muyactual.com. El incumplimiento de una regla resultarÃ¡ en un aviso que podrÃ¡ convertirse en una expulsiÃ³n si no se corrige el comportamiento. En casos de discurso de odio la expulsiÃ³n podrÃ­a ser inmediata, sin aviso previo.

Prohibidos discursos de odio

Se considera discurso de odio a cualquier acciÃ³n comunicativa que tiene como objetivo promover y alimentar una opiniÃ³n dogmÃ¡tica y destructiva hacia personas por motivos raciales, Ã©tnicos, religiosos, de origen nacional, de orientaciÃ³n o identidad sexual, de discapacidad, etc.

Prohibido el "SPAM" y limitaciones al "crossposting"

Los siguientes comportamientos son considerados SPAM en este servidor:
- PublicaciÃ³n repetida de enlaces externos (especialmente a otras redes sociales)
- Excesiva promociÃ³n de productos o servicios.
- Comenzar a publicar enlaces o archivos multimedia sin presentarse ni rellenar el perfil.
- Publicar con demasiada frecuencia, especialmente archivos multimedia.
- Publicar sin seguir ni interactuar con nadie.

El "crossposting" (publicaciÃ³n desde otras plataformas) estÃ¡ permitido, pero con limitaciones. Para evitar ser considerado SPAM, sÃ³lo debe usarse para compartir publicaciones propias, y no podrÃ¡ contener enlaces al sitio original (por lo que no se pueden compartir, por ejemplo, los RTs o citas de esa otra red social). AdemÃ¡s, las cuentas de miembros con crossposting activado que no interactÃºen con nadie serÃ¡n eliminadas.

Respeta la legalidad espaÃ±ola

Ya que el paÃ­s del propietario es EspaÃ±a, se espera de los miembros cumplan con la legalidad de esta paÃ­s.

El idioma principal de la cuenta debe ser el espaÃ±ol, pero tambiÃ©n se pueden usar otros

La idea de esta comunidad es promover la interacciÃ³n con otros hispanohablantes. No obstante, entendemos la necesidad de comunicarse tambiÃ©n en otros idiomas (especialmente en inglÃ©s y lenguas regionales de paÃ­ses hispanoparlantes), asÃ­ que tambiÃ©n puede usar md.muyactual.com para publicar en otros idiomas, siempre que no publique Ãºnicamente en idiomas distintos al espaÃ±ol.

Si quieren crear una cuenta para publicar Ãºnicamente o mayormente en otro idioma les recomendamos que escojan otra comunidad en instances.social

Esta regla solo aplica a publicaciones con visibilidad pÃºblica.

Cuentas no personales pidan permiso para usar la red

md.muyactual.com ofrece sus servicios gratuitamente a personas individuales, costeando los servicios a base de donaciones o directamente del bolsillo del propietario. Si quiere utilizar md.muyactual.com para una cuenta no personal (como una organizaciÃ³n o empresa, con o sin Ã¡nimo de lucro) debe contactar con el administrador para pedir permiso (le llegarÃ¡ un mensaje de bienvenida al registrarse).

Si querÃ©is alojar una cuenta bot en md.muyactual.com, podÃ©is esperar las siguientes condiciones:

- Que publiquen con visibilidad "no listada" para no saturar nuestra lÃ­nea pÃºblica.
- Que activen la eliminaciÃ³n automÃ¡tica entre 1 y 3 meses para hacer un uso responsable de los recursos del servidor.
- (En caso de interactuar con el usuario) Que respeten la etiqueta #nobot en el perfil.
- Y por supuesto, que respeten las otras reglas.

No insulte, ofenda ni moleste a otros usuarios.

Esta es una regla de convivencia bÃ¡sica, que se incluye en caso de que sea necesario tomar medidas contra un usuario problemÃ¡tico. No obstante, los usuarios tienen a su disposiciÃ³n herramientas para bloquear y silenciar, y recomendamos usarlas en lugar de reportar al usuario.

Esta regla tambiÃ©n limita la tÃ©cnica del "joseo". La tÃ©cnica del "joseo" consiste en parafrasear una publicaciÃ³n ajena, modificando ligeramente su contenido o citando un autor distinto, a modo de parodia.

El "joseo", aunque no tenga Ã¡nimo de ofender, puede ser realmente molesto para personas que no estÃ©n familiarizadas con Ã©l. Se pide a los miembros que sÃ³lo usen el "joseo" con personas con las que tengan confianza o con consentimiento previo.

Prohibido contenido sexual (salvo arte no pornogrÃ¡fico)

Con arte pornogrÃ¡fico nos referimos a aquel que tenga como fin la excitaciÃ³n sexual (ejemplo: ecchi / hentai ) y no la expresiÃ³n artÃ­stica (ejemplo: la maja desnuda).

Esta regla no aplica a lo que publiquÃ©is con visibilidad privada o sÃ³lo para cuentas mencionadas, sÃ³lo aplica a lo que publiquÃ©is con visibilidad pÃºblica o no listada.

Evite compartir intencionadamente informaciÃ³n falsa considerada nociva para la sociedad

Catalogamos "informaciÃ³n nociva" EXCLUSIVAMENTE informaciÃ³n que:

- Niegue el holocausto.
- Ponga en riesgo la salud de las personas (y sÃ­, esto incluye anti-vacunas y negacionistas).
- Niegue el cambio climÃ¡tico.
- Justifique el terrorismo de estado.

Lo que no estÃ© en la lista anterior no serÃ¡ objeto de censura (aunque la lista podrÃ­a ampliarse si surge la necesidad). Las cuentas serÃ¡n advertidas si publican informaciÃ³n de este tipo una vez, y suspendidas en caso de que la cuenta se dedique mayormente a la difusiÃ³n de informaciÃ³n nociva.


Servidor

Pulsa para mostrar Este servidor de Mastodon es gratuito para todos sus usuarios.

En caso de cierre de servidor por falta de fondos u otra razÃ³n, se anunciarÃ¡ con 3 meses de antelaciÃ³n para que los miembros puedan planificar la mudanza de sus cuentas

Hay siempre una persona con acceso de emergencia a la infraestructura del servidor por si sucede alguna incidencia

Por seguridad, se hace una copia de seguridad diariamente segÃºn se indica en: docs.joinmastodon.org/admin/backups/


PolÃ­tica de servidores silenciados/bloqueados

Pulsa para mostrar Se silenciarÃ¡ a otros servidores que por SPAM, cuentas automatizadas o contenido inapropiado dificulten la discusiÃ³n.

Se bloquearÃ¡ tambiÃ©n a los servidores que reproduzcan cuentas y contenidos de Twitter. La razÃ³n para bloquear todos menos uno es para evitar estar almacenando contenido duplicado y para asegurarnos que el servidor que usan nuestros usuarios es el que mejor funciona.

No bloquearemos nunca otro tipo de servidores - salvo en casos de acoso dirigido desde uno o varios servidores en concreto. En su lugar, se recomienda a los miembros que usen las herramientas a su disposiciÃ³n, con las que pueden silenciar y bloquear individualmente servidores y usuarios sin nuestra intervenciÃ³n.

Poyo! This is a small server dedicated to the Kirby fandom. We are using masto [dot] host to run this (hopefully) cozy place for those interested the the pink puffball.

This server is operated by someone in the UK, and such is 18+ to join. It is, however, "SFW", or more accurately, forbids explicit content.

It is anti-harassment, and has rules in place to protect people. We welcome other servers related to this fandom to set up rules to protect the people closest to them, provided they don't attempt harrassment towarsd the "out-group"

In an emergency relating to this server, please speak to the owner, @SnowBug, or one of the admins. You may contact SnowBug at https://mastodon.gamedev.place/@Gh0stVX if I appear to be unreachable here.

Domain blocks are hidden to avoid advertising harmful content. We currently have set up the FediNuke blocklist from https://pleroma.envs.net/users/Seirdy and will go through the reciepts for the tier 0 and tier 1 blocklists as they become available.
Short: Poyo! This is a small server dedicated to the Kirby fandom. We are using masto [dot] host to run this (hopefully) cozy place for those interested the the pink puffball.

Description:
A small server for friends. We are left wing, generally queer, and mostly based in the north of England.

Rules will be enforced; friends need to be accountable. If you find anything on this server that is harmful or goes against the spirit of the fediverse, please report it to an admin so we can address it.

The server is intended to be small. We will have a minimum of 1 moderator per 5 users. Moderators will be responsible for actioning reports and checking the fediblock tag at least once per week.

Once we have more members a yearly AGM will be held to decide on our priorities and elect positions.
Short: A small server for friends. We are left wing and generally queer.

Description:
Named after a folk melody medley I wrote years ago, the Crossroads Inn is a small instance based around the idea of a cosy multifunctional building from where it's possible to go in every direction.

I've considered setting up my own Mastodon instance since joining in 2022, but decided to try a few already-established instances first. The Fediverse is, well, diverse, but it is also rather specific and sprawling; that's the nature of the beast. I say "specific" because most instances have a theme, either set up that way or developed by the user base through the local timeline. And because it's sprawling, it's sometimes hard to know what exactly is out there and might be a good fit. The instances where I felt most at home were more general in nature, yet I often felt I was too specific. It just didn't really fit for me. Cue The Crossroads Inn.

I do not want to categorically state that this instance will remain closed to people interested in making it their Fediverse home, but currently it can only support a handful of active users. If I do decide to open it up for others, I'll have to consider what is reasonable for me to manage, both in terms of moderation and costs. For now, I'll be happy to hear from you (preferably via DM) if you're interested, but I cannot make any promises.

With love, Cassana

Concerning moderation

Although The Crossroads Inn is a very small instance, it still feels essential to lay out a fundamental framework for what is not tolerated; not only for legal reasons, but as a general guideline. However, this will not be phrased in the usual way, e.g., no racism, ablism, homophobia, transphobia, etc., though these things are, of course, implied in the following statement, which is meant to encapsulate more terms than can be enumerated.

Users on this instance are kindly requested to consider what they post about, and how it is presented. Sharing opinions and critique is a natural part of human discourse, yet should be understood as not being fixed. Opinions and critique, especially including hierarchical value judgements or when presented as facts or absolutes, is where problems arise, and where we must draw a clear line. This includes outright statements that alienate or devalue individuals and groups, or comparisons designating inferiority or superiority based on innately unquantifiable factors, e.g., ethnicity, appearance, aesthetic/lifestyle choices, assumed aptitudes/capabilities, etc.

Diversity is Encouraged

MastoMo aims to provide a positive, safer environment not only everyone in its community but also those who interact with us, regardless of:

age

body size

caste

disability

ethnicity

gender identity and expression

level of experience

education

socio-economic status

nationality

personal appearance

race

religion (or lack thereof)

sexual identity and orientation

tribe
Short: General Mastodon Server. A safe space.

Description:
Rules Â¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Best practices Â¶

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("â€¦@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Resources Â¶

I occasionally post on my own blog.

@oliver is maintaining this instance on his spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.

Attribution Â¶

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.

Description:
Full Code of Conduct

mstdn.tacowolf.net is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all mstdn.tacowolf.net spaces, including Mastodon and any organizational spaces defined by mstdn.tacowolf.net staff, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the mstdn.tacowolf.net administrators and moderation team.

Some mstdn.tacowolf.net spaces may have additional rules in place, which will be made clearly available to participants. Participants are responsible for knowing and abiding by these rules.

Definitions of Harassment

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of 'dead' or rejected names.
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate.
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Stalking or following.
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention.
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication.

mstdn.tacowolf.net prioritizes marginalized people's safety over privileged people's comfort. mstdn.tacowolf.net administrators and moderation team reserves the right not to act on complaints regarding:

  • 'Reverse' -isms, including 'reverse racism,' 'reverse sexism,' and 'cisphobia'
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a 'tone' you don't find congenial
  • Criticizing racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Members of Law Enforcement

mstdn.tacowolf.net as a space is primarily inhabited by minority communities who are frequently and have historically been the victims of violence, harassment and unfair treatment by members of law enforcement, military personelle and their allies and affiliates.

As such, Access to this service or its content by members of law enforcement (or military personelle or their allies or affiliates) is strictly forbidden.

This includes (but is not limited to): Law Enforcement Officers / Police Officers / Peace Officers, The FBI, CIA, or NSA, The US Military (inclusive of all branches), Active Military Personelle, and any organization or individual affiliated with any of the above.

Your Account

Accounts on mstdn.tacowolf.net are expected to be created with the intention of interacting with the community in some way. We will suspend user accounts which do not demonstrate good faith efforts to do so within a week of account creation. This process will be expedited for accounts which do not appear to be organic (as in, created directly by a sentient intelligence), or were created from points of origin registered to non-consumer-serving commercial entities. Content Warnings and Sensitive Images

Content Warnings (CWs) are a feature of Mastodon that enable you to hide the body of a "toot" (post) behind a line of text. The intended use of this feature is to provide a way to discuss sensitive and/or potentially harmful topics without causing duress or harm to anyone who might stumble upon it, though it may be used for many other things.

Images can be marked as sensitive; this is a feature which hides an image until a warning banner is clicked. Images may be marked as sensitive separately from Content Warnings, though using a Content Warning automatically marks the toot's images as sensitive.

Clearly communicated and accurately labeled content warnings and sensitive image settings are required when having public conversations involving any of the following topics or content:

  • Sexual or Adult content
  • Detailed descriptions of harassment as outlined above in the definitions of harassment
  • Political Commentary of any kind
  • Drugs or Drug Use
  • Advertisements for Corporations
  • "Rage" toots and Toots using exclusively capital letters
  • Excessively Long Toots (longer than ~20 lines)

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of mstdn.tacowolf.net, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the mstdn.tacowolf.net administrators and moderation team using the Report User/Toot feature or via email to taco directly at takouhai@proton.me. If the person who is harassing you is on the team, they will recuse themselves from handling your incident. We will respond as promptly as we can.

This code of conduct applies to mstdn.tacowolf.net spaces, but if you are being harassed by a member of mstdn.tacowolf.net outside our spaces, we still want to know about it. We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by mstdn.tacowolf.net members, especially mstdn.tacowolf.net's administrators and moderation team, seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The abuse team reserves the right to exclude people from mstdn.tacowolf.net based on their past behavior, including behavior outside mstdn.tacowolf.net spaces and behavior towards people who are not in mstdn.tacowolf.net.

In order to protect volunteers from abuse and burnout, we reserve the right to reject any report we believe to have been made in bad faith. Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we've received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of mstdn.tacowolf.net members or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, mstdn.tacowolf.net administrators and moderation team may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all mstdn.tacowolf.net spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other mstdn.tacowolf.net members or the general public.

Participants (or parties interacting with participants) who violate the code outlined above will be warned where applicable. When a warning does not result in adequate correction within a reasonable timeframe (or in cases where moderation deems a warning unwarranted) the offender will be suspended from the instance. Staff

This instance is administered by the site owner, @taco. This CoC document is based off of plush.city's, which is based off of the Geek Feminism Wiki example policy.

This instance uses Blobfox, Neofox, and Neocat emojis by Volpeon. Neofox and Neocat are CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.
Short: taco's cool fediverse server for awesome people

Description:
Welcome to Karakun.social

Karakun.social is the Mastodon instance of Karakun. We use our own instance to be independent with regard to its availability, administration and moderation.

There is only one user account running on karakun.social. We use @karakun@karakun.social to post news about us, about the software developer community and other relevant information.

Nevertheless, we applied a few rules for postings:

  • Whenever we post content, we take care of the rights of individuals. We, e.g., neither capture nor post pictures or videos without explicit consent.
  • We have zero tolerance when it comes to racism, discrimination and mobbing.
  • We treat others with respect.

At Karakun, we are convinced that an open and actively practiced feedback culture is vital for every company. If there is anything you'd like to discuss with us about karakun.social, feel free to write us an email.
Short: Karakun.social is the Mastodon instance of Karakun AG.

Description:
Welcome to Mastodonts

Mastodonts is operated and maintained by Mastohost - https://masto.host/

Mastodon Server Covenant

While this instance is relatively new, we do intend to keep it running long-term and it follow the Server Covenant as outlined at joinmastodon.org/covenant.

  • We agree to active moderation against (by not limited to): racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia

  • We agree to daily backups to ensure your data is safe

  • We have backup administrators ready to operate this server in emergencies or unexpected absence

  • In the unlikely event this instance shuts down, we agree to give our users a 3 month period to migrate to another instance

Description:
This is a private, invite-only mastodon instance funded by members of the giftedmc.com community. Our goal is it to enable neurodivergent individuals to organize and have a good time together. We do not tolerate bigotry and any form of -isms.

You don't have to be neurodivergent or play minecraft to join the community. You can join our matrix space or our discord server. Members of either of these spaces will get invites for this mastodon instance at some point.

Right now only supporters test this instance. To become a supporter, visit https://patreon.com/haui111

veoh.social

This is a small server focused on Connecticut and the Hartford area. We post about local happenings, interests, and whatever else is interesting to the nutmegger. Signups are closed right now but I plan to open them as soon as all the moderation stuff is set up!

This server exists because I loved the idea of nutmeg.social but unfortunately the admin has been awol for some time, and in the meantime I want to make sure there is somewhere actively maintained for connecticut users. I still support nutmeg.social and you should too, and hopefully both servers can grow together into the future!

Hosted by masto.host

"What is veoh?"

VEO or VEOH is a common graffiti tag seen around Hartford and beyond, see https://realhartford.org for more.

DMCA policy

This Digital Millennium Copyright Act policy (â€œPolicyâ€) applies to the veoh.social website (â€œWebsiteâ€ or â€œServiceâ€) and any of its related products and services (collectively, â€œServicesâ€) and outlines how this Website operator (â€œOperatorâ€, â€œweâ€, â€œusâ€ or â€œourâ€) addresses copyright infringement notifications and how you (â€œyouâ€ or â€œyourâ€) may submit a copyright infringement complaint.

Protection of intellectual property is of utmost importance to us and we ask our users and their authorized agents to do the same. It is our policy to expeditiously respond to clear notifications of alleged copyright infringement that comply with the United States Digital Millennium Copyright Act (â€œDMCAâ€) of 1998, the text of which can be found at the U.S. Copyright Office website. This DMCA policy has been created with the help of the DMCA policy generator. Table of contents

  1. What to consider before submitting a copyright complaint
  2. Notifications of infringement
  3. Counter-notifications
  4. Changes and amendments
  5. Reporting copyright infringement

What to consider before submitting a copyright complaint

Before submitting a copyright complaint to us, consider whether the use could be considered fair use. Fair use states that brief excerpts of copyrighted material may, under certain circumstances, be quoted verbatim for purposes such as criticism, news reporting, teaching, and research, without the need for permission from or payment to the copyright holder. If you have considered fair use, and you still wish to continue with a copyright complaint, you may want to first reach out to the user in question to see if you can resolve the matter directly with the user.

Please note that if you are unsure whether the material you are reporting is in fact infringing, you may wish to contact an attorney before filing a notification with us.

We may, at our discretion or as required by law, share a copy of your notification or counter-notification with third parties. This may include sharing the information with the account holder engaged in the allegedly infringing activity or for publication. If you are concerned about your information being forwarded, you may wish to hire an agent to report infringing material for you.

Notifications of infringement

If you are a copyright owner or an agent thereof, and you believe that any material available on our Services infringes your copyrights, then you may submit a written copyright infringement notification (â€œNotificationâ€) using the contact details below pursuant to the DMCA. All such Notifications must comply with the DMCA requirements. You may refer to a DMCA takedown notice generator or other similar services to avoid making mistake and ensure compliance of your Notification.

Filing a DMCA complaint is the start of a pre-defined legal process. Your complaint will be reviewed for accuracy, validity, and completeness. If your complaint has satisfied these requirements, our response may include the removal or restriction of access to allegedly infringing material as well as a permanent termination of repeat infringersâ€™ accounts. A backup of the terminated accountâ€™s data may be requested, however, we may not be able to provide you with one and, as such, you are strongly encouraged to take your own backups.

If we remove or restrict access to materials or terminate an account in response to a Notification of alleged infringement, we will make a good faith effort to contact the affected user with information concerning the removal or restriction of access, which may include a full copy of your Notification (including your name, address, phone, and email address), along with instructions for filing a counter-notification.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any portion of this Policy, the Operator reserves the right to take no action upon receipt of a DMCA copyright infringement notification if it fails to comply with all the requirements of the DMCA for such notifications.

Counter-notifications

A user who receives a copyright infringement Notification may make a counter-Notification pursuant to sections 512(g)(2) and (3) of the US Copyright Act. If you receive a copyright infringement Notification, it means that the material described in the Notification has been removed from our Services or access to the material has been restricted. Please take the time to read through the Notification, which includes information on the Notification we received. To file a counter-notification with us, you must provide a written communication compliant with the DMCA requirements.

Please note that if you are not sure whether certain material infringes the copyrights of others or that the material or activity was removed or restricted by mistake or misidentification, you may wish to contact an attorney before filing a counter-notification.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any portion of this Policy, the Operator reserves the right to take no action upon receipt of a counter-notification. If we receive a counter-notification that complies with the terms of 17 U.S.C. Â§ 512(g), we may forward it to the person who filed the original Notification.

Changes and amendments

We reserve the right to modify this Policy or its terms related to the Website and Services at any time at our discretion. When we do, we will revise the updated date at the bottom of this page. We may also provide notice to you in other ways at our discretion, such as through the contact information you have provided.

An updated version of this Policy will be effective immediately upon the posting of the revised Policy unless otherwise specified. Your continued use of the Website and Services after the effective date of the revised Policy (or such other act specified at that time) will constitute your consent to those changes.

Description:
As well as being a Mastodon instance, Crinstam Camp is both a real place and a fictional one.

The real part is where Tom and Nicole live, off grid, in northern Ontario with their two dogs, Luna and Gracie.

The fictional part is about where we will be when we find the appropriate property to buy.

We welcome anyone who isn't right wing or anarchist, who needs a place to park a tiny home, trailer, RV or van in order to live off grid.

Our instance is only for people who live here, or who have supported us with financial or other material help.

Please read the rules as we simply will not tolerate people who break them.

If you meet someone from our instance who you feel has violated our rules, please screenshot it and send us an email

We will block instances that allow hateful content or scientific/medical misinformation.
Short: A public server for members of Crinstam Camp

Description:
Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Description:
Imprint

Daniel Wenzlik
Amberger Str. 26a
91217 Hersbruck (Germany)

Mail: hello (at) selfhostedsocial.com

Rules explained

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • We do not tolerate advertising, exceptions are free open source applications and after consultation with our moderators.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Description:
Hello!

This is the official nzyme Fediverse/Mastodon server. We use this server for our official accounts and outside registrations are not possible.

Accounts

There are several accounts you can subscribe to on this server:

  • nzyme
    • The main account with all relevant updates.
    • This is the one you probably want to follow.
    • Medium frequency, a few posts a day.
    • No cringe retweets of random industry news to generate traffic or other unrelated posts.
    • #noCringeZone
  • releases
    • Notifications about nzyme releases and milestones on GitHub
    • Low frequency. Only sends a post for a new release or a newly created milestone on GitHub.
  • issues
    • Live feed of any new issues created in the nzyme GitHub repository.
    • Medium frequency. Can come in bursts during planning phases.
    • Includes staff and community issues.
  • commits
    • All nzyme commits pushed to GitHub
    • High frequency. Can come in bursts.
    • If you really want to!

Note that all accounts also provide an RSS feed. Just add .rss to the end of the profile URL.

Want more accounts with other information? Please suggest your ideas to nzyme.
Short: The Fediverse presence of the free and open nzyme - Network Defense System project.

Description:
Welcome to UGGStadon, where tech meets cozy comfort in the most unexpected way!

Our story began with a quest for the unattainableâ€”a short domain name that wasn't already snatched up by every Tom, Dick, and Harry in the virtual universe. After what seemed like an eternity of brainstorming and a series of increasingly bizarre domain name combinations, inspiration struck in the most mundane of moments. There, in the entrance of our home, my wife, the unwitting muse, was wriggling into her comfy UGG boots. And just like that, UGGStadon was bornâ€”a place where snug meets tech.

UGGStadon is more than just a Mastodon server; it's a haven for friends, nerds, IT gurus, and everyone who appreciates a good laugh along with their byte-sized discussions. Our server is like that pair of UGG bootsâ€”unassumingly stylish, ridiculously comfortable, and always there to keep your digital toes warm.

Here, youâ€™ll find a community as diverse as the different models of UGG boots. Whether you're a Fedora fan, a Debian devotee, or someone who just accidentally Googled their way here while searching for actual UGG boots, youâ€™re welcome! Weâ€™re like the all-inclusive resort of the tech worldâ€”minus the overpriced drinks and sunburn.

UGGStadon is managed with a blend of professionalism and a dash of whimsy. Our admins are as friendly as they are tech-savvy, answering your queries with the enthusiasm of a kid in a candy store. And our members? Well, they're the heart and sole (pun intended) of this community. From heated debates about the best Linux distributions to sharing the latest tech gags, there's never a dull moment.

So, whether youâ€™re here to discuss the intricacies of server management, debate the merits of various programming languages, or just want to hang out and share a laugh or two, youâ€™ve found your tribe. We promise to keep the server running as smoothly as your favorite pair of worn-in UGGs.

In summary, UGGStadon is where the warmth of a friendly community meets the thrill of tech talk. Itâ€™s a place where you can be yourself, whether you're a geek, a tech whiz, or just someone who appreciates a good pair of boots.

Boot up, log in, and let the fun begin at UGGStadon â€“ where every day is a 'comfortable fit'!
Short: UGGStadon: Where tech enthusiasts & friends unite in a cozy, quirky online haven. Inspired by UGGs, built for connection!

1) Intended to follow @north@fosstodon.org (and you should)

2) Clicked the ã†².com link on Wikipedia: single-letter second-level domain.

Description: Akkoma: The cooler fediverse server

Our Mission

To reduce the overpopulation of feral cats in our community and to provide fresh food, water, shelter, and medical care were necessary. Working with dedicated caretakers through a â€œtrap / spay / neuter / vaccination / returnâ€ program to help homeless cats live happier, healthier lives.

About Us

We started Feral Today Friend Tomorrow because we saw a cat that that was lost, alone, and hungry. Now 2 years later, she told all of her friends and we now care for a community. In addition to caring for the community we provide medical care, TNVR, food, fresh water, and adoptions to those cats and kittens who are able to transition to a new lifestyle.
Short: A small server run by the Feral Today Friend Tomorrow non-profit

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

About

Run by youtaite who are sick of dealing with the "Big Company" BS.

You get more control over your privacy and ownership of your data, but this is not run out of several international datacenters, so it might not be as fast or have the same service guarantees.

Moderation

Moderation is done by volunteers. Please include helpful context that can help in decisions. The goal is to be transparent and more reasonable than the mass automated systems used by large companies.

For now, the system will be 3 warnings, then 3 strikes before a ban.

If you wish to appeal moderation action, reach out to moderation@youtaite.xyz
Short: An instance for the Youtaite community. Based around making song covers of music made with Vocaloids casually or in competitions called "Chorus Battles"

Was ist freie-radios.org?

Diese Mastodon-Instanz ist - verwandt mit freie-radios.net - eine Kommunikations-Plattform Freier Radios. Die Sender kÃ¶nnen hier Ã¼ber einen weiteren Kanal kommunizieren und nicht zuletzt ihre Podcasts im Fediverse verÃ¶ffentlichen.

Kann unser Radio hier auch einen Zugang haben?

Ihr seid Mitglied in einem Verband Freier Radios? Habt einen Zugang bei freie-radios.net? Dann ist's ganz einfach, schaut mal bei den Serverregeln.
Short: Diese mastodon-Instanz wird im Kontext des Bundesverbands Freier Radios (BFR) in Deutschland betrieben. Hier finden sich Mitgliedsradios des BFR, aber auch andere nichtkommerzielle Radio-Projekte.

Description:
English:

Welcome to my personal Mastodon instance â€“ a unique, close-knit community space. Here, we don't practice authoritarian control over which instances are deemed 'evil.' However, we're serious about our server rules and will block instances that violate them. No preventive detention, though!

To join our community, you should ideally:

  • Know me personally,
  • Be a family member,
  • Share the same surname (a nominal fee of 1â‚¬/month applies),
  • Or be a close friend.

Here, we share and discuss a variety of topics, including vegan food, metal music, web development and technology, cycling adventures, and insights from my business trips. Join us for engaging, diverse conversations!

Deutsch:

Willkommen auf meiner persÃ¶nlichen Mastodon-Instanz â€“ einem einzigartigen und sicheren Familienspace. Wir praktizieren hier keine autoritÃ¤re Kontrolle darÃ¼ber, welche Instanzen als 'bÃ¶se' gelten. Allerdings nehmen wir unsere Serverregeln ernst und werden Instanzen blockieren, die dagegen verstoÃŸen. Es gibt aber keine PrÃ¤ventivhaft!

Um unserer Gemeinschaft beizutreten, solltest du idealerweise:

  • Mich persÃ¶nlich kennen,
  • Ein Familienmitglied sein,
  • Den gleichen Nachnamen haben (hierbei fÃ¤llt eine symbolische GebÃ¼hr von 1â‚¬/Monat an),
  • Oder ein enger Freund sein.

Hier teilen und diskutieren wir Ã¼ber eine Vielzahl von Themen, darunter veganes Essen, Metal-Musik, Webentwicklung und Technik, Fahrradabenteuer und Einblicke in meine GeschÃ¤ftsreisen. SchlieÃŸ dich uns fÃ¼r spannende, vielfÃ¤ltige GesprÃ¤che an!

Of course, The Fediverse is a massive place - you may want multiple homes, and that is perfectly okay too!
Short: BitForged Social is the Mastodon instance for The BitForged Network, a variety of services under the administration of @russjr08 and @myth.

Description:
Welcome to OnlyFinland's Mastodon server! This is a social network aimed at Finnish content creators and people interested in Finland.

The goal is to bring all content related to Finland into one location where people can discuss and share their thoughts in a friendly environment.

If you like the premise, you are more than welcome to join and start contributing to this community!

Also, if you would like to learn more about Finland, you can check out my website: OnlyFinland.com. There, you can stay up-to-date on everything Finland and maybe get some inspiration for your next post here.
Short: Mastodon server for Finnish content creators and people who love Finland.
This is me sharing stuff with my friends! If you're my friend, sign into an account somewhere in the fediverse, and send me a follow request to @yourstruly@social.thilo.app.
